loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is married to Judy, and together they have two children who both attend school. He own a retail kiosk, and has been in this business for the past 10 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 80,000 from the business.

This is his first loan from KADET. He will this loan to purchase cereals, cooking oil, and soap .

Benard will use his anticipated profit to install electricity in his home. His dream is to expand his kiosk to sell goods wholesale in order to increase his income so that he can fully meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase cereals, cooking oil, and soap.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, es agricultor, aprendió de su padre el oficio del cultivo, además atienden la venta de verduras y su esposa prepara tortillas para vender, son una familia trabajadora, se esfuerzan por tener todo en el hogar.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, como abono y herbicidas, para aplicarlos a la siembra de maíz, este préstamo le ayudara para tener lo necesario así que su trabajo pueda tener la producción abundante de maíz.
El objetivo de Marcos es apoyar a su familia, gozar de buena salud para trabajar todos los días y juntos poderse superar.
texts.en:
Marcos lives with his wife and three children.  He is a farmer - a trade he learned from his father.  He also sells vegetables and his wife prepares tortillas to sell.  They are a hard-working family who work hard in order to have everything their household needs.

Marcos is currently requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and herbicides to apply to his corn crop.  This loan will help him to have what he needs in order to enjoy an abundant production of corn.

Marcos' goal is to support his family, to enjoy good health so that he can work every day, and to make progress together with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides for his crops

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael está aplicando a su segundo credikiva, porque quiere comprar bebidas y refrescos fríos para su venta, pues se prepara para fin de año época en el cual repuntan sus ventas. Su anterior credikiva lo invirtió en 30 cajas de cervezas  y 8 de poni Malta, las cuales vendió, reinvirtió y aplico nuevas utilidades a su bienestar y al de su familia. De los financiadores Rafael dice “Gracias a ellos he podido hacer crecer mi negocio y que ha podido mejorar la calidad de vida de él y la de su familia. También expresa que gracias al trabajo en el negocio, se siente una persona útil a su familia y a la sociedad.”
texts.en: Rafael is applying for his second Kiva loan because he wants to buy soft drinks and other beverages to sell. He is getting ready for the end of the year, when he sales increase. His previous Kiva loan was invested in 30 cases of beer and 8 cases of Poni Malta. He sold these, reinvested and used the new profit for his wellbeing and his family's. When speaking of the financiers, Rafael says: "Thanks to them I have been able to make my business grow and been able to improve my own quality of life and my family's." He also expresses that thanks to his work in the business, he feels like a useful person to his family and society.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and other beverages to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva, de 50 años, esposa de Simeón, juntos viven en su casa propia en compañía de sus 03 hijos a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Hace 05 años que Eva, empezó a vender salchipollo en un stand movil sanguchero, en la cual todas las tardes se va al ovalo de su ciudad para expender a sus asiduos clientes o de aquellos que pasan por la calle. Eva es una mujer humilde y amable con sus clientes, la gente que va a comer su rico salchipollo salen satisfechos por la buena atención que les brinda. Lo que más le gusta es dejar contentos a sus clientes y considera que lo más difícil es tener que estar parada atendiendo hasta altas horas de la noche. Con el crédito solicitado, podrá comprar productos para la preparación de su plato como: papa, pollo, especias. Así dejará satisfechos a sus clientes. Este será su primer préstamo con MFP y agradece la oportunidad que le brindan. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, podrá comprar productos para la preparación de su plato como: papa, pollo y especias.
texts.en:
Eva, 50, is the wife of Simeón.  They live together in their own house with their three children, whom they want to offer a better quality of life.  Five years ago, Eva began selling fried chicken from a sandwich stall.  Every afternoon, she moves about her city to serve her eager customers or those who see her in the street.  Eva is sincere and friendly with her clients.  People who eat her delicious chicken leave satisfied with how well she takes care of them. She really enjoys making her clients happy, but the hardest part for her is to have to stay parked, serving customers until late into the night.

This loan will enable her to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare her dish, such as potatoes, chicken, and spices, so she can satisfy the demands of her customers.  This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, chicken, and spices for her food stall.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a married man with five children, four of whom attend school, while one is still too young for school. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. His major dream is to expand the business as a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES (Kenya shillings) he wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. Julius decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: El Portal Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “El Portal” está conformado por 15 emprendedores, quienes se desempeñan en diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran pastelería, rotisería, venta de ropa, venta de joyas y perfumería. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Concepción.
Elisa integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en primera fila, ocupando el segundo puesto de izquierda a derecha, usa su cabello corto y viste una polera estampada de color verde y blanco.
Ella se dedica a la chocolatería desde hace 15 años, comenta que comenzó como un hobby y después se convirtió en el negocio que tiene. Después se perfeccionó en un curso que se impartió en la ciudad de Concepción.
Ella produce los chocolates en su misma casa y posteriormente los distribuye a sus clientes, quienes hacen sus pedidos. Elisa produce de manera artesanal y para esto cuenta con la implementación necesaria.
Ella aprovecha todas las temporadas de fiestas y celebraciones durante el año. Entre semana santa, día del niño, madre, padre, cumpleaños, navidad, entre otras fechas.
Comenta que con el tiempo se ha hecho de un gran número de clientes, ya que también trabaja a pedido para colegios.
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras y confiterías. 
Con el crédito comprará chocolate en cantidad, para preparar sus productos. Además de moldes y coberturas.
Una de sus metas a largo plazo es instalarse con un local establecido.
Elisa vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad, ambos asisten al colegio.
Sus sueños son incrementar su producción y ventas, para recibir mejores ingresos y esto le permita una estabilidad económica al igual que una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad y apoyo que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Biobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called El Portal and is made up of 15 entrepreneurs who work in different areas, including making pastry, roasting chickens, clothing sales, jewelry sales, and perfume shop.  All are in the city of Concepción.  Elisa, a member of the communal bank, is the second from the left in the first row in the photo; she has short hair and is wearing a t-shirt with a green and white pattern.

Elisa has worked making chocolate for 15 years.  She says it began as a hobby and then became her business.  Later she perfected herself in a course that was given in the city of Concepción.  She makes the chocolates in her own house and later distributes them to her customers, who order them.  Elisa works in an artisanal fashion and has the necessary tools for this.

She takes advantage of all the holiday seasons and celebrations throughout the year, between Holy Week, Day of the Child, Mother's Day, Father's Day, birthdays, and Christmas, among other days.  She comments that over time she has acquired a large number of customers because she also works on request for schools.  She buys her merchandise from distributors and in candy shops.

With the loan she will buy lots of chocolate to prepare her products, as well as molds and icings.  

One of her long-term goals is to set herself up in an established location.

She lives with her husband and two children, ages 8 and 5, both of whom attend school.  Her dreams are to increase her production and sales and to receive better income, which will give her better economic stability as well as a better quality of life for her family.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity and support that Fondo Esperanza has given her to invest in her business.

Concepción is located at the mouth of the Biobío River, one of the largest rivers in the country, in the south of Chile in the Biobío region.  It has had an important role in our history, being the site of important battles and a notable settlement, especially during the Arauco War, because it is on the border of Mapuche territory.  Currently the city has important economic and demographic development and is coming to be considered one of the most notable urban, demographic, administrative, financial, and commercial centers of Chile, after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: to buy chocolate, molds, and icings

loans.name: Paula Andrea

texts.es: Paula Andrea es una madre soltera cabeza de familia, que gracias a su empuje ha podido sacar adelante a sus tres hijos. Con 36 años de edad, Paula Andrea actualmente se encuentra trabajando en su puesto de comidas, actividad a la que debió recurrir desde que se quedó sin empleo y debía generar los ingresos necesarios para sostener a su familia. Paula Andrea se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y siempre se ha esforzado por brindarles a sus tres hijos la mejor educación posible. Sueña con que su negocio crezca, con pasar de su carrito de comidas a una gran cafetería y dejarles así una estabilidad económica a sus hijos. Como en su negocio ha aumentado la variedad de productos que le ofrece a sus clientes, Paula Andrea requiere de la compra de insumos para su negocio como servilletas, vasos desechables, entre otros.
texts.en: Paula Andrea is a single mother who is head of her family.  Thanks to her effort she has been able to improve the lives of her three children.  Paula Andrea, 36, is currently working in her food stall-a business that she has had since she lost her job and needed to generate income to support her family.  Paula Andra is a very hardworking woman and she always makes the effort to offer her children the best education possible.  She dreams that her business will grow and she could go from a food cart to a big cafeteria and leave her children in good economic circumstances.  Since her business has increased with the variety of products that she sells to her customers, Paula Andrea needs to buy supplies such as napkins, disposable cups, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Sebastian Ivan

texts.es: Sebastian de 49 años  vive en  (paraíso Guayaquil ). El empezo  ese negocio de ser carpintero con su padre siendo oficial ahora el se desempeña en ser maestro de carpintería . también en su tiempo libre cuando el cree necesario es taxista asi teiene dinero adicinal. Con muchas ganas y dedicacio trabaja todos los días. a futuro el desea tener un buen negocio y tener en buena salud a su familia. Con el préstamo comprara herramientas y algunas telas y maquina de coser para ayudarle con herramientas a su esposa en el negocio.
texts.en: Sebastian, 49, lives in Paraíso, Guayaquil.  He started the carpentry business with his father who was an officer.  Now he works as a master carpenter.  When he deems it necessary he also works as a taxi driver.  He works every day with much dedication and effort.  In the future he'd like to have a good business and have his family in good health.  He will use the loan to buy tools, as well as some cloths and a sewing machine to help his wife with her business.

loans.use: to purchase tools and some cloth and a sewing machine to help with his wife's business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 22-year-old woman, persevering, and very focused on her goals and dreams.
Gladys is an amazing woman who is a smallholder farmer based in Lessos village in the Nandi Hills, Kenya. Gladys is seeking a loan to stock her cereals business. She plans to use the money to purchase and transport cereals in bulk to far markets, where she will sell at prices high enough to cater for all the expenses incurred plus profit. She is confident that she will be able to repay the loan in time because she is hard-working and financially disciplined.

Returns from the investment will change her life, as she will use the additional income to raise her family's living standards and pay for her children's education.

Her positive attitude and her hopes of getting ahead show that Gladys has an immense desire to better herself and of course, a desire to receive a favorable response to her loan request.
Support her during this festive season!

loans.use: to purchase cereals.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Kitale is a remote town in the Rift valley area of Kenya where most of the villagers suffer from poverty and malnutrition. Beatrice is a smallholder farmer who has been practicing farming on a small inherited piece of land for the past six years. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in other small personal businesses. 

The Kitale area has a high demand for cereal products. Like many farmers from her region, Beatrice finds cereal selling very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about cereal selling is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks the funds to increase her cereal business, so she is seeking a loan of 65,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy cereals for resale. Being from a marginalized community, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging. However, through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy cereal. With the loan, she will be able to provide more cereals to the local market. This will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her cereal business to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income will be used in fully repaying the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.
This smallholder farmer is looking for a little support to accomplish big things, and with this loan you can help him reach her goals.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Gérard Kouassi

texts.en:
Mr. Gerard Kouassi A. is 44 years old & lives in Agbanakin in the Lake District of Togo. He is head of a family of more than six. He makes his money principally from traditional farming techniques which he does with simple tools such as hoes and scythes. The size of his plot and the number of persons he cares for require him to expand and modernize in order to increase profitability. At present this is nearly impossible with the scant resources he has received over the last 15 years. He is asking for a loan of $1000 which will allow him to acquire young sugar cane stalks, to buy new tools (boots, wheelbarrow, and a canoe which will enable him to better access his land.

Agé de 44 ans et domicilié à Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs, Monsieur A. Gérard Kouassi est un père de famille ayant plus de six (06) personnes en charge. Il tire principalement son revenu de l’agriculture traditionnelle qu’il pratique avec des outils rudimentaires comme la houe et le coupe-coupe. La taille de son ménage et le nombre de personnes qu’il a en charge exigent de lui la nécessiter d’agrandir et de moderniser son exploitation en vue d’une meilleure rentabilité. Ceci est quasi-impossible avec le faible revenu qu’il tire de son activité depuis 15 ans. Ainsi, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui peut lui permettre d’acquérir de jeunes plans de cannes à sucre, d’acheter des matériels de travail : bottes, pousse-pousse et une pirogue. Ceci fera de lui le leader incontesté de la localité.

loans.use: Acquisition of young sugar cane plants & purchase of working material.

loans.name: Lady

texts.en:
Mrs T. is married with two children. She has been in this business for one and a half years. She sells food and goods used in the home, such as soap, matches, oil, dairy products, and cereal. She grateful to have a store in her home that facilitates her to sell goods without having to pay big costs, such as the cost to carry out goods. This type of business from home helps her to take care of her children by working from home without going around to sell her goods .

With the loan of $200, she can count on adding more cereal to her merchandise line. With the remaining money, she will buy others things like soap, milk, and oil.

Mrs T. is one of the HELP Africa beneficiary groups called, “Fezirewe.” The three women of this group are asking for a loan of $200 each. The total amount for the group is $600.

loans.use: Augment inventory

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.en: Tojiniso has been selling different kinds of fabric for ten years. She is married and has one daughter. Her husband is her business partner, and he is responsible for trips to the wholesale market. Their little shop is located in the big central Panjshanbe market. They sell different kinds of cotton fabrics. The turnover of their business is fast. They have one seller. In the future Tojiniso and her husband plan to rent two places for trade from Avganbazaar, which located in the district of Khujand. Additionally they want to employ two sellers for those trade places.

loans.use: Business developing

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: A dedicated client of LAPO who is happy with her business, Janet E. is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. She hails from Benin City in Edo State. She has been in this business since 1987 and hopes to buy more provisions and drinks with the loan.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & drinks for sale

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: H. Vagif is 54 years old. He is a refugee from the Gubadi region, which is in the Azerbaijan - Armenia conflict territory in the West of Azerbaijan. He is a farmer who started his business in 1992, when he purchased 5 sheep with money he had saved up. The work is interesting, but it is time-consuming and it takes a lot of effort. At the same time, the salary is not enough to cover all of the family expenses. In 2005 Vagif borrowed $500 to add to his own savings of $3000 and purchased another six sheep. Since January 2006, prices have doubled and Vagif has applied for a loan of $600 from Normicro to purchase five sheep for meat production and expanded his business, increasing his income considerably. Vagif would like to receive $800 loan in order to acquire 2 small bulls and feed for them. He will repay the loan within 16 months. In the future he hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: to acquire 2 small bulls and feed for them

loans.name: Yayah

texts.en:
Yayah is 43 years old and lives with her youngest child, aged 11. Her other children are married and live separately from her. Yayah has a small stall where she sells some snacks, household goods and other items. She can earn up to $6 per day. Her husband, S., is a driver who earns $12 per week.

Yayah needs more capital to grow her business. She requests IDR 500,000 ($75 USD) to buy more goods to fill her stall. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Haneefa's Group

texts.en:
I am a widow, Haneefa D., and I have lived all my life in a small town - Raiwind, Pakistan. I live with my two boys and one girl. One boy has a vegetable business and we also rent a piece of land on contract and plant vegetables in it. Now, we need a loan to take another piece of land on contract and hence increase our income. This is a very profitable business.

I have a few other group members who wish to get loans and help them solve their economic problems. My group members are Parveen B., who needs a loan for their cloth business; Samina R., who intends to invest the loan in their stitching business; Rani B. requires a loan for their vegetables business. We all are responsible for each other's loans.

loans.use: Take a piece of land on contract to raise vegetables

loans.name: Resmi

texts.id:
Resmi purchases basic ingredients like chicken Rp 20.000,00/kilogram (USD2 for 2.2lb) and Lele Rp 8.000,00/kilogram (less than USD1 for 2.2lb), each 20 kg (44lbs) per day at the Badung market. While at the same time for spices she spends funding of Rp 100.000,00/week (about USD11). Her medium of transportation is a motorcycle. While for selling her goods she used large baskets. Income she earned from this activity is Rp 200.000,00/week (USD22). Profit from this activity she use to supplement her husband’s earnings to pay for their children’s education Rp 200.000,00 (about USD22)/month.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Resmi membeli bahan baku berupa ayam Rp 20.000,00/kg dan Lele Rp 8.000,00/kg masing –masing 20 kg per hari di Pasar Badung. Sedangkan untuk bumbu – bumbunya dia mengeluarkan modal Rp 100.000,00/ minggu. Sarana transportasinya sepeda motor. Sedangkan untuk berjualan ia menggunakan rombong. Dari usaha ini keuntungan yang ia peroleh mencapai Rp 200.000,00/minggu. Hasil usahanya ini ia gunakan untuk membantu suaminya salah satunya membiayai pendidikan anaknya Rp 200.000,00/bulan.

loans.use: Purchase chicken, flour, eggs, oil, and others (Membeli ayam hidup, tepung, telur, minyak, dan lain lain.)

loans.name: Bakery A(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jane N.. She is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Jane is 32 years old and is married She has five children ranging from age 14 to 20 and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business to snack selling.

Jane is joined in her small group by Esther N., Harriet N., Midius K., and Jamila N.. Esther N. has a business selling matooke and wants to expand to bulk selling. Harriet N. is currently operating a business in food cooking and wants a loan to purchase more raw food and ingredients. Midius K. operates a restaurant business and wants to add capital. Jamila N. is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To expand restaurant business and make more profits

loans.name: Riad

texts.en: Riad is 44 years old and lives with his family in the town of Tyre in southern Lebanon. He has three children and makes a living as a barber. This is the fourth time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He will use this newest loan to pay the rent on his shop.

loans.use: to pay the rent on his barber shop

loans.name: Hadija's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Hadija is 45-years-old and is married with two children, ages 28 and 25. Hadija is a tailor and also sells snacks. she began her businesses in 2001. Hadija earns a monthly profit of approximately $40.

She is requesting a loan to purchase additional tailoring items and wheat flour for her business. She will share this loan with her group members, Mwatima, Zainabu,Pili, Zainab, and Zakia, who have businesses dealing in firewood, fish, mayai, snacks, juice and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring items and  wheat flour

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru:
Jumagul N. lives with her family in the Rudaki area. She owns a private cafeteria in Dushanbe. Because the place has become a little bit dirty it requires repairs. This is why Jumagul has decided to take out a loan. The loan will help her to improve working conditions and service quality. This will allow her to attract new customers and to increase her profits. She plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Неъматова Джумагшуль живет со своей семьей в районе Рудаки. Имеет частную стололвую в городе Душанбе. В связи стем , что помещение немного испачкалось его необходимо отремонтировать. Для этого Джумагуль решила получить кредит. Он поможет ей улучшить условия работы , а так же качество обслуживания. Это даст ей возможность привлеч новых клиентов и получать прибыль больше чем прежде. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Building Repairs

loans.name: Fatíma Francisco

texts.pt:
Fatíma Francisco L. is 37 years old. She is a single mother and has a 12-year-old son that is on the 7th grade. Besides her son, she also supports her mother and grandmother. They do not live with her so she has to send them money and, sometimes, food. Fatima went to school up to 11th grade and she had to drop out becasue of her first pregnancy. She was born in Boane and, lived in the district of Namaacha and, when she was fleeing the war, she also lived in the city of Maputo, completing the 6th and 7th grade there. She lives with her aunt while her home is under construction. Fatima has been working as a care-giver for the past two years and she has a renewable and pre-determined labor contract. Her daily shift is from 8:00am to 3:30pm. Fatima learned this skill at ADDP (African Disability Decade Programme). Her monthly salary is 4000,00mt and she is able to save 1000,00mt from that. This is Fatima's second loan request from Hluvuku -- she has never requested it from another instituition. With this loan Fatima will buy construction materials to speed up the conclusion of her home. The house would take much longer to be completed if her salary alone had to sponsor it. Her future plan is to improve her housing conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Fatíma Francisco L. tem 37 anos de idade e é solteira mae de um filho de 12 anos que estuda na 7ªClasse, para além do filho sustenta a mae dela e sua Avó e esta dua não mora com elas na mesma casa só manda dinheiro e as vezes produtos alimentares. Fatima estudou até 11ª classe e deixou por causa da gravidez do seu primeiro filho, ela nasceu em Boane e viveu algum tempo no distrito de Namaacha e tambem na cidade de maputo quando fugia da Guerra onde fez a 6 ª e 7 ª Classe, vive numa casa da tia e tem a sua casa más ainda em construção. Fatima trabalha com animadora a dois anos e tem um vinculo laboral determinado e renovavel e tem um horario de trabalho das 8:00h as 15:30h. Fatima aprendeu o trabalho na ADDP. Tem salario mensal de 4000,00mt e poupa deste 1000,00mt por mes. Este é o segundo emprestimo da Fatima na Hluvuku e nunca teve noutras instituições. Com este empréstimo Fatima vai comprar material de construção e para ela vai acelerar a conclusão da obra melhor que se estivesse a Construir pouco aos poucos na base do salário. Tem como planos futuros melhorar cada vez mais as condições habitacionais.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Petra

texts.es:
Petra is a widow, and she started her business to stay active. She started a notions store to help herself economically since her pension is minimal. She started 5 years ago selling notions such as ribbons, buttons, needles, etc, and little by little she started selling other products, mainly those for babies, which is what she does currently.

She needs a loan of $275, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase merchandise. With your support, Petra will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Petra es viuda e inició el negocio para mantenerse activa, instalo una mercería para ayudarse económicamente ya que mi pensión es mínima. Comenzó hace 5 años vendiendo productos de mercería como listones, botones, ahujas etc. y poco a poco fue vendiendo otros productos principalmente para bebe y es a lo que se dedica actualmente.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $275 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía, con tu apoyo Petra saldrá delante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Judith Mumba's Green Tomalin Group

texts.en:
Judith M. is 35 and married. She has three children, ages 17, 13, and 4. She owns a salon in Mbezi but also makes house calls for her customers. She opened her salon two years ago and works from 8 am to 9 pm daily. Her monthly profit from the salon is about $43. To supplement this income, she also sells traditional Swahili dress called kangas, which increases her monthly income to $130.

Judith has received three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania that she used to increase the stock in her salon. She has paid back all three loans successfully. Similarly to the others, she intends to use this new loan to increase her stock of kangas and buy more products for her salon.

Judith is part of subgroup D of Green Tomalin. The other members of her subgroup sell clothes, hardware, and groceries. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Judith is wearing a black and white striped shirt.

loans.use: To increase stock of kangas and salon products.

loans.name: Filiberta

texts.es:
Filiberta inicio el negocio para ayudar a su marido con el gasto familiar. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 7años y con los ahorros que tenia, resultante de ventas que hacia por catalogo, decidió poner una mini-tienda en una habitación de su casa y con el apoyo de los micro créditos ha hecho crecer su tienda lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar más mercancía en su negocio. Con tu ayuda saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Filiberta started her own business in order to help her husband with the family expenses. She began approximately 7 years ago with the savings that she obtained as a result of her catalog sales. She decided to set up a mini market in her home. With the support of these micro loans, she has been able to make her store grow, which has allowed her to help her children get ahead in life.

She needs a loan of $950.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can purchase more merchandise for her business. With your help, she will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Magda Juana

texts.es:
Magda es natural del distrito de Macusani, provincia de Carabaya, Puno, nació el 06 de Mayo de 1977, estudió segundo grado de primaria, es conviviente y madre de 3 hijos menores de edad (dos mujeres de 8 y 6 años  y un varón de 07 meses de edad). Vive en el distrito de Conduriri, Provincia El Collao, Puno, y es una nueva integrante del Banco Comunal de “Maria Parado de Bellido” en Conduriri.

Con este crédito de S/.300, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas comprará 05 paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes marcas con S/.70, 06 cajas de galletas con S/.150.00 y 04 bolsas de chupetines con S/.40.00, los cuales serán comercializados diariamente en la plaza de Conduriri. Paralelo a este negocio ella se dedica ha tejer, es socia de “Artesanía nuevo Amanecer”, convenio con el Corredor Puno – Cuzco. Desde hace dos años les llega pedidos de la ciudades de Cuzco y Lima.

Su sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Magda is originally from the District of Macusani in the province of Carabaya in Puno. She was born on May 6, 1997 and she went to school up to grade 2. She is married common law and she has 3 children who are still minors (two are girls, aged 8 and 6 years, and the boy is 7 months old). She currently lives in the District of Conduiri in the province of El Collao in Puno. She is a new member of the Community Bank "Maria Parado de Bellido" in Conduiri.

With this loan amounting to S/.300, which will be repaid in a term of 3 months, she will purchase 5 cases of soft drinks of different brands for S/.70, 6 cases of cookies for S/.150, and 4 bags of candy suckers for S/.40. The products will be sold daily at the plaza in Conduiri. In parallel to this business she also spends her time knitting. She is a member of the gruop "Artesania Nuevo Amanecer" in Corredor Puno in Cuzco. For the past 2 year she has been taking orders in the city of Cuzco and Lima.

Her dream is to purchase a house in the city of Ilave, and for her children to go to school.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, cookies, and candy.

loans.name: Christy Owari

texts.en: Thirty-three-year-old Christy is a fashion designer who also sells clothes and tailoring materials. Christy has two sewing machines. She is a LAPO client. She is married and has 3 children ranging in age from 7 years to 7 months. Christy lives in Ijaniki, Lagos state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for the past 2  years. Christy is asking for a loan of N120,000 ($1025) to purchase clothes and tailoring materials. She is happy because the festive season is fast approaching, and the demand for her tailoring skills will be high. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and tailoring supplies

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en: Roxana is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Village Bank; “Sumaq Huayta” means “Beautiful Flower” in Quechua. Roxana is 32 years old and lives with her partner and their son. Roxana has a store in her home, where she sells dry goods. She also sells meals and provides lodging for employees of a transportation company. Roxana needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy rice, sugar and milk. Roxana dreams of improving her business and expanding by offering a wider variety of merchandise. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Roxana es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Linda Flor. Roxana es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo, Roxana tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, además Roxana vende comida y da pensión a los trabajadores de una empresa de transporte. Roxana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche. Roxana sueña con mejorar su negocio y ampliar con mas productos.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar and milk

loans.name: Moulikatou

texts.fr: H. Moulikatou est née le 5 mai 1965. Elle est veuve et elle a deux enfants,  Fathyiath a 17 ans et Ashadou a 15 ans. Ils ont tous scolarisés. Elle a commencé sa commerce avec la vente des condiments comme la tomate fraiche, le piment, et les légumes. Actuellement elle vend les fruits comme les oranges, les mangues, l’ananas, et les bananes. Avec le crédit elle va acheter les fruits a Tokpa. Les autres crédits de Kiva lui a permis d’arrêter d’acheter a crédit, et de payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Dans le futur, elle voudrait développer votre activité par acheter en gros et aussi vendre en gros.
texts.en:
Moulikatou H. was born on May 5, 1965. She's a widow and has two school-attending children, Fathyiath (age 17) and Ashadou (age 15). She started her business selling condiments, such as fresh tomatoes, chili pepper, and vegetables. Today, she sells fruits such as oranges, mangoes, pineapples, and bananas. With this loan, she will go buy fruits in Tokpa. The former Kiva loans enabled her to buy supplies, and to pay the school expenses of her children. In the future, she would like to expand her business by buying and selling wholesale.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of fruits

loans.name: Mahmadiso

texts.ru: Махмадисо Худойбердиев проживает в районе Бохтар. Возраст 50 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Уже шесть лет занимается торговлей. Торгует на центральном рынке , калошами. В данный момент хочет увеличить ассортимент товара  путем получения кредита. Это поможет ему привлечь новых клиентов и развивать свой бизнес. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahmadiso H. lives in Bokhtar. He is 50, married, and has 4 children. Mahmadiso has been in business for 6 years. He sells rubber boots at the central market. Mahmadiso applied for this loan to increase the assortment of his products. This will help him attract new clients and develop his business. Mahmadiso plans to pay off this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mr. Phan N. is 38 years old and lives in the countryside with his wife and three children. He and his wife are farmers and makes US$6 every day. They started growing rice and vegetables in 2006. Three of their children are students. Phan N. would like to take out a loan to purchase fertilizers and farming tools to expand his cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and farming tools.

loans.name: Leonel Antonio

texts.es: Don Leonel tiene la edad 43 años, reside en el barrio Villa reconciliación en la ciudad de Managua, su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 9,13 y15 años de edad, todos ellos estudian, su esposa es la cocinera de un comedor que tiene la familia y el es el encargado de la caja del comedor y el de hacer todas las compras para preparar los alimentos,  tiene ocho años de estar en las ventas, negocio que inicio su suegra con dinero propio y que ha ido creciendo con esfuerzo de todo han logrado mantener el negocio de la comideria. El señor Leonel lleva ocho ciclos de préstamo en Afodenic, el cual va invertir en mejoras de su casa en la construcción de un  muro para tener  privacidad y seguridad para su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Leonel is 43 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the city of Managua. He and his wife have three children ages 9, 13 and 15, and all of them are students. His wife is the cook at a restaurant that his family owns. He is in charge of the cash register at the restaurant and also shops for the ingredients to make the food. He has had the business for eight years, which his mother-in-law started with her own money. It has been growing with everyone’s hard work, and they have succeeded in maintaining the restaurant. Mr. Leonel has borrowed eight loans from Kiva partner Afodenic. He will invest this loan in home improvements and will build a wall to provide privacy and security for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a wall

loans.name: Islom

texts.en:
B. Islom is 53 years old and married with 8 children. His wife works as a teacher in the local school. For many years, Islom has lived very happily in his small house surrounded by his fields and the "Good Morning" of a beautiful sunrise every day. He rises before sunrise, and with love and hope he works the fields that generate his family's income.

Islom is applying for a loan of 500 USD with which to buy the supplies necessary for the maintenance of his crop, including seeds and fertilizer. These supplies will guarantee the quality of the harvest to which he has dedicated many hours of work during many months.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Liên Group

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị (20213030008) is a 50 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Cầu Gạo 2- 09 (9).


L. is married and has 3 adult children.  To make a living, L. operates a family member's business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling bamboo products to local businesses and community members.  L. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.186.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 3.360.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Chu Thị T. (20213030009) is a 32 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


2.  Đỗ Thị L. (20213030010) is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


3.  Đinh Thị L. (20213030011) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 4.256.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


4.  Đào Thị T. H. (20213030012) is a 20 year-old female who is requesting a 4.256.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


5.  Nghiêm Thị T. (20213030013) is a 22 year-old female who is requesting a 4.256.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Nguyễn Thị (20213030008) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Cầu Gạo 2- 09 (9).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng tre cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.186.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3.360.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Chu Thị T. (20213030009) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  Đỗ Thị L. (20213030010) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


3.  Đinh Thị L. (20213030011) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


4.  Đào Thị T. H. (20213030012) là 20 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


5.  Nghiêm Thị T. (20213030013) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất L. & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Leonard's Group

texts.en:
N. Leonard is the leader of Bwagonga Eco Bakyara Tukwatanise in Ibanda. She is a friendly and hard-working 40-year-old widow with 6 children aged 5-18 years. Leonard also cares for 2 orphans. All the children are in school from S.6 – P.1.

Leonard is a farmer who has been selling agricultural produce for 4 years. Mostly she sells matooke, which is used for making a local dish once boiled. In doing her business, she is faced with a challenge of debts: some of her customers come and load trucks of produce but make only partial payments, which sometimes affects her business and money flow. She hopes to expand her business as well as attain the best education for her children and all those that she cares for.

loans.use: Buying more produce (matoke) for sale.

loans.name: Yessenia

texts.es: Yessenia es una muchacha de 18 años, muy trabajadora y alegre, vive sola en la casa de sus familiares y tiene muchas ganas de sobresalir en la vida. Aunque todavía es muy joven, se ha dado cuenta que para tener un mejor futuro debe trabajar mucho, es por eso que desde muy niña se preocupo por ganar su propio dinero. Ahora trabaja en la farmacia de su tía, donde desde muy temprano se dedica a atender y vender los medicamentos que los clientes le solicitan, los precios que ofrece son muy accesibles, es por eso que es más concurrida que otras farmacias. Yessenia es una vendedora por naturaleza, la alegría y confianza que le brinda a sus clientes son sus principales armas de persuasión, pero lo que no le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir a la calle, aun así sabe que tiene que realizar su trabajo para tener ingresos económicos, con los cuales, en el futuro pueda poner su propio negocio. Tiene ya un año y medio en esta actividad y es muy conciente que sólo trabajando duro, podrá mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es el primer préstamo de Yessenia con MFP y quiere pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a más préstamos posteriormente, sabe que en su banco comunal la apoyarán y guiarán, ya que es una socia muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita comprará más medicamentos para la farmacia de su tía, así podrá generarse más ganancias.
texts.en:
Yessenia is a very hardworking and cheerful 18-year-old. She lives in her relatives’ home, and has the desire to excel in life. Although she is still very young, she realizes that she needs to work hard in order to have a better future, which is why she has been earning a living ever since she was a child. She now works in her aunt’s pharmacy, where she attends to the customers very early in the morning, selling them the medication they request. They offer affordable prices, which is why theirs is the most frequented pharmacy. Yessenia is a natural saleswoman. Her joy and the trust that she gains from her customers are her main tools of persuasion. However, what she does not like is having to stay in the pharmacy all day long without being able to go out. Still, she knows that she has to work in order to make the money with which she will be able to start her own business in the future. She has been working in the pharmacy for a year and a half, quite cognizant of the fact that only by working hard can she improve her quality of life. This is Yessenia’s first loan from MFP. She wants to make her payments on time because she knows that her microfinance institute will guide and support her, being the beloved member that she is. With the 1,000.00 PEN that she is requesting, she will purchase more medication for her aunt’s pharmacy, which will allow her to generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.en:
This committee is in its first cycle with the Fundación Paraguaya, and has 18 participants.  The committee members all work in different industries, and the loans they applied for will go toward merchandise and raw materials.  The committee has a good relationship and a deep respect between all of the participants.  Despite the fact that it is a new committee, the women are working hard and producing good results. 

Their goal as a group is to be able to proviD. their children with a good education, which will give them the opportunity to find a good job.  For this reason the women of this committee work twice as hard to be able to accomplish their goals. 

1	Marta D. C.-	Food sales 
2	Liduvina B.-	Fruit sales 
3	Liz M.-	Recycling 
4	Lidia D. A.-	 Food sales 
5	Claudia V.-	Clothing sales 
6	Carmen D. B.-	Clothing sales 
7	Marta D. D. G. -	Food sales 
8	Gualberta D. D.-	Clothing sales 
9	Lucia D. B.- 	Fruit and salad sales 
10	Gabriela D. M.-	Food sales 
11	Ronaliz D. P.-	Food sales 
12	Lourdes F.-	Vegetable sales 
13	Ediltrudis M.-	Food sales 
14	Alicia I.-	Snack sales 
15	Norma M.- 	Food sales 
16	Eulalia A.-	Clothing sales 
17	Cristina D. C.- 	Snack sales 
18	Eva D. G.-	Fruit sales

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and merchandise for sale

loans.name: Abrahan

texts.es:
El socio Abrahan, pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOC KILLA”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 41 años de edad,  es soltero tiene 2 hijos y se dedica al prestar el servicio de taxi, el socio requiere este préstamo para uso personal pero parte de ello es para mantenimiento de sus taxi. El lleva 15 años trabajando como taxista y ahora tiene su propio auto

Nuestro socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The associate Abrahan is a member of the community bank "Mosoc Killa" and lives in the Santiago neighborhood of the city of Cusco. Our member is 41 years old, single and has 2 children. He makes a living providing taxi services. He needs this loan for personal use and to pay for the maintenance of the taxi. He has been a taxi driver for the last 15 years and now owns his own car. The member is very grateful for this opportunity that is available to him and agrees to comply with the payment terms in the contract.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Kem Y., 45, has been involved in the grocery business with a typical income of US $3 per day. Y. and her husband work so hard all days to ensure a comfortable standard of living for the family. Y. and her husband are blessed with four school-aged children who have all attended a local school. Her husband is a local government schoolteacher with a typical income of approximately US $2 per day. Y. really wants to take a loan of US $500 to expand her inventory by purchasing more groceries for her store at home to generate more income for her household expenses and save for her children’s future education.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Exotic plants in bulk

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 48 years old and married with 4 children. She has been in the business of selling provisions for 8 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N 150,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says "thanks" to all the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie E. and her husband, Edgar E., value the 1-hectare (~2.5-acre) rice field that they own, because it provides adequate food for the whole family. With 6 children to feed, hard work is required to make their farm productive. 

Less than a year ago, Melanie was able to qualify for membership in CEV. She immediately used the loan money for farm inputs. She said that ever since she became a member of CEV, her financing needs are met. 

Now she is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to be used for farm inputs. Melanie is very thankful for the financial support she receives for her business.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Amornia

texts.en:
Amornia U. is from the city of Pagadian City. She is 34 years old. Amornia is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Amornia operates a family member's business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services to local community members. Amornia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Amornia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amornia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Amornia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Amornia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Guapuru Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento GUAPURU fue fundado en el año 2007; actualmente se encuentran en su sexto ciclo, todas las socias son cumplidas y solidarias entre ellas, las reuniones se realizan en la casa D. la Sra. Ruth Montegro que es la presidente desD. hace dos ciclos, la mayoria D. ellas se dedica a la preparacion y venta D. comida, panaderia y venta D. cosmeticos, tienen un varon como socio en el grupo que ademas D. la venta D. comida tambien maneja un equipo D. animacion y sonido. 		
La Sra Ruth Montegro es una D. las fundadoras del banco D. emprendiemiento, ella esta casada y tiene una hija que asiste a la escuela; vive en alquiler con su esposo que se dedica al tranporte urbano, ella es presidenta del Banco D. Emprencdimiento y su actividad principal es la venta D. empanadas y sobre todo almuerzo que deja a pedido en empresas y construcciones.Ahora ella esta muy satisfecha con la ayuda economica que brinda en su hogar , ya que se siente importante y ademas que ahorra y comparte con sus amigas y vecinas que son parte del Banco.			
La Sra Candelaria V. es una socia muy responsable siempre llega antes que los demas y es la ultima en retirarse, se dedica a la panaderia en su domicilio donD. convive con su familia, sus hijas la ayudan a preparar las masas y hornear el pan, ella desea comprarse muy pronto un horno más granD. y poder poner su propia tienda en la casa para mejorar sus ingresos, sabe que no esta  muy lejos D. su meta porque en el Banco D. Emprendimiento ha aprendido a ahorrar dinero ademas D. ser muy responsable y consecutiva con sus objetivos. 			
El Sr. Andres S. es un socio antiguo, lleva tres ciclos con el grupo, es una persona responsable y cumplida, se dedica a la venta D. comida junto a su esposa, ademas los fines D. semana atienD. su equipo D. amplificacion, quienes le ayudan siempre que tiene que trabajar los fines D. semanas en las fiestas que los contratan, él se siente orgulloso D. estar con grupo D. señoras que se apoyan y que ademas son muy cumplidas con su crédito, el colabora a su hemana en la crianzar D. sus sobrinos, ademas D. ser resonsable con su propia familia, por eso es que el trabaja duro y esta muy contento D. pertenecer a este Banco D. Emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The Guapuru Communal bank was founded in 2007. They are currently in their sixth cycle. All of the members are accomplished, and they are united among themselves. They hold their meetings in Ruth Montegro’s house. She has been the president for two cycles. Most of the members prepare and sell food, make bread, or sell cosmetics. One member of the group is a man who, in addition to selling food, also manages sound and animation equipment. Ruth Montegro is one of the founders of the communal bank. She is married and has a daughter who goes to school. She lives in a rented house with her husband who works in urban transportation. She is president of the communal bank. She sells empanadas, and, most of all, she sells ordered lunches to businesses and construction workers. She now feels satisfied with the economic support she brings to her household. She feels important, and she also saves and shares with her friends and neighbors who are part of the bank. Candelaria V. is a very responsible member who always arrives before the others and is the last to leave. She makes bread in her house where she lives with her family. Her daughters help her make the dough and bake the bread. Soon, she would like to buy a larger oven and be able to set up her own store in her home. She wants to do this to improve her earnings. She knows that she is not very far from her goal because in her communal bank she has learned how to save money, be responsible, and to reach her objectives. Andres S. is a long-time member. He has been with the group for three cycles. He is an accomplished and responsible person. He sells food with his wife. On the week ends he works with his amplification equipment. He uses the equipment when he is contracted to work on the week ends at parties. He is proud to be part of a group of women who support each other and are accomplished. In addition to be responsible with his own family, he helps his sister raise his two nephews. He works hard and is very happy to belong to this communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Madalena Manuel

texts.pt:
Madalena N. nasceu em chokwe, Província de Gaza, ao sul de Moçambique, tem 30 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 4 filhos de 13,10,5 e 1 anos de idade. Não estudou porque o pai não sustentou as despesas escolares, vivia com uma outra esposa na Republica da Africa do Sul. Vive na casa própria construída na base de material precário em Boane com a família e para alem desta sustenta a Sogra (mãe do Marido) enviando alguns géneros alimentícios.

Saiu de Chokwe em 1997 com a mãe para a casa da tia em Boane, provincia de Maputo, começa a trabalhar numa empresa agrícola de produção e venda de Banana (Bananalandia) com o seu esposo. Actualmente trabalha das 6h as 14h auferindo um salário de 1.630.00mt, poupa algum no fim de mes com colegas através de Xitique e o marido tem ajudado sempre nas despesas caseiras.

Nunca trabalhou com outras instituições de crédito, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes desta instituição e este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, cimento, areia ferro e outros).

Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo afim de aceder a mais créditos no futuro concluir a sua obra e oferecer a sua família melhores condições de acomodação.
texts.en:
Madalena N. was born in Chokwe, province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique, she is 30 years old and is married and has 4 children who are 13, 10, 5 and 1 years old. She didn't studied because her father didn't support any school endeavours, as he lived with another wife in the Republic of South Africa. She lives in her own house built of very poor material in Boane with her family and besides her family she supports her mother in law sending her food. She left Chokwe in 1997 with her mother to live at her aunts' house in Boane, province of Maputo, started working at an agricultural company that produces and sells bananas (Bananlandia) with her husband. Currently she works from 6 am to 2 pm with a salary of 1.630MT, she saves some money with co-workers thru Xitique and her husband always helps with the household. She never requested credit from other institutions, she learned about Hluvuku tru co-workers who are clients too, and this is her first loan for 10.000MT which she expects to use to buy construction material (rock, cement, sand, iron, among others). She promises to pay on time the loan in order to access to more credits in the future and finish her house to offer her family better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand and others)

loans.name: Lazaro Jesus

texts.es: Don Lázaro H. padre de familia de 6 hijos todos a su cargo, su esposa ama de casa. Su negocio es un taller de carpintería con treinta dos años de hacer modelos diferentes en mueble. Las dificultades es que abecés le cuesta conseguir la madera buena, y cuando la haya a un costo muy alto de precio lo cual solo puede comprar poco y terminar el trabajo encargado, tiene 49 años de edad,  su propósito para sus hijos es apoyarlos en sus estudios y en lo que este a su alcance, cuando comenzó la carpintería sus trabajos los hacia solo, ahora tiene dos trabajadores para terminar los muebles mas rápido, mas finos, ya que a través del tiempo ha logrado una buena clientela que lo recomienda y es el único en el sector del barrio  Laureles Sur, con ese negocio que es una gran ventaja. Con este financiamiento comparara madera variada para hacer sus muebles y aumentar la variedad de productos ya que ha estado en estos últimos meses solo con encargo y desea hacer, camas, ropero, mesas y exhibir para mejorar las ventas. Contento por los nueve ciclos de préstamo que Afodenic ha dado para mejorar su inversión.
texts.en:
Mr. Lazaro H. is a family man with 6 children, and a wife who cares for their home. His business is a carpenter shop, in which he has made different types of furniture for 32 years. The most difficult part is that sometimes it is hard to obtain quality wood, and when he is able, he can only afford to buy a small amount to finish the job he is on, due to the high price. He is 49 years old, and his goal is to be able to support his children in their studies. When he began doing carpentry, he made the furniture by himself, but now he has two workers who help him finish the furniture more quickly and with a higher quality. Over time he has built up a good clientele that recommends him to others, and he is the only one in the sector of the neighborhood Laureles Sur with this business, which is a great advantage. With this loan he will purchase assorted types of wood to make his furniture and increase the variety of products. He would like to make beds, wardrobe closets, and tables, which he will exhibit in order to improve his sales. He is happy about the nine loan cycles that Afodenic has given him to increase investment in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase assorted types of wood to make furniture

loans.name: Etelbina Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Etelbina S. se dedica a la elaboración de alimentos para la respectiva venta siendo comercializados por ella misma en las afueras del mercado central donde busca la manera de cómo vender a diario todo el alimento para generar utilidades para el bienestar de su hogar.
Ella actualmente no posee las condiciones necesarias para desarrollar su negocio por lo que busca la manera de cómo desarrollar su negocio y hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y de esta manera comercializarlos en el mercado.
texts.en:
Etelbina S. lives in Chinandega department and works selling meals that she prepares herself outside the city's central market. Her daily task is to sell out all her meals so that she can generate profits for the wellbeing of her home. She currently lacks the resources to develop her business further so she has called upon Ceprodel to request financing to buy ingredients for her meal preparations in order to continue selling in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meal preparation.

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday sells motorcycle spare parts at retail prices to his customers. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He is 40 years old and married with four children. He is a hardworking man. His wife is a trader, and she sells groceries to support her home. Friday hopes to own a big stall in the future. He needs a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.es: Marina del Carmen H. D. M. D. 34 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos D. 12 y 11 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y residen en el departamento D. Usulután. Marina posee una venta D. ropa para niños y adultos, así mismo venD. cremas y ganchos para el cabello, la cual lo comercializa en uno D. los lugares con mayor comercio en Usulután. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, D. manera que pueda tener más prendas D. vestir que ofrecer a las personas, como tallas, color y estilos, y así poder aumentar sus ventas. Marina es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo la cual desea seguir adelante con su negocio y poder mejorar las condiciones D. este, ya que es gracias a su venta D. ropa como ella pueD. obtener una estabilidad económica junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Marina del Carmen H. D. M. is 34 years old and lives with her husband and their two children aged 12 and 11. Her children are both in school, and the family resides in the department (administrative region) of Usulután. Marina has a business selling clothing for children and adults along with creams and hair clips; she sells these items in one of the places with the most traD. in Usulután. She requests a loan to buy an increased quantity of clothing so that she will have more clothing to offer her customers with a variety of sizes, colors and styles, and in this way increase her sales. Marina is a person who is very dedicated to her work. She wants to proceed with her business and be able to improve it; as thanks to her clothing sales she is able to obtain economic stability for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing and hair accessories

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 28-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ali has been working at furniture repair for almost ten years now. He also sells furniture, but it is usually used furniture that he repairs and then sells later on.

Ali decided on doing his business because he learned it when he was young and gained lots of experience. He also said that he is creative and always follows furniture fashions, that’s what makes him special. When he first started his business, he had to face some financial issues since the price of the thread and machines is expensive.

Ali requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new thread and repair one of his sewing machines for his work. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time. His clients can be anyone from his region. He also has attractive and competitive prices because he wants to keep on increasing his networking and grow his client base.

loans.use: To purchase new thread and repair one of his sewing machines for his work

loans.name: María Olga

texts.es:
María Olga tiene 34 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a sus cuatro hijos en el sector Huaca de Barro, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia la llevó a dedicarse al negocio de crianza y venta de animales. Usualmente cría aves de corral y cerdos en un terreno abandonado ubicado en la parte exterior se su casa, María Olga los alimenta con granos y hierbas naturales para luego ir a vanderlos al mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de chiclayo dos veces por semana.

Los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para mantener a su familia, por lo que desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una madre luchadora y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es darle a sus hijos una educación de calidad que les garantice un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
María Olga is 34. She is separated and lives with her four children in the Dacha de Barro sector in the Mórrope district. It is located one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. The need to get her family ahead caused her to devote herself to the business of raising and selling animals. She usually raises poultry and pigs on an abandoned piece of land outside of her house. María Olga feeds them grains and natural herbs. She later sells them twice a week at the Moshoqueque market in the city of Chiclayo. The income that she gets is not enough to support her family. That is why she wants to expand her business by purchasing more animals. For the first time she is asking the Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 1,500 PEN, which will help her achieve her objective. She is a fighter and a hard-working mother. Her greatest desire is to give her children a quality education that will guarantee a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy animals to expand her business

loans.name: Miriam Namaemba

texts.en:
Miriam V. is 40 years old and is from Kakamega town. She is married to Tom V. and they have three children who are still in primary school.

Miriam has applied for two previous loans from KADET and has repaid them well and on time. She is now applying for her third loan and she can testify that the two previous loans enabled her to expand her business.

Miriam started with the salon and as the business grew she then opened a side boutique. This was a wise idea since the clients who come to have their hair done get the chance to try on new outfits and handbags.

Miriam hopes to get Kiva lenders to assist her in buying more clothes, handbags and shoes for her boutique and shampoo, rollers and towels for her salon. She hopes to expand her hairdressing salon to be able to accommodate more clients.

loans.use: To buy clothes, handbags, rollers and towels to add to her stock

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 35-year-old married man with two children.  He runs a mobile money transfer business (M-Pesa) in the Kibera slums.  He also sells mobile air time and has employed two people in his business which has been running for five years.  He was formerly distributing bread before he started this business. He also earns extra income from his retail shop.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to support his family and be financially independent.   He has requested Kes. 60,000 to add cash float, air time cards and buy cereals.  He hopes to open other outlets for his business in the future.

loans.use: Add cash float to money transfer business

loans.name: Gachanja

texts.en:
Gachanja is 67 years old and a dairy farmer. He is blessed with one son and two daughters. He has been doing dairy farming for the past 10 years.

Gachanja was introduced to Kadet through marketing outreach in his hometown Gatundu. He plans to buy another dairy cow with the loan he has applied for. 

Gachanjas’s main intent is to buy more dairy cows with the extra profit generated from his business. His hopes and dreams are to become a famous dairy farmer. He describes himself as a hardworking dairy farmer.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. is a hard-working business woman who owns a retail shop at Arua Hospital. She is 35 years old, married and blessed with five children, who all attend school.

Margaret A. has been operating her store for almost three years. She plans to use the loan to purchase retail items such as posho (a starchy dish made from corn flour), beans, sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, pens and biscuits, to resell. Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase retail items to resell

loans.name: Gladys Changawa

texts.en:
Gladys, 27 and separated from her husband, is the custodian of their two children, John and Jennifer, who are ten and nine respectively. In the business of selling food to local residents in Kibokoni Malindi for the past two years, Gladys was introduced to Kadet by an existing client, and this will be her second loan. She earns a monthly profit of Kshs 6,500 and will use this loan to increase her grocery stock, improve her business stand, open another business hawking clothes, and pay transport and miscellaneous expenses.

Gladys plans to reinvest the extra income by employing more staff in her business. A hardworking woman, she hopes to acquire a plot of land and eventually build rental houses.

loans.use: Add food stock, improve business stand and start a new clothing sales business

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: EL SEÑOR LUIS TIENE LA ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL LA DE  TRANSPORTISTA Y COMO SEGUNDA ACTIVIDAD LA VENTA DE ZAPATILLAS EN LA CALLE TUMUSLA ESTA ES UNA DE LAS CALLES MAS COMERCIALES DE LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ, QUIEN HA DIVERSIFICADO SU ACTIVIDAD  CON OTROS RUBROS Y DESEA SEGUIR TRABAJANDO CON LA INSTITUCION, EL ES CLIENTE ANTIGUO ESTE SERIA SU QUINTO CREDITO CON NOSOTROS, DICHO CLIENTE TRABAJA CON MUCHA PUNTUALIDAD Y ESMERO CON SUS CUOTAS, DESEA AYUDAR A SU FAMILIA Y SUS HIJOS PARA QUE SEAN MEJORES ESTUDIANTES Y QUE NO SUFRA COMO ELLOS, SIEMPRE COLABORANDO CON SU FAMILIA, SU ESPOSA LE AYUDA EN LA VENTA DE ZAPATILLAS CUANDO EL SALE A TRABAJAR CON SU MOVILIDAD.  EL INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE LLANTAS Y AUMENTARA SU CAPITAL COMPRANDO MERCADERIA EN LO QUE ES LAS ZAPATILLAS PARA NIÑAS. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Luis's main job is as a courier. He also sells shoes in Tumusla Street, one of the main commercial streets in the city of La Paz, and he has diversified into other areas.
