He would like to continue working with this field partner: he is a good customer and this will be his fifth loan with them. He is always on time and keeps careful track of his installments. He wishes to help his family, especially his children so that they can be good students and have a better life. The family always sticks together, and his wife helps out selling shoes when Luis is out working as a courier. He plans to invest the loan in buying tires for his car and adding to his stock of children's shoes. He is very grateful to the field partner Emprender, and to Kiva, for the confidence they have shown by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying stock to sell

loans.name: Dok

texts.en: Dok C., 50, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells food for an income of $13 US per day. Her husband is a butcher, earning an income of $1 per day to help cover the family expenses.  C. is requesting a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a new business as a motor-taxi driver. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred C. is a 54 year old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a beauty service business. She lives in Brgy. Gargato, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental with her husband and their 7 children, who are between 13 and 33 years old.  Some of them currently going to school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1994 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her beauty service business, she is gradually providing more economic stability for her family.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000.

Mildred is now borrowing PHP 13,000 so that she can purchase additional beauty products for her business. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her most recent loan of PHP 16,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Mildred aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned its respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: tourchase additional beauty products for her business

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en: Nizami Q. is a 55-year-old barber who has been working in a barber shop since 2000. He is married and has four children. Nizami applied for 1000 AZN to purchase new tools. He believes one day he could open his own barber shop and start a new business. Now he would like to purchase modern tools and increase his monthly turnover.

loans.use: to purchase new tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Repairs for cattle business.

loans.name: Lolita Friolo's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lolita Friolo, 48 years of age, married, is a resident of P2 Montol, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental.  Lolita is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lolita Friolo’s Group.

Lolita is blessed with 6 children of whom three are already married while the other three are now teenagers and presently working in different companies.  To earn their living, Lolita decided to engage in operating a sari-sari (variety) store. Also she is receiving support from her husband Segundino who is a farmer. For 3 years already, she was able to maintain her business  activities and at this time she is earning an average net income of not less than Php1,500 a month which is helpful to their family budget.

Upon hearing the good news of PAGLAUM MPC being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and awarded Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006, she joined the cooperative this year, 2010. As a newly recognized member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a micro-finance program that reaches out to the rural poor, she is requesting the amount of Php 4,000 as her 1st loan to be used as additional capital for her existing sari-sari store. The future income from this loan will be used to improve living conditions for her family, to meet their basic needs, for loan repayments to PMPC, savings and for possible business expansion.

About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store

location.town: Ozamis-P2 Stimson Abordo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 36 years of age and lives in a city called Borewala in Pakistan with her three sons and a daughter. None of them could get an education due to financial constraints. Her sons had to start work in their early age to support the family financially. Her eldest son is a painter. He paints on walls, doors and windows and the youngest son does welding.

Rukhsana is a housewife who spends most of her time managing her household chores. Her home is a small one and only consists of two rooms. 
She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her son. With the loan, he will buy different colors and brands of paint to offer quality services to his clients.  
Rukhsana is hopeful that with the help of an increased income, she will be able to marry her daughter who is in her marriage age.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of paint

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes C. is a married woman who lives in Cantil-e, Barangay Habitat, Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  a general store, raising hogs and a dry goods business. Her husband, Jesus, who is 55 years old, works as a security guard to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 24 and 29 years old.

Agnes joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Agnes has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $275, raising the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing 25,000 PHP, which she intends to use purchase more stock for the general store and dry goods businesses so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and to purchase additional pigs to raise. 

Agnes C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Scola

texts.en: Scola is 46 years old, married and has eight children. She is a farmer who grows kales (sukuma wiki) (leafy green vegetables) to earn a living.  She has been in the business for the past 20 years. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya because she had previously managed to buy a piece of land for farming.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers. Scola hopes to earm more income so she can open a shop in the future. She sees herself diversifying into dairy farming in 10 years' time.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Nora Myladis

texts.es:
La Sra. C. C. es una Profesora de Primaria y a la vez comerciante de Ropa que habita en el Municipio del Viejo.
Ella va a utilizar el crédito para comprar Ropa nueva en Managua para luego venderla a las profesoras compañeras de su trabajo y sus vecinos cercanos. 

A la fecha la Sra. C. C. lleva 07 créditos con CEPRODEL, los cuales todos los anteriores los ha cancelado muy bien en tiempo y forma, es una excelente cliente que espera seguir trabajando con la Institución por más tiempo.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. C. is a primary school teacher and also a clothing merchant in the town of Viejo.

She is going to use the loan to buy new clothing in Managua to later sell it to her fellow teachers at work and to her nearby neighbors.  

At this time,  Mrs. C. C. has had  7 loans with CEPRODEL. All of them have been paid off in good time and in good order. She is an excellent client who hopes to continue working with the institution more.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to invest in the business.

loans.name: Varónica Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla y Cuna de Eloy Alfaro el Viejo Luchador.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Verónica, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 2 y 1 año, su marido tiene un negocio de venta de pollos.

Tiene un pequeño almacén de productos agrícolas y veterinarios, vende balanciado, vitaminas, abonos e insumos agropecuarios. Trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8am hasta las 19h00, trabaja sola y en las tardes con la ayuda de su esposo. Dice que esta muy a gusto con su negocio ya que le permite ganar dinero y a la vez estar al cuidado de sus hijos que es lo mas importante. Los productos los compra en Manta en una distribuidora.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos más que todo los agrícolas ya que se acerca el tiempo de siembras y quiere tener de todo para sus clientes. Esta en el Banco Comunal desde el principio y esta muy a gusto por los beneficios que recibe.
 
Su sueño es tener un almacén mucho más grande.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Aníbal San Andrés" meets every 15 days in the canton of Montechristi.  This is a place that is famous for its straw hats and for being the birthplace of former Ecuadorian president Eloy Alfaro (known as "El Viejo Luchador," or "The Old Warrier.")

In this place we find Veronica, who is 24 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 2 and 1.  Her husband has a business selling poultry.

She has a small store where she sells farming supplies and veterinary products.  She sells balanced feed, vitamins, organic fertilizer and other farming supplies.  She works from Mondays to Fridays from 8am until 7pm.  She works alone, but in the evenings her husband helps her.  She says that she is very pleased with her business, since it allows her to earn money and at the same time care for her children, which is most important.  She buys her products in Manta from a distributor.

She will use this loan to buy products, especially agricultural supplies, since the planting season is approaching and she wants to have everything for her customers.  She has been a member of her communal bank since it started, and she is very pleased with the benefits that she receives.

Her dream is to have a store that is much larger.

loans.use: to buy agricultural and veterinary products: vitamins, balanced feed, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou P. is 33 years old and from Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur.  She has been selling pigs since 2004. She is asking for funding from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to expand her business by buying more piglets and feed.
 
Marilou is married and has four children. The additional profits will allow her to better provide for their daily needs and maybe start another business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional provisions such as Ovaltine, powdered milk and mayonnaise

loans.name: Waylita

texts.en: Waylita R. is from the village of Poblacion, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 57 years old. Waylita is married and has two adult children. To make a living Waylita owns and operates a specialized retail store. The business's main source of income comes from buying and selling vegetables such as squash, eggplant, cabbage and sayote in the local community. Waylita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010 Waylita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Waylita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional vegetables to buy and sell. Waylita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Waylita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila E. is from the village of Sibutad. She is 31 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Mila owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling viand (cooked meats) and other delicacies in the local community. Mila has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 650 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Mila is requesting her 4th loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to invest for the expansion of her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov P. has been in the farming business for years. She grows various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2 per day. Her husband earns a living by providing battery charging services to his neighbors and villagers in the province of Kompong Tom. This couple has been married for years and has only one child, who is attending in school. Nov P. wishes to open a small shop in order to sell a few products for additional income. Because her savings account is not enough to start this new business, Nov P. would like to request a loan to buy some items, such as food, soft drinks, sweets, and other necessary products, to sell.

loans.use: To buy some items, such as food, soft drinks, and sweets, for selling.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa L. lives in the Katanga neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 12 children, nine of whom are in school. Latifa has a little restaurant.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Latifa sells her food at the market.  

Latifa has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, beef and chicken. She also generates additional income through charcoal sales.

The main business challenges for Latifa include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to sell wholesale and also to educate her children up to university.   Latifa lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches  of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, beef and chicken

loans.name: Monh

texts.en:
From Siem Reap province, Monh T. is 29 years old and has had a fish sale trade since 2000. Monh T. sells fish that she and her husband themselves catch from the river. She also buys fish from other fishermen when she does not have enough fish to serve her valued clients. By doing this, they are able to generate about $6 per day to solve their daily financial problems. The couple was married many years ago and has been blessed with two children, both of whom are going to school. 

Currently, the quantity of fish caught is decreasing due to the fact that her old boat was broken during the fishing process, and she is lacking fishing tools and supplies. Because of this, Monh T. has requested a loan in order to purchase a new boat and more equipment for her fishing activities.

loans.use: To purchase a new boat, and more equipment for fishing activities.

loans.name: Lina Esther

texts.es:
Lina B.  quiere ampliar su negocio y ahora está solicitando su credikiva para comprar una vitrina y surtirla con calzado, accesorios femeninos y fantasías en general. Con su anterior credikiva incremento sus ventas y aumentó así mismo sus utilidades, porque todo el queso, suero, calzado y vestidos que compró los vendió y ganó dinero. Ahora se dispone a buscar nuevos compradores y a responderle a sus clientes actuales, con calidad, oportunidad y responsabilidad, así seguirá creciendo y logrando  su confianza. 
Si usted quiere conocer la Historia de Lina puede ingresar al siguiente enlace: 
http://kiva.org/lend/173040
texts.en: Lina B. wants to expand her business and is now requesting a credikiva loan to buy a glass case and fill it with shoes, women’s accessories, and costume jewelry.  With her last credikiva loan, she increased her sales and improved her profits because she sold all of the cheese, whey, shoes, and dresses that she bought and earned money.  Now she is looking for new buyers and to respond to her current customers with quality, opportunities, and responsibility so that she can be sure to keep growing and gaining their trust.  If you want to learn more about Lina’s history you can go to the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/173040

loans.use: buy a glass case and fill it with shoes, women’s accessories, and costume jewelry

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 36 years old and married. To earn a living, he does printing and sells stationery. He started the business 10 years ago. John also runs a taxi business to earn extra income. He has employed two people in his business. He is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because he has managed to buy a piece of land. He hopes to grow his business so as to earn more income. He has requested a loan of 50,000 kes to buy stationery and repair his printer.

loans.use: To buy stationery and repair his printer

loans.name: Ayiminasso 2 Group

texts.en:
The Ayiminasso 2 group of 20 entrepreneurs all live in the same village outside the rural centre of AllaD.. This is their first loan with ALIDE.

Philomène (with her hand raised in the photo) was born in 1976 in AllaD.. She moved to her current village 8 years ago, and now lives with her husband Laurent and one of their two children, both of whom have been to school.  For the past 25 years Philomène has run a stall selling corn in the village. This loan will enable her to purchase three sacs of corn from Cotonou, Benin’s economic centre, two hours away from AllaD.. Her aim in the long term is to grow her business to be able to fully support her family’s needs. She claims to be rigorous and dynamic in her approach to business.

loans.use: to purchase sacs of corn

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela is 31 years old and married to Mr. G. who operates an agriculture business. He has a small piece of land where he grows different seasonal crops and sells to his clients for a profit. He also has a sweetmeat selling business. His shop is located in the market and he opens it after his day work. 

Shakeela is a very supportive lady. She assists her husband in his work by making sweetmeat. She is also a very good housewife who manages her household works effectively.  She lives in the area of Shanty nagar in Khanewal in a three-room brick house with her family. Khanewal is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and is known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there for the past 15 years. She is the mother of a daughter and two sons. None of them is able to attend school due to poor financial conditions of Shakeela and her husband. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s agriculture business. Through the loan, he will buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides to grow better quality crops and earn more profits hopefully. He has been operating this business for the past eight years and Shakeela is very hopeful that an investment will bring better profits to her husband by improving his business conditions. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shakeela.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Nelis Estela

texts.es:
Nelis, resiD. en Jucuaran departamento D. Usulután, trabaja la agricultura, vive con su familia  sus hijos y su esposo, quienes le ayudan a cultivar maíz, ella también atienD. un molino D. nixtamal.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas, ya que se dispone con su familia a sembrar maíz, para esto se necesita D. abonos y fertilizantes, esta compra le permitirá obtenerlos y realizar el proceso del cultivo.
Nelis, tiene por objetivo montar el negocio fuerte con el molino, ser una microempresaria D. éxito y vivir cómodamente con su familia.
texts.en:
Nelis lives in Jucuaran, in the department of Usulután. She works in agriculture. She lives with her family, her children and her husband, who help her to grow corn. She also operates a nixtamal [hominy] mill.

Currently, she needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies, since she is ready to plant corn with her family, and she needs compost and fertilizer. This purchase will allow her to obtain them and carry out the cultivation process. 

Nelis' goal is to strengthen her business with the mill, become a successful microentrepreneur, and live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a married woman from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband is a farmer and primarily grows rice. She has a sari-sari (variety) store business and sells various items like soap, diapers, and canned goods. 

Rufina has applied for a loan and plans to use it to buy more items to sell such as rice and canned goods. She hopes to expand her sari-sari store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice and canned goods.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman with 2 children. She is 40 years old and runs a sari-sari store business.  Lilian sells items like canned sardines and noodles to the people in her community. She also sells prepaid mobile loan credits. Lilian wants to sell rice as well.

Lilian is requesting a loan of 18000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and rice.

In the future, Lilian hopes to expand her sari-sari store.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 27 year-old married man and the father of one child, from Al Ashrafia, Jordan. Ahmad has a vehicle repair shop.  He is requesting a loan of 1500JD to purchase more tools and equipment to improve his performance as a mechanic and to be more efficient for his customers. Ahmad aspires to enlarge his business, increase his customer base, and improve the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more tools and equipment

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Phalla, 30, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Phalla is a teacher at a public school, earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family's expenses. The family is also assisted by her mother who grows vegetables to sell, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 15 on the other necessary expenses. Phalla is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase vegetable seeds to grow more crops to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds to grow more crops

loans.name: Roline

texts.en:
Roline is 28 years old and married with three children who attend school. For the past four years, she has been selling electrical goods and she has two employees. Roline has grown her business with the help of Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.

Roline is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy a refrigerator. In the future, she hopes to open other business outlets.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
59 year-old Carmelita is a farmer working in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has been growing and selling rice since 2002. She earns about 6000 PHP per month doing this farming.

Carmelita is single and has no children. She supports her parents financially. Carmelita requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for her business to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sipporah

texts.en:
Sipporah is 37 years old. She is single and has two children age 16 and 10. She runs a clothing sales business within Nairobi city center. She has been in this business for three years now and says her major challenge is financial constraints.

She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to add to her stock of clothes to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and open a big boutique within the city center in the future. 

She describes herself as social, honest and God-fearing.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Raghida

texts.en:
Raghida is a 27-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and four siblings. She established in 2007 an accounting business to help provide various types of reports for members of her community and some companies. She works on a freelance basis. 

With her requested loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, she will make much needed repairs on her car. In that way, she will be able to serve her clients whenever they are located. In the future, she is planning to expand her business level and get employment in a large company and earn a good income.

loans.use: make much needed repairs on her car.

loans.name: Rosa Maclovia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comuna Sector 3 María, vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad  es de clima frió, su gente es muy carismática, amable y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones. La arquitectura de Cuenca se mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno lo que le hacen una ciudad muy especial.

Doña Rosa tiene 39 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 18, 16, 14 y 12 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a la construcción y labora como albañil, la casa es de su propiedad construida en su unión conyugal.
  
La Señora. Rosa se dedica al cuidado de su hogar y como pasa en casa se dedica a la cría de pollos y cuyes a los que los vende en la ciudad o en su comunidad. 

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir para la compra de alimento para sus pollos.
 
Su meta es tener ganado y crecer en la cría de animales.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a member of the Sector 3 Maria communal bank. She lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. This city has a cold climate and its people are very charismatic, friendly and maintain their culture and traditions. The architecture of Cuenca is a mix of colonial and modern, which makes it a very special place.

Rosa is 39, married and has 4 children who are 18, 16, 14 and 12 years of age. All of her children are in school in the city. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. The house they live in is their own and is a product of their union.

Sra. Rosa is a housewife and, as she spends her days at home, she also raises chickens and guinea pigs which she sells in the city or in her neighborhood.

This is her second loan as a member of the communal bank and she will use it to buy chicken feed.

Her goal is to have cattle and to expand her animal raising business.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old, married, and blessed with two children.  To earn a living, she sells second-hand shoes.  She has been in the business for four years.  She has employed two people to assist her in the business.  She also owns rental houses which earn her extra income.  Previously, she used to operate a salon.

Grace hopes to expand her business within five years.  She has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Edison Antonio

texts.es:
Edison Antonio tiene 22 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
 
La VRC 1º de mayo, se encuentra ubicada en la cdla 1º de mayo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos se dedican a labores comerciales.
	
Edison se dedica a fabricar ladrillos los materiales los compra en el comercial Loaiza y los vende en Ventanas. El crédito lo solicita para comprar material y poder ampliar el negocio para mejorar los ingresos económicos.

El credito le servira para poder mejorar la estabilidad económica por los que esta pasando.

El sueño es poder administrar un fabrica grande para poder tener ingresos buenos. Los desafios al que se enfrenta a diario es la competencia.

En los momentos libres le gusta pasear y ver televisión.
texts.en:
Edison Antonio is 22 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  He lives with his parents in Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.

The '1º de Mayo' community bank is located in '1º de Mayo' community, in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  The members of the bank work in commercial activities.

Edison makes bricks.  He buys his materials in Comercial Loaiza and sells in Ventanas.  He is requesting this loan to buy materials and expand his business so that he can improve his income.

This loan will help Edison to improve his financial stability.  His dream is to be able to run a large factory so that he can make good income.  The challenge he faces every day is competition.

In his free time, Edison enjoys going out for walks and watching television.

loans.use: to buy material and expand his business

loans.name: Sare Sahara/ Pellital Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Pellitala été créé en juillet 2008  lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte 14 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles font toutes le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama (assise à l’extrême droite), est responsable. Elle est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 02 enfants.

Elle est vendeuse de beignets dans son village. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans.

Son crédit va lui permettre d’acheter de la farine en quantité et divers ingrédients pour la préparation de beignets.

Avec les bénéfices elle compte appuyer son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Pellitala Group was established in July 2008, when the local Banc Villageois was inaugurated. The group is made up of 14 women who live in the same village. They all work as resellers.

Mrs. Mariama (sitting on the far right in the photograph) is responsible for the group. She's 39 years old, married, and the mother of two children. For more than five years, she's been selling donuts in her village.

Her loan will enable her to buy a large quantity of flour, and various ingredients needed to make donuts. With her profits, she intends to help her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy flour and other ingredients needed to make donuts

loans.name: Kassofor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 07 JUIN 2001. Il  est  constitué de douze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce. 

Madame Aby qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 65 ans. Elle est veuve  sans enfants. Mais elle en charge trois enfants confié par ses parents et proches.

Elle s’active dans la vente de fruits et légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer son activité de vente de fruits et légumes.

Les profits générés par son petit commerce lui permettront de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et d’améliorer les conditions de vie des enfants qui lui sont confiés par exemple: la nourriture la santé etc.…).
texts.en:
Kassofor Group was established on June 7, 2001. It is made up of twelve women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main business is retailing.

Mrs. Aby, raising her hand on the right in the photograph, is responsible for the group. She's 65 years old, a widow, and without children. But she has three children entrusted to her by family.

She sells fruits and vegetables. She's been running this business for several years, and has a good experience in this field. This loan will enable her to bolster her working capital and better expand her business.

The profits of her business enable her to provide for herself and improve the standard of living (food, healthcare) of the children she has to support.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 46-years-old and lives in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has six children all of whom are currently in school. For the past eight years Lawrence has been working hard to manage his store which makes and sells furniture. 

To help expand his business, Lawrence has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more timber and will help Lawrence to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Lawrence hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to grow his business. 

Lawrence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lawrence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more timber.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: El señor Guillermo tiene un pequeño taller de imprenta y además recibe una pensión por ser rentista jubilado. El crédito lo requiere para la cancelación de unos estudios dirigidos en el área grafica así mejorar los productos y servicios que ofrece a su distinguida clientela. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa Nueva Potosí en la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y  tiene dos  hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron ya que le dieron la posibilidad de crecer como pequeño microempresario. Es muy loable su actitud de que, a sus 59 años de edad, haya decidido tomar unos cursos para estar mejor preparado en su área de trabajo.
texts.en:
Sr. Guillermo has a small print shop, but he also receives a retirement pension. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for some graphic design courses so that he can improve the products and services he offers to his distinguished clientele. Guillermo lives in his own home in the District of Villa Nueva Potosí in the city of La Paz. He is married and has two children.

Guillermo is very pleased with the loans that have been granted to him because they have provided him the opportunity to grow as a small businessman. At 59 years of age, he should be commended for having the right attitude in deciding to take a few courses so that he can be better prepared in this line of work.

loans.use: to pay for courses in graphic design.

loans.name: Nehema A Group

texts.en:
Lydia is the facilitator of the Nehema A group. Lydia and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Lydia and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Lydia joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Lydia had a very good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Lydia was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from her maize sales, Lydia will invest in a cow and build a house.

In 2012, the members of Nehema A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Lydia with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Luz  Magaly

texts.es:
La Sra. Luz Magaly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Pachacutec II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de  San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 27 años, está casada y tiene 02 hijos menores de edad de 10 y 03 años, la mayor está estudiando el nivel Primario. 
Empezó vendiendo productos de belleza, al ingresar al banquito ya hace mas de un año decidió incrementar sus ingresos con un nuevo negocio con la venta de salchipapas, su esposo la ayudó con la compra de un carrito salchipapero y le faltaban los insumos, es asi que el primer préstamo de S/.300.00, lo usó  para comprar  insumos como papa, aceite, hot dog, y desde entonces viene trabajando todos los días de 5:30 pm hasta las 10:00 pm, para generar ingresos que pueda contribuir con la economía de su hogar, su esposo le ayuda con la atención de los clientes que son sus vecinos, transeúntes.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00,  comprará  productos e ingredientes al por mayor y así disminuir sus costos como papas por sacos, aceite por galones y los condimentos, además comprará los envases descartables que utiliza en su negocio y gaseosas que es un complemento para su negocio. 
Luz Magaly, es una mujer trabajadora, su sueño es construir su casa para tener un local propio donde pueda implementar un negocio familiar que les permita  crecer  y mejorar económicamente, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de generar sus propios ingresos, y fomentarles la cultura del ahorro para poder cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Luz Magaly belongs to the communal bank Pachacutec II, in the district of La Banda de Shilcayo, in the province of San Martín, in the Department of San Martín. She is 27 years old, married and has 2 young children 10 and 3 years old and the older child attends primary school.

She began selling beauty products, starting with a little bench, and more than a year ago decided to increase their income with a new business by selling salchipapas [fried potatoes and hot dogs or sausages served with condiments]. Her husband helped by buying a salchipapero [a cart from which to sell salchipapas] but it lacked supplies, and this is the reason for her first loan of 300 soles. She used it to buy supplies such as potatoes, oil, hot dogs, and since then she has been working every day from 5:30PM until 10:00PM in order to earn income that she can contribute to the household expenses. Her husband helps her by tending to the customers who are her neighbors and passers-by.

With this loan of 1000 soles she will buy wholesale products and ingredients and thus reduce the costs, such as sacks of potatoes, gallons of oil, and the condiments, and she will also buy the throwaway containers that she uses in the business and soft drinks that round out the meal.

Luz Magaly is a hardworking woman, and her dream is to build a house in order to have her own facility where she can expand her family business that  will permit her to grow and improve financially. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to earn her own income, and to foster a culture of savings in order to be able to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sacks of potatoes, oil by the gallon, and condiments

loans.name: Kwembe Group

texts.en: Frolence, who is in her twenties, is married and has no children. She has a retail, food products shop and works from 6 am to 6 pm daily.  Frolence is able to make a small monthly profit. This will be Frolences's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more stock for her food shop. She has successfully paid back all her loans. Frolence is requesting another loan to further increase her stock. Her dream is to one day have a wholesale food products business. Frolence will share this loan with her loan group "Kwembe", which has a total of 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to expand her shop.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 31 años de edad, convive con Luciano de 33 años; viven en su propia casa, fruto de esa relación concibieron 03 hijos a quienes desea brindarle una mejor prosperidad. Lidia, menciona que uno puede llegar lejos proponiéndose y trazándose metas, ella desde muy niña quiso dedicarse a la agricultura y comprarse sus propias tierras donde ahora siembra raíces de barbasco. Sus productos lo venden a los grandes mayoristas ya que a veces también compra barbasco y se siente contenta por lo que viene atravesando y no se arrepiente por realizar esta actividad. Además asegura que le hace un bien al medio ambiente. En tiempos de cosecha necesariamente tiene que contratar jornaleros para agilizar con las extracciones de barbascos. Normalmente su producto lo vende en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad y a un precio competitivo. Lidia con el crédito solicitado comprará plantones de barbasco para luego injertarlos y obtener ingresos de lo que produce en corto tiempo, su plan a futuro es comprar barbasco ya que es muy rentable al venderlo. Este será su crédito número 08 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que una vez más tendrá el apoyo financiero. En su banco comunal es una socia solidaria y vela por el progreso de su grupo. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, comprará  raíces de barbasco.
texts.en:
Lidia is 31 years old and lives with her partner Luciano, 33.  They live in their own house.  Together they have 3 children, who they want to give a more prosperous life.  Lidia says that one can get far by proposing and setting goals.  

Since she was a young girl she has wanted to work in agriculture and buy her own land where she now plants barbasco [mullein] root.  She sells her products to the major wholesalers.  Sometimes she also has to buy barbasco.  She is happy about her experiences and doesn't have any regrets about taking up this activity.  She is also assured that she is doing the right thing for the environment.  At harvest time she needs to hire workers to help expedite the harvesting of the barbasco.  Normally, she sells her products to co-ops in her town at a competitive price.  

With the loan requested Lidia will buy barbasco plants to graft and obtain the income from what they produce in the short term.  Her future plan is to continue buying barbasco since it is very profitable to sell.  This will be her eighth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support again.  She is a supportive member in her communal bank and she ensures her group's progress.  With the 3,000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency], she will buy barbasco roots.

loans.use: purchase barbasco roots.

loans.name: Angel Vicente

texts.es:
Angel Vicente tiene 48 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 6 hijos, vive con el conyugue y los hijos de 21, 20, 17, 15, 11 y 7 años de edad en  Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC TENDAL está conformada  por 11 integrantes entre hombres y mujeres se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos de la cooperativa.

Angel  se dedica a la Agricultura a los sembríos de cacao, plátano verde y naranja.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en  San José del Tambo cada semana. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, plantas de cacao, fertilizantes, abonos, líquidos.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá incrementar el negocio, mejorar ingresos para la  familia.

El sueño es  aumentar la producción para tener un mejor ingreso para que los hijos culminen los estudios.

Los desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado son las vías en mal estado.
En el tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a los sembríos, es respetuoso, responsable y le gustan las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en: Angel Vicente is 48 years old.  He lives in a common-law relationship and has six children, ages 21, 20, 17, 15, 11, and 7.  They live in Chillanes, Bolívar province.  The TENDAL VRC [Ventanillas Rurales Crédito, or Window to the Countryside Loan] consists of 11 male and female members and is located 45 minutes from the cooperative.  Angel works in farming and raises cocoa, green bananas, and oranges.  He makes his purchases and sells his produce in San José del Tambo each week.  He is requesting the loan to buy supplies, cocoa plants, fertilizer, manure, and liquid fertilizer.  The loan will help him expand his business and provide better income for his family.  He dreams of increasing production and having better income so that his children can complete their studies.  The poor condition of the roads present a challenge for him.  In his free time, he enjoys tending to his sown fields.  He is respectful and responsible and enjoys the festivities during carnival.

loans.use: to purchase, supplies, cocoa plants, fertilizer, manure, and liquid fertilizer.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 33 years old. She is married to Waweru, and they have 4 children. She has been practicing dairy farming for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of KES 2000.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd in the amount of KES 30,000. She will use the funds to purchase feeds for her dairy cows and fungicides. With the anticipated profits, she will expand her farming business.

Her hope and dream is to venture into large-scale dairy farming.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and fungicides.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 30 year old single woman who supports 1 family member from Al Karak Jordan.She is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to pay for woman clothes to sell to her friends and neighbors.In the future she would like to expand her project through opening a shop and she wants to increase her income.
Rania is conservative woman she is unwilling to upload her photo in the internet the photo is for her uncle.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell

loans.name: Pedro Damian

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 36 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial, caracterizada porque se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de maíz, manzana, entre otros. Pedro vive al lado de su esposa con la cual tiene un pequeño de 2 años por el cual trabaja muy duro  quien es su motor para seguir adelante cada día. Pedro anteriormente trabajaba como agricultor y también en ocasiones trabajaba para algunos fundos de su ciudad, hace algunos meses su padre lo ayudo y le dio una mototaxi, en la cual trabaja como chofer de mototaxi y recorre las calles de su ciudad en busca de pasajeros para ofrecer sus servicios, pero también tiene un pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de cerdos, con lo cual tiene un ingreso extra para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar ; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es responsable y sobre todo atiende de manera amable a los clientes.

Pedro esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mas cerdos para su negocio, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y de esta manera seguir trabajando y luchando cada día para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y poder ser un gran empresario.

loans.use: Para la compra de cerdos

loans.name: Yainkain

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Yainkain. She is single and has one child, age 3, who is not going to school. She has no additional dependents who live with her. 

In 2004, Yainkain established her cosmetology business. She started doing this work after she graduated with a diploma in cosmetology. Working 7 days a week, and 6 to 7 hours a day, she earns about 500,000 leones (SLL) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL.

Yainkain requires a loan in order to improve her business by buying more stock of hairdressing products for her clients. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits to approximately 800,000 SLL. In the future, Yainkain intends to continue to educate her child with this business  and to improve her salon into a training center for young girls. She hopes to be a great businesswoman. She is  thanking you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of hairdressing products.

loans.name: Maria Helena

texts.es:
María Elena es una mujer que vive por sus dos hijas las cuales son su gran motivación de salir adelante y piensa que estudiando y superándose es la mejor manera, le gusta la estética porque cree que viéndose linda por fuera se siente bien por dentro, además le gusta estudiar es apasionada por lo que hace, tiene dentro sus planes tener su propio negocio, manejar sus horarios tener mas tiempo para compartir con su familia y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
El poder entrar a una escuela le da pautas para empezar a subir el primer escalón y alcanzar sus metas, piensa que la edad no tiene ningún problema para llegar a su objetivo le gustaría mostrarle a sus hijas que nunca se es viejo para lograr sus sueños y que hay que esforzarse para ello, a María Elena le gusta ayudar a la gente y sabe que hay muchas personas que no les gusta su físico y por ello tienen problemas de autoestima y le gustaría desde el punto profesional poder ayudarlos.
Su más grande sueño es tener un centro holístico donde encuentren belleza integral, relajación y mucha espiritualidad donde pudiera ayudar a niños enfermos por medio de masajes hidroterapia a pasar ese trago tan amargo.
A nivel personal le gustaría tener una casa propia para asegurarles un mejor futuro a sus hijas que son el motor de sus vida ella tiene una adolescente de 15 años y una hermosa princesa de 4 años su hija mayor no tiene padre lo cual hace que ella se esfuerce mas por el futuro de su hija y a la cual le quiere mostrar que es mejor esforzarse por las metas y está convencida que hay que capacitarse y ver mas allá de lo que nos rodea. Para María Helena la familia es la gasolina que impulsa todo tipo de motor.
texts.en:
María Elena is a woman who lives for her two daughters, who are her main motivation to move forward.  She thinks that studying and succeeding is the best way to do that.  She likes esthetics because she believes that when you see yourself as beautiful on the outside, you feel good inside.  She likes to study esthetics because she is passionate about what she does.  She has plans to have her own business and manage her schedule so that she can have more time to share with her family and have a better quality of life.  Being able to enter a school gave her guidelines for how to take the first step and achieve her goals.  She thinks that age will not stop her from reaching her objective and she would like to show her daughters that you are never too old to achieve your dreams and you have to make an effort for them.  María Elena likes to help people and she knows that many people do not like their physical shape and have problems with self esteem and she would like to be at the professional level to be able to help them.

Her greatest dream is to have a holistic center that offers comprehensive beauty treatments, relaxation, and spirituality.  She also wants to help sick children with hydrotherapy massages since she has experienced that bitter experience.  On a personal level, she would like to own a home to be sure she can provide a better future for her daughters, since they are the driving force in her life.  She has a 15 year old teenager and a beautiful princess who is 4 years old.  Her older daughter does not have a father, which makes her make more of an effort for her future.  She wants to show her that it is better to work for your goals.  She is convinced that its important to get training and see farther than what is around us.  For María Helena, her family is the gasoline that drives everything.

loans.use: to enroll for one semester in a body esthetics course.

loans.name: Wanignon-Pouce 2 Group

texts.fr: aLe groupe WANIGNON-POUCE 2  est composé de six personnes qui résident  dans le même village. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Alice est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo, et n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Alice est âgée de 25 ans et vit au Bénin. Alice est mariée à un peintre du nom de Ségbègnon. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Alice vend à son domicile depuis huit ans des savons comme activité principale à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Alice vend du maïs ; ce qui lui permet de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Alice s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu. Alice ensemble avec les membres du  groupe WANIGNON-POUCE 2, sollicite un premier  crédit auprès de ALIDé

loans.use: Acheter des savons.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma has a small store where she sells snacks and soft drinks. She owned a store similar to this one for about 8 years with her husband but she had to close it down when they got a divorce. The store she runs now is only 8 months old but is doing well. She has a steady flow of clients and she is looking to invest in candies, cookies and chocolates. She has already spent all of her savings to start up the store and therefore requires a loan in order to make further investments.

Norma has five children who are all grown up and have microenterprises of their own. She is a divorcee who is hoping to get reestablished and be a successful business woman on her own.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in new products for her small market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 20 more chairs and renovate her hotel business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is married. Her husband is a bricklayer and together they support their children. She works very hard to support her family. She used to work in a workshop that makes furniture but the pay was low, and her husband's income variable, so she decided to invest her small savings to buy clothing and cushions to sell, having her money work for her and gaining customers. Julia is requesting a loan of $275 to buy women's and children's clothing. She has chosen this customer base carefully based on experience, and proposes to repay the loan in 4 to 8 months. She hopes you will support her and thanks you in advance.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Julia esta casada y su esposo trabaja como albañil, ambos mantienen a sus hijos y por la necesidad económica fue que Julia tuvo que trabajar y como es una mujer muy trabajadora lo hizo; anteriormente trabaja en un taller de mueblería pero su salario era muy bajo y el de su esposo variable, entonces decidió invertir un pequeño ahorro en comprar ropa y colchas para venderlas, y así fue dando vueltas a su capital y fue teniendo más clientes, y salir adelante.

Julia esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 275 para comprar ropa de dama y niños quienes son la mayoría de sus clientes y como ella fue seleccionando su mercado con la experiencia, ofreciendo pagar este préstamo en un período de 4 a 8 meses. Ella espera la apoyes y te esta muy agradecida por ello.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Holger

texts.es:
Descripción del Negocio // Business Description

Holger tiene una experiencia de 12 años con su actividad. Hace 7 se inicio solo con la ayuda de un amigo y su esfuerzo logro conseguir capital de trabajo. Comenzó vendiendo de manera ambulante y pudo conseguir varios clientes. Al momento ha podido mejorar su negocio. Tiene un local en un mercado de la ciudad. Trabajando todos los días de la semana en horario de 6 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m.

Holger has 12 years of experience in his business of selling fish. He began his business seven years ago with the help of his friend and with his own effort in acquiring working capital. He started selling fish in the streets which gave him the opportunity to meet various clients. To date, he has been able to improve his business. He has a shop in one of the open markets of the city. He works every day of the week from 6:00 am to 2:00 pm.

Uso del Préstamo // Loan Use

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de un congelador. Con el que aspira comenzar a trabajar en su domicilio. Y otra parte en mercadería para su local.

He will invest part of the loan in purchasing a freezer, which will allow him to work out of his home. The remaining part of the loan will be used to purchase products for his shop.

Información Personal // Personal Information

Holger esta separado de su esposa hace un año. Tiene 51 años y 2 hijos. Los cuales estudian y están a cargo de el. Con su lucha a logrado adecuar su domicilio. De esta manera darle una mejor vida a su familia. Actualmente esta construyendo un segundo piso en su domicilio. Por lo que espera con la inversión que realizara poder terminar de construir su casa.

Holger has been separated from his wife for one year. He is 51 years old and he has two children, who study and who look after him. With personal effort he has been able to remodel his home and provide for his family with a better lifestyle. Currently, he is adding a second floor to his home, which he hopes that the investment to his business will in turn provide income to allow him to finish with the construction of his home.

loans.use: Invertir en una congeladora //  Purchase a freezer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase piglets, pig feed, and vaccine

loans.name: Trang

texts.en: Trang and her husband have two children. The parents plant the green dragon and other cultivated crops, and sometimes work as day labourers . Their children. ages 8 and 5, are in school. Their average income is $14 per month/person. Trang is requesting a loan of $75 to invest their green dragon planting which will increase her family's income. The loan will be repaid during six months.

loans.use: To invest in green dragon planting

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Mavluda S. is 37, college educated, mother of 3. She has been an active client of Microinvest since 2002. In the beginning she was selling spools, elastic and other retail goods. Now she has a wider assortment of goods and her business is growing. She sells children clothing at the market in the city of Hugend. In the future Mavluda hopes to open a new trading place.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Сангиноива Мавлюда- возраст 37 лет ,мать 3их детей имеет высшее образование.С 2002 года кредитуется в МЗФ Микроинвесте.При первом кредите она торговало мелкой розницей ,нитки ,резинки и.т.д.А на сегоднешний день ее ассортимент увеличился и изменился,т.к. товарооборот увеличивается.Продает она на рынке Худжанда детскую одежду.И в дальнейшем хочет открыть новую точку продажи.

loans.use: to expand the business

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Knee pain impedes Betty’s ability to move with ease. Nevertheless, this impediment doesn’t stop her from continuing to work in her little grocery store. This woman has always helped with the family’s income by selling desserts in the market. Today, her impediment has made her establish a business in her home.

Despite having recently started this business, the earning she has received are a great help, and thanks to the income she can pay for her medical treatment.

Betty, in addition has helped many of her neighbors and friends from the market where she used to work open their own businesses, uniting them under the project Prosperidad de EDAPROSPO.

Betty hopes to be able to better stock her store and buy freezers and shelving in order to offer and display her products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

Los dolores en la rodilla impiden a Betty moverse con facilidad. Sin embargo, esto no es impedimento para que siga trabajando en su pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Y es que desde siempre esta mujer ha ayudado con la economía familiar vendiendo postres en el mercado. Hoy, esta dificultad ha hecho que establezca su negocio en casa.

A pesar que recién esta comenzando, las ganancias que recibe le son de gran ayuda ya que, gracias a ellas, puede pagar el tratamiento que sigue por su malestar.

Betty, además ha ayudado a que muchos de sus vecinos y amigos del mercado donde trabajaba pongan su propio negocio uniéndolos al proyecto Prosperidad de EDAPROSPO.

Betty anhela poder surtir mejor su tienda y comprar congeladoras y más estantes para ofrecer sus productos.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru:
Parvina was born in 1985, is single and lives with her parents. Her family is of average means. Her parents do not have money to pay for higher education, so after high school Parvina and her elder sister started working at a bakery that made pirozhki - baked or fried pastries/patties with meat or vegetable filling. There were three other young women working at the bakery.

Parvina worked at the bakery from 2002 to 2005. During this time she became very good at making pirozhki and decided to open up her own business. For the last three years she has successfully run such a business. She and her sister make the dough, her younger brother bakes and then sells the pirozhki. Her food stand is located in the 'Safariyon' Market and is definitely one of the well known ones.

Parvina joined MLF MicroInvest in early 2007 and has had good credit standing. When she found out about the Kiva partnership, she requested a loan to buy 4 sacks of flour, 50 liters of cooking oil, 40 kilograms of meat and 6 sacks of potatoes for the filling. She would like to use any remaining funds to buy fire wood to fry the pirozhki because in winter the market does not have any electricity during the day. Parvina is very hopeful about getting a Kiva loan and extends her thanks in advance for the help.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Buying  ingredients & heating supplies for  the business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca A. is a trader who is in the selling of lace, jeans, linen, plain materials and others. She is a single parent of one child. She wants to increase her sales but lacks enough capital to achieve her aim. She is asking for $525 as an additional capital to buy more jeans, lace, plain materials and others for sale.

loans.use: Francisca would like to buy more jeans, lace, plain materials and others for sale.

loans.name: Nji

texts.en:
C. was born in 1962. She's married and has six children. Her difficulties in life have been that of poor health, educating the children, feeding them and the lack of farming tools. With all this she had to join GHAPE where she received training in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, she has repaid all her loans with which she raised money to pay school fees for the children and provide them with food and medication.

Given a new loan , she plans to buy rice, palm oil, and various food items to sell in front of her house since her house is located along a public road. Also, these food items are of high demand in her locality. Part of the loan will be invested in mixed farming and will provide food items in the local market. She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. Her first installment repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of food item and seedlings,

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
Fotima G. lives in the Gissar region of Tajikistan. She is 20 years old and single. For the last six years Fotima has been making a living selling groceries in a small store close to her home. She brings goods from Dushanbe which she purchases from wholesalers. To increase the profits of her business and to attract new customers Fotima wants to expand the number of goods she offers for sale. To finance this she needs to take out a loan. She is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Гозиева Фотима жительница Гиссарского района . Ей 20 лет , она не замужем. Занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Имеет магазин рядом с домом. Привозит товар из города Душанбе , покупая у оптовых продавцов. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 6 лет. Хочет увеличить товарооборот. Для этого ей необходимо получить кредит. Погасить его она сможет в течении 12 месяцев. Если она увеличит ассортимент товара это поможет ей привлечь новых клиентов и принести дополнительный доход.

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua K. sells palm oil. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Afua and her six children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for $300 of additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Mercedonio

texts.es:
Mercedonio lives in San Ignacio, Paraguay, and is married with two young daughters. He dedicates himself to selling articles of clothing and general footwear. He acquires his merchandise in his hometown and in the surrounding areas of Yabebyry, Laureles, Cerrito, etc., with the help of a vehicle. His wife, Eva Rodríguez, helps him with this in San Ignacio, and they hope the activity will help their daughters' education and their family's well-being.

Mercedonio is requesting a loan for the purchase of jackets, athletic footwear and wool jerseys specifically because they are in high demand this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Mercedonio D. P., reside en la ciudad de San Ignacio, casado, tiene 2 hijas menores; se dedica a la venta artículos de ropería y zapatería en general. El reparto de sus mercaderías lo realiza por nuestra ciudad y las zonas de Yabebyry, Laureles, Cerrito etc. para lo cual cuenta con un vehiculo.

Su esposa, Eva Rodríguez, lo ayuda en el reparto por la ciudad de San Ignacio, mediante esta actividad que posee el Sr. Mercedonio sus hijas pueden acceder a la educación de nivel medio y el bienestar de su familia.

Solicitó de este préstamo en nuestra institución para compra de camperas, calzados deportivos, tricotas de lanas específicamente debido a que posee mucha demanda en esta época D. año.

loans.use: Purchase jackets, wool jerseys and athletic footwear / Compra de camperas, tricotas de lana, calzados deportivos.

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser is 53 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She lives in Beirut.

Yasser is a hardworking and ambitious seamstress. She is requesting a loan for an amount of USD 1,200 to purchase fabric and accessories.

This will allow her to continue to provide needed income for her husband and children. Yasser has been a microcredit client of Al Majmoua for the past eight years, a sufficient period of time to build solid trust and confidence.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and accessories

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina is 49 years old. She currently cares for her son, as well as her 90-year-old father. She is very hard-working and, in addition to working at a local enterprise, she dedicates herself to raising chickens. She cares for them after getting home from work, feeding them, and when they are big enough she sells them based on orders she receives. At times, she butchers them herself to sell the meat at a higher price. Albina dedicates the most time to her animals on the weekends, since she doesn’t have to go to work. She must ensure she keeps them in good health because, if she didn’t protect them from disease, she would have difficulty with her sales. Albina has a great motivation to put forth all her efforts towards her work – her fourteen-year-old son. Albina’s dream is to raise not only chickens. She wants to buy some guinea pigs to expand her farm, which is why she is seeking a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Albina tiene 49 años, en la actualidad cuida de su hijo y su anciano padre de 90 años de edad. Es muy trabajadora, además de trabajar para una empresa en su localidad, se dedica a la crianza de pollo, al regresar del trabajo atiende de ellos, dándoles de comer, cuando están bien crecidos y en peso los vende, de acuerdo a los pedidos que le solicitan, a veces ella misma los mata para vender su carne a mayor precio. Son los fines de semana cuando Albina se dedica más a sus animales, ya que no labora en la empresa. Debe prevenir que no tengan enfermedad alguna, porque esto perjudicaría mucho sus ventas. Albina tiene una gran motivación para todo su esfuerzo, su hijo de 14 años. El deseo de Albina no es solo criar pollos, sino también cuyes, por ello que solicita este préstamo para la compra de cuyes y así podrá implementar su granja.

loans.use: In addition to raising chickens, she would like to buy guinea pigs to generate more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of materials for a small motorcycle tire shop.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es:
Silveria tiene 46 años de edad, estudió sexto de primaria, es conviviente, madre de dos hijos menores de 10 y 09 años de edad, vive en el Jr. Arica Nº 1333, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno y es una de las socias antiguas del Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita” en Yunguyo.

Con su crédito inicial de S/.300 compró 05 ovinos para degollar y vender en carne. A los 30 años de edad tuvo su pareja y ambos empezaron el negocio de compra de ovinos para la venta en carne, y a la fecha sigue con ese negocio.

Con este crédito de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 06 cuotas, comprará 03 ovinos, el precio depende del peso del ovino (entre S/.140 a S/.200).

Su sueño es seguir con su negocio, y sobre todo que sus hijos estudien y no estén sin trabajo.
texts.en:
Silveria is a 46 year old woman who completed the sixth grade. She is the mother of two children, ages 10 and 9, and she lives at Jr. Arica number 1333 in Yunguyo. She used her initial loan of 300 soles to purchase 5 sheep which were raised for meat. She met her spouse when she was 30 years old, and of them have worked buying sheep to sell for meat - something that they continue doing to this day. With this 500 sol loan, which they will repay in 6 payments, they will purchase 3 sheep. The price of the sheep depends on the animal's weight (between 140 and 200 soles). Her dream is to continue her business, and above all, ensure that her children attend school and never be without work.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Нурова Дилафруз проживает в городе Яван. Разведена. Живет одна с двумя детьми. Зарабатывает на жизнь , занимаясь торговлей. Имеет небольшой магазин , где торгует продуктами питания. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже5 лет. В данный момент ей необходимо завезти товар , для этого она решила получить кредит , сроком на 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dilafruz N. lives in the town of Yavan. She is divorced and has two children. She earns her living in retail and owns a small grocery store. She has been in this business for 5 years. Currently, Dilafruz decided to obtain a 10-month loan in order to acquire new goods.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Karen Valeria

texts.es:
La joven Karen G. habita en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur dedicándose a su actividad económica de venta de periódicos en su casa de habitación donde es visitada por diferentes personas para la compra de los periódicos emitidos diariamente en Nicaragua.

Es una joven soltera y con muchos deseos de superación ya que se ha destacado como buena estudiante en la universidad.  Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los periódicos para continuar con su actividad económica en su casa de habitación y de esta manera seguir supliendo todas las necesidades que se presentan en su humilde casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Karen G. lives in the San Rafael del Sur neighborhood. Her business activity is selling newspapers in her house where people come to purchase the daily papers of Nicaragua. She is an unmarried, young woman with much desire for self-improvement, since she has stood out as a good student in her university. She has come to Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will allow her to purchase newspapers to continue with her business, through which she will be able to continue covering all of the necessities of her modest household.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of newspapers to sell

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. is a forty year old married woman. She has given birth to five children, four of whom are boys. All her children are currently in school. Two are in the elementary school and the youngest is in the nursery  school. Faustina lives with her family in Nkawkaw, a town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Nkawkaw is a community which is full of business activity. Faustina’s husband owns a provision store. 

Faustina sells smoked fish in the market square. She buys fresh fish and smokes it herself. She also sells some of the fresh fish to the food vendors in her community. She has been in business for four years and has requested a loan to start buying larger quantities of fish in bulk so that she can distribute it to customers in her community.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish in bulk

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana runs her own small firm, manufacturing plastic windows. The windows are very popular as replacements for old, wooden, single-pane windows that are common in many buildings. They offer much better insulation against the cold in the winter and the heat in the summer. Oksana and her husband live in Ordzhonikidze.

Oksana launched this venture with the help of her husband a year ago. They researched the market, noticed growing demand in the market for plastic windows and decided to step in. Oksana says they have not been sorry to have taken the risk. Presently, they have about 70,000 invested in working capital. Monthly profit exceeds 4,000 Grivnas a month.

Oksana is seeking a 5,000 Grivna loan to purchase additional window fittings for her production unit. Oksana is only getting started with the expansion and development of her business. She wants to keep the benefits her customers have enjoyed before: free delivery services and a flexible discount system. Moreover, Oksana is hoping to grow her business and be able to offer additional jobs for the unemployed in her town as there are many who were downsized due to the volatile economic situation in the country.

loans.use: To purchase window fittings

loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
S., 38, has been running a business raising ducks for eggs for a long time. As another income, he also plants a few vegetables next to his house. He is married with three children who are still single; one of them is employed as a garment worker. His wife is a good homemaker, cooking tasty meals and caring for the children.

The rice harvesting season is coming, S. needs to borrow a loan to buy rice from farmers to stock and later sell to gain income. He will use the remainder of the loan for growing vegetables.

loans.use: To buy rice from farmers and sell for income

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris tiene 46 años y vive con su hijo de 13 años. Desde hace 3 años empezó a generarse un ingreso económico a través de su tienda, la cual atiende todos los días durante la mañana, en ella no solo vende abarrotes, sino también carne de pollo y de carnero; y por las tardes vende comida al paso en las afueras de su casa. Doris disfruta cada día de su trabajo, porque le permite estar en su misma casa y estar al tanto de las necesidades de su hogar y de su hijo. Doris desea impulsar su negocio e implementarlo con más productos para que poco a poco pueda crecer hasta llegar a ser una distribuidora de alimentos.
