Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a realizar un trabajo solidario en su banco comunal para el bienestar de todos sus integrantes. El dinero que solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería para su tienda, para surtirla de otros productos e inclusive diversas bebidas.
texts.en:
Doris is 46 years old and lives with her 13-year-old son. Three years ago she started earning money through her store, which she runs every morning. She does not just sell groceries, but also chicken and mutton. In the afternoon she sells prepared food outside her house. Doris enjoys her work every day, because it allows her to be at home and stay on top of her responsibilities at home and with her son. Doris wants to improve her business and broaden her products so that she can slowly grow to be a food distributor. This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises to collaborate with her community bank to promote the well-being of all of its members. The money that she is requesting is to be invested in purchasing merchandise for her store, adding products and even a variety of beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Broaden the range of merchandise offered by store

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. is a 35 year-old mother of three. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. They live in the capital town of the province, San Jose, Antique, but her husband is driving a pedicab in the other town, Hamtic.

She applied for this loan to buy a secondhand motorcycle to be attached to the pedicab for her husband’s convenience in going to Hamtic, and to increase his income. She is hoping that, in the future, they can establish a motorcycle with sidecar.

She also wants to save money for the education of her two children who are already in their secondary school, and one in his elementary grade. She dreams of sending them to a university and building a better house in the future.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcyle for her husband's pedicab

loans.name: Toli

texts.en:
Toli F., 33, is married with 4 children. She has 5 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village and the general public 2 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 120 Tala (~58 USD). SPBD loans are Toli’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, a knife, a rake, a spade and weed killer

loans.name: Lwebukona B Atwine Bwesise Group

texts.en: Atwine B. is a lady of 30 years. She is married with four children, three of them schooling and she is looking after one dependent. She has been in retail business for over eight years. She is using the loan to purchase stock such as sugar, salt, soap, coffee, basins, cups, sweets, plates, saucepans, etc. She is a hardworking woman whose dream is to work hard and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase stock that is sugar, salt, soap, coffee, basins, cups, sweets, plates, saucepans, etc.

loans.name: Marina Karina

texts.en:
Maria Karina A. owns a mini-mart in the city Guyaybi. She sells beverages and foodstuffs as well as basic necessities and sweets, cookies and dairy products.

Maria also sells cell phone credits as well as cards and accessories for cell phones. She has many clients and generates a good income. Maria has good references and is professional.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Concepción C. labora es una dama emprendedora que logró montar su propia panadería en la ciudad de Masaya donde atiende a diario a sus clientes que le visitan para comprar el pan de cada día.

Ella ha decidido acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de harina, leña, sartenes, manteca y otros para la elaboración del pan. Por esta razón es que ella espera muy confiadamente en Ceprodel para que se le brinde su crédito y de esta manera mejorar su situación económica y sacar adelante su panadería.
texts.en:
Concepción C. is an enterprising woman who was able to open her own bakery in the city of Masaya where she attends to her clients who visit daily to purchase her bread. She has decided to seek out Ceprodel to solicit a loan to purchase flour, wood, pans, butter, and other items needed to make bread. For this reason she waits confidently for Ceprodel to grant her a loan to be able to improve her economic situation and move her bakery forward.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, wood, pans, butter, and other items.

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men V. is a 47-year-old farmer and mother. She was blessed with two kids, both of whom are attending the public high school. Her husband, Oun Meng, is 49 and works in the farming business. Men V. inherited the farmland where she and her husband grow different kinds of crops from her grandmother. In the past, Men V. has always hired the neighbor’s cow in order to alleviate the chore of plowing the farmland. Right now, she hopes to buy her own cow and that is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva. This will provide her with an additional fixed asset.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Oum

texts.en:
Oum S., 41, has been involved in a business of selling firewood with a typical income of US $1.30 per day in Takeo Province since 2005. S. and her husband work very hard every day to ensure a comfortable standard of living for the family. She and her husband are blessed with a lovely young child who has not enrolled in school yet. Her husband is employed with a construction building company with a typical income of US $4.60 per day.

S. really wants to take a loan of US $700 to purchase cows to raise for sale and to help her in farming with her rice fields. By doing this, she hopes that she will be able to generate a better income to cover her family expenses as well as for savings to support her child’s future education.

loans.use: buying cows

loans.name: Yesenia Katherin

texts.es:
La señora YESENIA KATHERIN B. S., tiene 19 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Mar y Cielo II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, y no pudo continuar con estudios técnicos o superiores debido a que quedo embarazada. 
YESENIA, se dedica a la comercialización de quesos, roscas, quesillo, manjarblanco, kinkones.
Este primer crédito de 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de mas productos lácteos, los cuales los venderá en Trujillo de puerta de puerta.

YESENIA, sueña con tener un local donde pueda vender sus productos lácteos al por mayor y generar más ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Yesenia Katherin B. S. is 19 years old. She lives in the District of Esperanza, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Mar y Cielo II” (Sea & Sky II).

This entrepreneur completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She did not continue on to pursue any higher education because she became pregnant. Yesenia sells hard cheese, string cheese, cream cheese, and manjar blanco. In addition, she sells a dessert called kinkones (translated as “King Kong Cookies” – it is a layered cookie that contains fillings of peanuts, pineapple, and manjar blanco).

She is requesting her first loan in the amount of 300 soles. She plans to purchase more dairy products, which she will sell in Trujillo door-to-door. Yesenia dreams of having a vending post where she can sell dairy products wholesale and generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy products for resale

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero, 57 years old and married with five children, bakes and sells cakes. In this business since 1979, she hopes for the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more baking material. Vero says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baking material

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en: Restituta J. is 46 years old who lives in Tagbilaran City, Bohol with her husband and their 4 children. She is a fish vendor. One of her dreams in life is to send her children to school and hopefully be able to finance schooling until they graduate. Restituta is a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. Her previous loans went to fishnets and other fishing gears. Now she is applying for a loan of Php17, 000 to add to her capital. This loan will help Restituta and her husband in their fishing business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima J. is from the village of Dullan. She is 41 years old. Prima is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Prima owns & operates a fruit vending business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits in the local community. Prima has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Prima joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Prima has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Prima is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Prima from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Delmi Cecilia

texts.es: Delmi Cecilia A. de 46 años de edad reside en Huizucar en el departamento de La Libertad, Delmi vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos Maura de 12 años y Hugo de 9 años de edad, ambos estudiantes de básica. El esposo de Delmi es empleado púbico y ella trabaja en su negocio hace once años, el cual tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal de Santa Tecla donde vende cereales y otros productos, ella solicita de un crédito porque desea surtir su negocio con verduras y granos básicos.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a businesswoman trading in Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials, selling mostly through hawking, a  method that moves her merchandise very quickly,  A 65-year divorced mother of seven grown children, Ama is very supportive of her family through her trading business which she has been operating for about 20 years now. Through the purchase of bulk torn cloth to increase her inventory, she hopes the loan will enable her to strengthen the business and make larger profits. Ama would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas clothes in bulk to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es:
La venta de repuestos para bicicletas es la actividad a la que se dedica el señor José Ernesto G. en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur desde hace cuatro años. Ha adquirido mucha habilidad en la reparación de bicicletas y por esto es muy visitado por los clientes tanto para reparar sus bicicletas como para comprar los repuestos.

El crédito que solicita es para la compra de los repuestos y  accesorios para las bicicletas para así comercializarlas y cuando un cliente le compre tales repuestos lograr instalarlo en dicha bicicleta. Es por este motivo que espera en que el crédito le será otorgado y así logrará continuar desempeñándose en su actividad.
texts.en:
José Ernesto G. has sold bicycle replacement parts in the town of San Rafael del Sur for the past four years. He has learned much about bicycle repairs and this is why he is visited by many customers both to have their bicycles repaired and to buy replacement parts. The financing he is requesting will be used to buy replacement parts and accessorieis for bicycles to sell and, when a customer buys said parts, to install them on their bicycles. For this reason he hopes that the loan will be approved so that he can continue to develop in his chosen line of work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bicycle replacement parts.

loans.name: Catalina Sobeyda

texts.es:
Con una alegre sonrisa, la señora Catalina R. atiende su negocio de venta de productos de madera y artesanías tales como hamacas, mesas, sombreros, canastos, entre otros.
Ella a diario vende desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana  y siempre busca la manera de cómo ir superando en su actividad. Es por esta razón que ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos artesanales y de madera para ofrecerlo a sus clientes y así continuar generando ingresos para el mantenimiento de su humilde hogar de habitación.
texts.en:
Catalina R.'s cheerful smile is ever-present when she tends to customers in her crafts shop. She sells wood crafts and other crafts like: hammocks, tables, hats, baskets, etc. From very early in the morning she is at her stall and always seeks ways to improve her line of work. For this reason she has called upon Ceprodel to request financing to buy more handicrafts and wooden crafts to offer for sale thereby continuing to generate income to support her humble abode.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood handicrafts and other crafts

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Lien T. T. ( id: 010117050056) is 27 years old. She sells aluminum and glass doors. She lives with her husband and child. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. She has been a member of SEDA for two years and repays her loans on time. This time, she wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND ($270 USD) to invest in her business. Her group consists of:
  • Hoa T. N. ( id: 010117050048) is 39 years old. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND ($270 USD) to breed pigs and poultry.
  • Phuong T. N. ( id: 010117050054) is 34 years old. She wants to borrow 4.578.000 VND ($245 USD) to buy and sell iron scrap.
  • Nhai T. T. ( id: 010117050055) is 44 years old. She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND ($225 USD) to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra Elizabeth P. O. de 24 años de edad, reside en Zacatecoluca, departamento de La Paz. Vive junto a su compañera de vida el cual trabaja como policía y su hijo de 6 años de edad el cual estudia en el Kinder Nacional de Zacatecoluca. Sandra posee una venta de sabanas, trastes, baterías de cocina y todo lo relacionado con el uso del hogar. Ella vende sus productos al crédito o al contado y cuenta con varios clientes fijos  con los cuales sabe que tiene una venta segura. Es por esto que Sandra solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar su producto al por mayor, y de esta manera tener más que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Sandra es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual goza de muy buenas referencias, ya que se destaca por ser muy responsable e ingeniosa, quien siempre esta velando por el bienestar de su hijo.
texts.en:
Sandra Elizabeth P. O. is 24 years old and lives in Zacatecoluca, La Paz. She lives with her life partner, who works as a police officer, and their 6-year old child, who studies in the National Kindergarten of Zacatecoluca. Sandra has a business selling sheets, utensils, kitchen tools and everything related to home use. She sells products on credit and cash sales, and has various steady customers, for which reason she feels the business is secure. Sandra requests a loan so that she can purchase products in bulk, and in this way offer more to her customers. Sandra is a hard-working woman, who enjoys many good references. Those that stand out are that she is very responsible and clever, always watching over the wellbeing of her child.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Furkat

texts.en:
Furkat has always distinguished himself as being a very hard working person and devoted to his family, who are his role models. Ever since he was young, his parents taught him about honest work and responsibility, virtues that he has adopted for himself. Furkat manages his own business, a grocery store. He started it 3 years ago after the mechanic\'s shop where he worked closed down, when he found himself needing his own way to support his family. 

Thanks to his business, Furkat has been able to help his family. Today he requests a loan in the amount of $2600 USD. He needs you and through your generosity you can help him expand his business so that he may continue to support his children's education. Please help them by becoming part of the development of his small business. Furkat will sincerely thank you.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Expand store inventory

loans.name: Rose Auma

texts.en: Rose Auma O. is married and blessed with three children. She runs a tailoring business in Manyole, Busia district. She started this business in 2009, and buys her stock thrice a month from Nambale town. She would like a loan of 10,000 KES, which she will use to expand her business by increasing her stock. Her plan is to ensure economic stability for her family, with a special concern for the education of her children and orphans.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her tailoring business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria S. is from the village of Villa Felipa, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Victoria owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Victoria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her 6th from HSPFI. Victoria chooses a lower loan amount due to the change in climate in their place. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.en: Sokhna N. is 45 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGOSCOP for nine years and has always paid back her loans on time. Like many other women in her village, she raises cattle and sheep, which she then sells at the grand market of nearby Bambey. In addition, she sells grain and peanuts. This loan will allow her to buy two young cattle. The revenues from selling them at the market will allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase two cattle

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie N. is from the village of Panay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Julie is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Julie owns & operates a business operating motor transport services. Julie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Julie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Julie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Julie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth M. is a 43 year old, married woman who lives in Brgy Suba, Bayawan City, Negros Occidental. She earns a living through her general store.

Maribeth’s husband, Jose Rickman, is a 43 year old seaman.  They have 4 children between the ages of 4 and 21. Three of them currently go to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Maribeth joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by running a general store. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000.

Maribeth is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 was used to fund the operations of her general store, and had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 5th loan of Php 15,000, which she intends to use on her general store. Maribeth is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: to provide additional working capital

loans.name: Kitsao

texts.en:
Kitsao C. is 32 years old. He is married to Margaret C. and they are blessed with two children. He is a businessman operating a retail shop in the Coast Bamba market in Kilifi district.

Kitsao joined KADET, a Kiva partner, four months ago and now he is ready for his first loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings. His monthly profit is Kshs 4,200 but he also relies on his spouse’s income to supplement other needs. He has been in the business for the last three years. He plans to buy flour, sugar and tea leaves and renovate the business with the funds from this loan. 

Kitsao has never taken loan from any other microfinance institution and was introduced to KADET by a World Vision staff member. He hopes that the loan will boost his business and one day he will become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar and tea leaves and to renovate the business premises

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio C. C. tiene 58 años, es casada,  tiene  7 hijos que se llaman Holger de 35, Oswaldo de 30,  Walter de 25, Estela de 24, Miguel de 21, Maria de 20 y Manuel de 17 años  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Gregorio trabaja en la agricultura toda su vida como principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son el maíz, papas, arbeja, fréjol.   Vende los productos en la ciudad de Guayaquil cada año.
Gregorio solicita el crédito para comprar ureas, abonos y pagar jornales de los trabajos.  Su meta es  construir unos invernaderos.   Los desafíos que enfrentan son que en tiempo de cosechas los precios se ponen muy bajos. Gregorio manifiesta que en su comunidad celebran a San Francisco y cuando no hay mucho trabajo salen a pasear
texts.en:
Gregorio C. C. is 58 years old, married, and has seven children named Holger (age 35), Oswaldo (age 30), Walter (age 25), Estela (age 24), Miguel (age 21), Maria (age 20), and Manuel (age 17). They live in the town of San Francisco de Rumí, which is 1½ hours from San Miguel Canton in the Province of Bolivar.

Gregorio is a member of the Communal Bank “San Francisco de Rumí Pamba”. The group consists of 25 members, most of whom are engaged in agriculture. Gregorio has been farming all of his life as the main source of income for his family. Among the crops grown in the area are corn, potatoes, peas, and beans. He sells his products in the city of Guayquil every year.

Gregorio is requesting a loan to buy urea and compost, as well as pay the salaries of his workers. His goal is to build a few greenhouses. The challenges he faces include harvesting his crops when prices are low. Gregorio says that his community of San Francisco celebrates when there is no work left to be completed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase urea & compost; pay his workers' salaries

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila N., from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur, is a 60-year-old widow with two adult-aged children. To make a living, Lucila owns and operates a business venture manufacturing and selling clothing products to local businesses and community members. Engaged in her business for over 20 years, she earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lucila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products, Lucila is requesting a new loan, her fifth, of 15000 PHP to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalena C. is from the town of Albur. She is 55 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Magdalena owns and operates a bakery, and sells a variety of baked goods in the local community. Ma. Magdalena has been engaged in her business for over eight years.
Ma. Magdalena joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her first from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

About CEVI
Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: José Armengol

texts.es:
El señor José Armengol L. P., tiene la edad de 37 años de edad, es casado, con sus 3 hijos adolecentes habitan en el populoso barrio Medardo Andino, su esposa se dedica a la agricultura, sus hijos apoyan a sus padres en los trabajos del hogar y la finca, tienen 11 años e dedicarse a la siembra de los cultivos de pithaya.

Dentro de los trabajos diarios que se tiene que realizar para preparar el terreno con las labores de arado, rastra, delineado y hoyado, cuida de la maleza y eliminacion de plagas y enfermedades que suelen afectar el suelo y dañar la cosecha. Este proceso productivo es muy costoso, ya que se requiere de comprar muchos insumos químicos necesarios para fertilizar el suelo. Y este a sido uno de los principales problemas que ha tenido, la falta de financiamiento, que no le permite la compra de insumos y materiales agrícolas, que brinden un mejor mantenimiento a sus terrenos, esta es la razón del préstamo, esto le traerá a un plazo mediano la posibilidad de mejorar sus condiciones económicas sobre todo que su hijo mayor está estudiando la universidad y los aranceles le han obstaculizado los planes de culminación de los semestres. Por tanto espera se le apoye a mejorar sus niveles de vida para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Señor José Armengol L. P. is 37 years of age. He is married, with 3 adolescent children. They live in the populous neighborhood Medardo Andino. His wife is dedicated to agriculture. His children support their parents in the work of the home and the farm. For 11 years they have been dedicated to the cultivation of pithaya (fruit of a variety of cactus, also known as dragon fruit). Among the daily tasks that he must perform are plowing, raking, marking lines and making holes for planting, weeding and eliminating pests and diseases that affect the soil and damage the crop. This production process is very costly, since it is necessary to buy many chemical supplies to fertilize the soil. And this has been one of the main problems that he has had, namely the lack of financing, which prevents him from purchasing supplies and agricultural materials to provide better maintenance to their lands. This is the reason for the loan. For a moderate period, It will provide him the possibility of improving their economic condition. Above all he is concerned that his older son is studying at the university and the fees they have kept him from completing some semesters. Therefore he hopes to support him to improve his standards of living for the welfare of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies and materials for growing pithaya (cactus fruit)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay for personal & educational expenses

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy M. is from the village of Umayco, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Nancy is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Nancy owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Nancy has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nancy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nancy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Nancy is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Nancy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Ammie

texts.en: Ammie D. is from the village of San Jose, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 38 years old and is married with three adult children. Ammie owns and operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,800 PHP a month. In 2008, Ammie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to repair the vehicle used in her business. This loan will be her 4th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair the vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Cuong

texts.en: Cuong V. N. is 29 years old. He has two small children. As a farmer, he has grown rice and vegetables and has raised pigs for years. The agricultural products are used to meet his family's food demand. A part of the food is sold to earn income. Since he became our client, his weekly repayments are prompt. Currently, he wants to request a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy food for pigs and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. She lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Aisha has a business selling roasted food like potatoes, cassava, and maize. She has been in this business for over ten years, and works seven days a week. She sells her products at the market, retail, and her main business challenge is transportation.

Aisha has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sweet potatoes, maize, bananas and cassava. Her goal and aspiration for her business is to own a delivery van.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sweet potatoes, maize, bananas and cassava

loans.name: Jovanny Josué .

texts.es:
El cliente Jovanny Josué V. R.. Vive en el municipio santa Rosa Del Peño Del sine 50 varas al oeste departamento león, tiene 2 hijo a su cargo trabaja actual mente en la alcaldía santa Rosa del peñón desempeña el cargo como ayudante de camión. 
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación en mal estado, propia el cual el destino del crédito es para la mejora de su vivienda.  
El destino del crédito es para la compra de una Puerta para el mejoramiento de su vivienda. 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en:
Jovanny Josué V. R. lives in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón in the department of León and has 2 children.  He is currently working for the Santa Rosa del Peñón town hall as a delivery truck assistant.  

He is requesting a loan to make improvements to his house as it is in poor condition.  He will purchase a door as this will improve his living conditions and maintain the well-being of his family.

loans.use: To purchase a door

loans.name: Cinthya Isabel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla y Cuna de Eloy Alfaro el Viejo Luchador.

La señora Cinthya lleva en el Banco Comunal 4 años y está muy contenta, nos dice que lo que más le gusta son las reuniones ya que en ellas se divierte con sus amigas. Tiene 23 años de edad, esta casada y tiene un hijo de dos años. Su marido trabaja de obrero. Ella tiene titulo de profesora de nivel primario.

Trabaja de docente en una escuela de la localidad, también es comerciante de productos de Avon, Esika (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas), trabaja todos los días en las mañanas en su escuela ya que les vende a sus compañeras y en las tardes sale a recorrer por la ciudad de Montecristi, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente o cada quince días.

Este crédito es para comprar mas de su mercadería ya que tiene varios pedidos para este mes.
 
Sus sueños son seguir su licenciatura y terminar su carrera.
texts.en:
The Aníbal San Andrés Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Cantón Montecristi, the place famous for its straw hats and the birthplace of Eloy Alfaro, the “Old Warrior.”
Cinthya has been a member of the communal bank for 4 years and is very happy. She tells us that her favourite part is the meetings because she has a good time with her friends.
She is 23 years old, married and has a two-year-old child. Her husband works as a labourer. She is certified as an elementary school teacher.
She works as a teacher in a local school, and also sells Avon and Esika products (beauty products, perfume and women’s accessories). She works at the school in the morning, selling to her colleagues. In the afternoon she goes around Montecristo, selling on credit and collecting payments every one to two weeks.
She will use this loan to buy merchandise given that she has a lot of orders this month.
Her dream is to continue and to finish her degree.

loans.use: Purchase of creams, perfume, jewelry and cosmetics

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a single man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

He has operated a charcoal-selling business for over one year, selling as retail and from home to restaurant operators, neighbors and passersby. Joel faces the challenge of competition from other charcoal sellers and also poor quality of charcoal, leading to low sales volume. He hopes to expand his business from retail to wholesale in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase bags of charcoal. Joel decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan is use to buy cotton material and shoes

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene P. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 35 years old and single. To make a living, Arlene runs a sari-sari (variety) shop, where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and convenience food in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for more than  2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Arlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and electricity bills.

For the past ten years, she has been running a school whereby the neighboring children are her potential customers. In addition she operates a Kikoi sales business which contributes to her other source of income. Beatrice faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her school in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of Kikois for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of Kikois (wraps) for resale.

loans.name: Fevita

texts.en:
Fevita A. is from the village of Mapuroc San Mateo. She is 49 years old, married and has 3 adult children. Fevita owns & operates a livestock business, raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP every four months.

In 2010, Fevita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Dama Masha

texts.en:
Dama Masha B. is a 55 year-old lady from Mtwapa. She is married to Dio Dzombo and together they are blessed with three children. Her husband is a business man who owns a retail shop. 

Dama is a charcoal dealer and she has been in this business for the last three years. This being her first loan from KADET, she intends to purchase more sacks of charcoal for sale. 

The anticipated profits will be reinvested into the business. Dama’s hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Markus

texts.en:
Markus is a 48-year-old farmer who is living in Liliba Village. He started farming back in 1994. Besides farming, Markus also works as a builder to generate additional income for his family. 

Markus is the father of three children, namely: Desy, who is 15 and studying in the first grade of Senior high school; George, who is 9 and studying in the third grade of elementary school; and Felix, who is aged 2. As the head of the household, Markus is responsible for the happiness of his family. He would do anything that he can for his family. 

Markus plants mustard greens, 'kangkung' (leafy vegetable), peanuts and corn on his farm. As a farmer, Markus relies on the weather to succeed with his harvest. The erratic weather and limited capital have been a challenge for Markus as a farmer. Sometimes he has to suffer from failure at harvest time because of the bad weather, and he couldn’t replace the damaged plants. 

Markus really wants to improve his business by purchasing more seeds and a water pump to support him in watering the plants. To do so, Markus is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. He believes that the loan will bring a positive change to his business.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and water pump

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda D. is from the village of Flores, Naguilian, Isabela. She is 39 years old. Belinda is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Belinda raises livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Belinda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Belinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Belinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Belinda is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Belinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Ángela Piedad

texts.es:
Cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Para  Superar en el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto, rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y es visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela, ella tiene 45 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 25, 24 y 16 años los mismos que aun viven en su casa, el menor estudia en colegio. El marido se dedica a la pesca.
 
Tiene un pequeño comedor en el mercado de San Jacinto, en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja sola de lunes a sabados desde las 05h00 hasta las  a las dos de la tarde. Nos cuenta que tiene su comedor por años y que siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos, su especialidad son los mariscos ya que es un plato muy apetecido por los turistas que acuden  a este hermoso lugar.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos y así estar preparada para la temporada de carnaval que espera que sea muy buena. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cuatro ciclos  y le gusta porque los créditos le permite financiarse cuando ella lo necesita. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y algún dia comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the Communal Bank "Esperanza Para Superar" (The Hope To Go Beyond) meet in the splendid seaside resort of San Jacinto, surrounded by a lovely beach where the River Portoviejo meets the sea. The resort is visited by many tourists, locals and foreigners alike.

Here we met Señora Ángela. She is 45 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and has three children, aged 25, 24 and 16. They still live at home, and the youngest attends secondary school. Her husband is a fisherman.

She has a small restaurant at the market in San Jacinto, where she serves delicious dishes. She works alone from Monday to Saturday from 5 a.m. to 2 p.m. She has had her restaurant for several years and has done very well, because her customers like the taste of her dishes. Her specialty is seafood and is in high demand from tourists who come to this beautiful place.

This loan will be used to buy rice, meat, fish and other ingredients for food preparation, ahead of the carnival season which will hopefully be very profitable. She has had four loan cycles from the Communal Bank and is very happy because the loans allow her to finance her activity when she needs it. Her goal is to progress in her business and someday buy a car.

loans.use: To buy rice, fish, meat, seafood and other ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania, de 53 años, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Bernabé de 59 años y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. Junto a su esposo, Epifania trabaja todos los días en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra de todo, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de muy buena calidad. Ella principalmente siembra papa, alfalfa y arveja, ya que estos productos se están vendiendo muy bien en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas, lleva 35 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde vende sus productos. Para el futuro de su negocio, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito la ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es una socia, muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa.
Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Epifania, age 53, is a humble and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Bernabé, age 59. What she desires most is to work hard so that she can get ahead in life. Together with her husband, Epifania works every day tending to her crops. Through her efforts, her land has generated productive returns. Now that she has planted everything, she knows that all of her products will be of good quality. Her main crops are potatoes, alfalfa, and peas. These products sell very well at the market. What she enjoys most about her work is protecting her crops from diseases that could affect them. Epifania has been farming for 35 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her crops to the wholesale market in Tarma where they are sold. For the future of her business, she wants to buy additional farmland so that she can increase her production.

This is her ninth loan with MFP. Epifania believes this loan will be a great help in developing her business. She is known in her Communal Bank as a very responsible member, a distinction of which she is proud. The loan of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy compost to improve the productivity of her land.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of compost.

loans.name: Zaib's Group

texts.en:
Zaib lives in Khanewal, which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living in the area of Marzipura in a two-room brick house with her family for the past 15 years. She is married to M. N. who works for the Pakistan railway for a low income. To fulfill the basic needs of the family, and to financially assist her husband, Zaib does sewing and embroidery work for neighborhood clients. The money she earns helps pay the utility bills and cover other household expenses.

Zaib has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to further improve her business. With this loan, she will purchase clothes and embroidery materials such as beads and colored thread to fulfill the orders of her customers on time and to increase her income. She has been in this business for the past five years and is very sure that an investment will definitely be helpful to her in improving her business.

Zaib is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She has built a good credit record in the previous loan year and never missed any meeting. In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Zaib.

loans.use: to buy clothes and embroidery material.

loans.name: Orfelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Rumichaca,  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Orfelia; es  casada, la socia tiene 43 años de edad; la socia tiene 4 hijos de (17, 15, 13 y 7) años de edad, la socia  se dedica al comercio minorista, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración y atención de sus tienda de abarrotes, la socia es muy querida en el pueblo y abastece su tienda de abarrotes para poder tener todo al alcance de la mano de sus vecinos, la socia es una persona muy trabajadora y siempre está implementando su tienda con todos los artículos que se requiera, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de mercadería para poder incrementar sus ventas y dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus menores hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Manos Juntas Rumichaca-Alta” (Hands Together Rumichaca-Alta).  This bank is located in the town of Rumichaca in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.  

The member is Ofelia; she is married and is 43-years-old.  The member has four children or 17, 15, 13, and seven years of age.  The member works selling retail.  She alternates her home activities with the administration and attention to her grocery store.  The member is very well-liked in the town and stocks her grocery store to have everything available to her neighbors.  The member is a very hard-working person and is always filling her store with all of the items required.  On this occasion, the member would like to invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise to be able to increase her sales and give a better quality of life to her younger children.  The member is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise.  

The member is very grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payments of the said loan in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina N. lives in the Kyebando neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. For the past year she has made a living by selling clothes. She works six days a week, selling her products by going door to door. She is applying for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second clothes. Her main challenges are transportation and theft, but she hopes to see her business grow large and become an importer. She owns her home, but it does not have electricity or piped-in water.  Her biggest monthly expenses are food, school fees and medicines.

loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is a thirty-seven-year-old married man with nine children.  They live in a semi permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He is the sole breadwinner for his family.  His dream is to educate his children to attain degrees as minimum qualification.  

Abdul works as both a carpenter and a motorcycle rider and has been in these businesses for twelve years.  He faces challenges in the irregularity of sales.   His desire is to have at least five motorcycles and also to improve his furniture shop.  Abdul needs a loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 51-year-old married man and the father of five children from Al Ashrafieh, Jordan.

Yousef owns a carpentry business. He is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD to purchase more equipment for production. Yousef aspires to enlarge his business.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for production.

loans.name: Sri Cendana Group

texts.en:
Like many Balinese women, Ni Ketut and the other members of the Sri Cendana group breed pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes.  Through many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to care for pigs to maximize income. 

Ni Ketut hopes that, through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs.  Ni Ketut will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork roll.  

With her profits, she will help support her family of three by supplementing the income of her husband.  Ultimately, Ni Ketut hopes that increased income will enable her to buy more pigs and further expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Santos Valentin

texts.es: Santos Valentín tiene 42 años, tiene su actividad que es brindar el servicio de barbería y vulcanizacion. Hace más de 16 años que administra este negocio, la experiencia obtenida en su trabajo le ha brindado el desempeño que sus clientes le solicitan. El negocio está ubicado en su vivienda, ya que no tiene mucha competencia en este negocio lo que le proporciona los ingresos necesarios. El financiamiento para la compra de espumas, peines, maquinas para resurar, talcos y cuchillas  entre otros.
texts.en: Santos Valentín, 42, is a barber.  He’s run his business for over 16 years.  The experience he’s gained at work has led to his customers seeking him out.  The business is home-based.  Because he does not have much competition in this business it generates sufficient income.  The loan is to buy rubber marking crayon, tires and tire removers, among others.

loans.use: to buy combs, hair products, scissors and talcum powder.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s Punjabi food restaurant business. He operates his restaurant in the market. He sells Punjabi food items called Nan chanay & Biryani at reasonable rates. He is very good in his dealings and has a good number of clients. 

With the loan, he will buy the required ingredients such as cooking oil, spices, lentils, rice etc to be able to cook good food and in a bigger quantity to offer to his clients. 

Farzana is a housewife who spends most of her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities.

Her husband has been operating his business for the past 12 years and has a good name in his area for his good quality services. Farzana is confident that an investment will help him attract new clients and retain his current customers by providing better quality food to them.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Farzana.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for a Punjabi food restaurant business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina  lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister and mother). 

Regina has a retail shop.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Regina sells her products in her shop, retail. Regina has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. She also generates additional income through her pay phone and selling milk.

The main business challenges for Regina include ever increasing prices of commodities and  transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and to build rental rooms.  Regina lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nawaogbzanga Group

texts.fr:
Mme Angèle est la représentante du groupe NAWAOGBZANGA. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé à 10 ans et le moins âgé à 02ans.03 de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle à 5 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des condiments  et légumes depuis 04 ans, les autres membres du groupe son des tisseuses. Mme Angèle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10. Ses clients sont les femmes; les hommes et ses voisins.

Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter 01 sac d’oignons,01 sac de tomate fraîche et quelques épices.

Ses économies servent  à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle a comme ambitions assurer la scolarité de ses enfants, se doter d’une moto pour faciliter son déplacement dans le cadre de son activité.
texts.en:
Mme Angèle is the representative of the NAWAOGBZANGA group. She is married and the mother of 4 children. The oldest is 10 and the youngest two years old. Three of her children go to school. She is responsible for supporting five persons. 

She has been selling condiments and vegetables for four years. The other members of this group are weavers. Mme Angèle buys her goods at the Secteur 10 market. Her customers are women, men and her neighbors. 

With the loan she wants to buy one sack of onions, one sack of ripe tomatoes, and some spices. 

Her savings will be used to pay school fees for her children. Her ambitions are to insure the school fees of her children and to buy herself a motorbike to make it easier to get around for her business needs.

loans.use: to buy one sack of onions, one sack of ripe tomatoes, and some spices.

loans.name: Glenda Elyzabeth

texts.es:
Doña Glenda se dedica al negocio de venta de cosmeticos y venta de ropa, con ochos años en las ventas, pues ha logrado captar clientes y esta contenta por poder apoyar  a su esposo y  asus dos pequeños hijos. Su esposo labora como cadete de taxi.
Para ella no ha sido facil, ya que los productos que vende son de Avon y muchos clientes no le han pagado, teniendo perdidas. Pero ha seguido adelante. Gracias a prestamo que Afodenic ha otorgado en ocho ciclos, de los cuales ha comprado mas ropa variada y mas pedidos.
Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento invertira en ropa de dama, caballeros,niños y cosmeticos de la Avon en perfume, vanidad, cremas, pintura de labios, lapiz de ceja, brillos de labios para niños, entre otros productos que se vendan.
texts.en:
Doña Glenda has been selling cosmetics and clothing for eight years. She has been able to attract customers and is pleased to have the support of her husband and their two young children. Her husband works as a taxi driver.

Her work has not been easy. She sells Avon products and has had many customers who did not pay, thereby resulting in losses. However, she continued to press forward. Thanks to the eight loans she received from AFODENIC, Glenda was able to buy more clothing of various types so that she could fulfill more orders.

Today she is requesting a new loan to invest in clothing for women, men, and children. Glenda will also purchase Avon cosmetics such as perfumes, compacts, crèmes, lipsticks, eyebrow pencils, lip gloss for children, and other products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Joweria

texts.en:
Joweria is 17 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Joweria has a business of selling charcoal, which she has had for 1 year.         

To help expand her business, Joweria has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase charcoal for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Joweria hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself.  In the future, Joweria hopes to expand her business.   Joweria is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improve her business that has helped her go to school.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Yolanda Breatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. Yolanda es socia del banco comunal Gualaceñitas, viven por el cantón Gualaceo. Este cantón es muy visitado por su armonía, el encanto y la calidez de una ciudad antigua y moderna, tiene una gastronomía muy variada, su gente no pierden sus tradiciones, se dedican a la elaboración de artesanías y lo más importante son personas cálidas y amables.

La Señora. Yolanda tiene 56 años es divorciada en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad, trabajan y le ayudan económicamente. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Yolanda se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida rápida, tiene su propio negocio y labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es el segundo crédito que realiza nuestra socia en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos como pan, carne, salchichas, papas, aceite, servilletas etc. para continuar con su negocio
 
Su sueño es de viajar a Panamá.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Gualaceñitas community bank whose members live in Gualaceo canton.  This canton is very popular with visitors owing to the charm and warmth of a city which is both ancient and modern.  The local cuisine is wide ranging and the local people have not lost their traditions.  They make handicrafts and, most importantly, they are warm and kind people.

Yolanda is 56 years old, divorced, and has two children from her marriage who are grown up, work and help her financially.  She does not own her own home but lives in a rental house.

Yolanda makes and sells fast food.  She has her own business and works from Sunday to Sunday.  She does not work fixed hours.

This is the second loan that our member has requested through her community bank and she will invest it in buying products such as bread, meat, sausages, potatoes, oil, napkins, etc. in order to continue in her business.  Her dream is to travel to Panama.

loans.use: to buy bread, meat, sausages, potatoes, oil, napkins, etc.

loans.name: Alovsat

texts.ru: Alovsat rodilsya v 1978 qodu. Uje 8 let kak on zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Alovsat jenat i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v shkole. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmete so svoyey jenoy i lubimimi detmi. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva molochnogo produkta, On delayet sir, yogurt i kefir iz moloka, prodayet ix v magazini.
texts.en: Alovsat was born in 1978.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for eight years and breeds cattle.  Alovsat is married and has two children, both of whom attend school.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his wife and beloved children.  Alovsat currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle in order to increase the volume of milk product.  He makes cheese, yogurt and buttermilk from milk, and sells these products to stores.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua is a married woman. She has five children with four currently enrolled in school. Mwanamvua operates a community health business and sells her goods door-to-door. She's worked in this business for 10 years and her primary customers are neighbors and passersby. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transportation and her largest monthly expense is school fees. 

Mwanamvua will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy containers of drugs. Mwanamvua aspires to own a community health center in the future. She joined Yehu to access working capital while paying lower interest compared with other organizations.

loans.use: To buy containers of drugs.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 36-years-old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. Ahmed has been working hard to manage his shop, which sells food and home supplies along with mobile money. 

To help expand his business, Ahmed has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to build his mobile money business and will help Ahmed to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Ahmed hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to grow his business. 

Ahmed is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ahmed who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to build his mobile money business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 26 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Fredy, su esposo. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Herli y Odaliz, a los que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Quebrada imperial. Todas las mañanas como es de costumbre, se dirige a cuidar de sus terrenos de cultivo; sus principales sembríos constan de maca y diversas variedades de tubérculos. También comparte su tiempo con el cuidado de sus hijos, a los que lleva a la escuela y alimenta. Pero los fines de semana la dedican a su esposo, quien regresa de la ciudad de Pampas, donde trabaja como albañil en el gobierno local. Juntos, se dirigen a sus terrenos para ver como se encuentran creciendo, además de disfrutar del hermoso paisaje de Quebrada. Los planes de está pareja es terminar de construir su casa y mejorar sus sembríos, pues tienen 2 hectáreas de terrenos productivos, donde quieren sembrar productos de calidad y de esa manera obtener buenas ganancias. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Los puquiales” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete una vez más, cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal; porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Elizabeth, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en completar el dinero para la compra de 250 kilos de semilla de maca que piensa sembrar.
texts.en: Elizabeth, who is 26 years old, is a hard-working woman.  She lives in the company of Fredy, her husband.  They have 2 children, Herli and Odaliz, who they take care of in their own house in the village of Quebrada Imperial.  Every morning, as usual, Elizabeth tends to her planted fields.  Her main crops are maca and several varieties of tubers.  She also spends time taking care of her children, who she takes to school and feeds.  But the weekends are dedicated to her husband, who returns from the city of Pampas, where he works as a bricklayer for the local government.  Together, they head out to their plots of land to see how the crops are growing and to enjoy to beautiful Quebrada landscape.  The pair's plan is to finish construction on their house and to improve their plantings.  They have 2 hectares of productive land on which they want to plant high quality products and thereby earn a better profit.  Elizabeth belongs to the  “Los Puquiales” communal bank, and this is her second loan with MFP.  She hopes for their help to be able to fulfill her plans.  In addition, she promises once again to comply with her payment plan, like she did with her previous loan.  Also, she is grateful to be a part of the communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  Elizabeth, once she receives her support, will invest the requested money in the purchase of 250 kilos of maca seeds, which she intends to plant.

loans.use: to purchase 250 kilos of maca seeds.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: La señora Rosalía se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo desde hace cinco años tiene  puesto de venta propio en un mercado de la ciudad de Cochabamba, trabaja de lunes a domingo, solicita el crédito compra de Mascotas y alimnetos,  para iniciar una nueva actividad junto a  su esposo la cual según indica doña Rosalía tiene buen mercado, con dicha actividad desean incrementar sus ingresos y para solicitar dicho crédito la primera opción fue nuestra institución lo cual nos muestra la buena confianza para con la institución,  vive en domicilio de propiedad de sus padres, la cual se encuentra muy cerca a su puesto de venta.
texts.en: Señora Rosalía has been selling chickens for 5 years and has her own stall at the market in the city of Cochabamba. She works Monday through Sunday. She is asking for the loan to buy pedigreed pets and feed to start a new business with her husband who according to Doña Rosalia has a good market for this. They want to increase their income with this new business. Their first choice for a loan was our institution which demonstrates their good faith in the institution. She lives in a house that belongs to her parents which is very close to her market stall.

loans.use: to buy pedrigrees pets and feed.

loans.name: Gombo

texts.en: Gombo is 72 years old and lives with with his wife and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and fence in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His one child attends university. His wife and son both help him with the business. He was an agronomy teacher until 1995 when he started his own business by growing vegetables. He has his own storage and 0.2 acres of land. His wife sells the vegetables in market in her own counter. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says "Man doesn't retire. Nowadays, people say they are retired and just simply stay at home." He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more seeds.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds.

loans.name: Eastern B Group

texts.en:
Ronald is 28 years old and single. He does not have children, but he has three other dependents who are his brother, sister, and nephew. 

He has been in business for one year and rents a shop to operate at Nyika Growth Point. He orders products such as clothes and shoes from Botswana and South Africa. He also sells groceries at the shop. He has one employee.

Ronald faces challenges of high competition and travelling for two days to get his orders from Botswana. In the next five years, he hopes to have a shop of his own in town. The loan will help him to take better care of his three dependents.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, and carpets

loans.name: Marta Ines

texts.es: La señora Marta Inés a sus 56 años es una emprendedora quien decide montar su propio negocio de reparación de electrodomésticos y venta de repuestos, esta idea surgió de la experiencia previa que tenia la señora Marta Inés de una empresa en la cual trabajo por muchos años realizando esta misma actividad. La señora Marta Inés trabaja sola en su local en una jornada de trabajo de lunes a sábado de 8:00 a.m a 8:00 p.m. La señora Marta requiere de la compra de herramientas de trabajo que le faciliten la prestación de su servicio y la calidad en el mismo. El sueño de la señora Marta Inés es ver crecer su negocio y poder brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marta Inés at the age of 56 is an entrepreneur who has decided to start her own appliance repair shop and appliance spare parts sales business.  This idea arose from the experience Marta Inés acquired previously when she worked for a firm for many years doing this same kind of work.  Mart Inés works alone in her shop from Monday through Saturday from 8am until 8pm.  Marta needs to buy work tools that will facilitate her providing service and quality.
