Marta Inés’ dream is to see her business grow so that she can provide her family with a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and work tools like a drill and a soldering gun.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: La Señora Wilma tiene  como actividad la venta de variedad de productos de manera ambulante vende entregando productos a crédito desde abarrotes, electrodomésticos, por distintas zonas, en los mercados, tiene ya clientas que le hacen variedad de pedidos y la Sra. Compra y les entrega y cada mes o cada quincena cobra   En esta ocasión solicita financiamiento para aumentar su capital de negocio, comprara por cantidad abarrotes  y por inicio de año electrodomésticos  para aumentar  sus ingresos y así de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vid, la Sra. Wilma es una persona muy trabajadora se siente muy agradecida con la institución ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos ya que gracias a su apoyo salió adelante en su negocio, diversificando su productos.
texts.en: Wilma makes a living selling a variety of products as a roaming merchant. She sells products from groceries to household appliances on credit in distinct areas and markets. She has customers who make a number of orders and she buys and delivers the products every month or 15 days. She is requesting the loan to increase her working capital to purchase a supply of groceries and to start the year with appliances to increase her income and improve her quality of life. Wilma is a very hard-working person who feels very grateful for Kiva partner Emprender because this business is her only source of income and thanks to the support she has made headway and diversified her products.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of wholesale products to sell.

loans.name: Gadah

texts.en:
Gadah is a 47 year old single woman from Al Zarqa Amman Jordan.She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for clothes to sell,she wants to develop her project.In the future she hopes to create a comfortable space for her family.
Gadah prefers not to display her photo on the internet,thus the above photo is of her brother's.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell

loans.name: Lourdez

texts.es: El Señora Lourdez de 24 años de edad actualmente es separada de su concubino debido a una mala relación por parte de su pareja por más de 1 año y medio, tiene una instrucción de nivel secundario tiene 2 hijos de  lo cual recibe una pensión por parte del padre de sus hijos, actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres en Colomi zona norte. La Sra. Lourdez cuenta con una actividad de venta diaria de abarrotes en puesto fijo además la venta de pollo frito y salchipapa en los días de feria, se mantiene económicamente junto a sus hijos pequeños para su alimentación, ella necesita un crédito para la ampliación de su negocio para la adquisición de mas mercadería para la venta de abarrotes, todos sus ahorros los invirtió en compra de mercaderías. Ella está muy entusiasmada con esta oportunidad de acceder a un porque así podrá ampliar mas su negocio y trabajar por el bienestar de sus hijos pequeños.
texts.en: Lourdez is 24 years old.  She is has been separated from her common-law husband for more than a year and a half because of difficulties with the relationship.  She has a secondary school education.  She has two children and receives child support from the children’s father.  She currently lives in her parents’ home in northern Colomi.  Lourdes has a fixed stand where she sells daily groceries.  She also sells fried chicken and “salchipapa” (a sausage and French fry dish) on market days.  She supports herself financially in order to feed her small children.  She needs a loan to expand her business and acquire more merchandise to sell at her grocery store.  She has invested all of her savings in the purchase of merchandise.  She is very excited about this opportunity because she will be able to expand her business further and work for the well-being of her young children.

loans.use: to purchase grocery merchandise.

loans.name: Carolyne's Group

texts.en:
Carolyne is 47 years old, has 4 children, and lives in Kariaga B village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya. Kariaga B village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from kowino borehole. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Carolyne and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Carolyne works as a subsistence farmer, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Carolyne and two other promoters in her community, including Tom and Eunice, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Carolyne will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Carolyne wants to be a promoter because she believes that the dispenser will kill bacteria, making the water safe to drink.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Carolyne’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To allow the community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Pauline was born in 1957 in Vogan ville (district of Vo). She is married and mother of (05) five with five (05) other children depending on her. She also takes care of her husband. She is clear in complexion, medium-sized, very discrete but hardworking. She was enjoying a peaceful life with her husband till a bush fire devastated the palm oil farm of Mr. A. (the husband), who lost all hope and turned to alcohol thereby becoming a drunkard. That is how misery struck the household. But Mrs. A. Pauline being a very courageous, dynamic and respectful woman, she was able to get a credit of $20 dollars to start the door-to-door trade of products like traditional soap, palm nut oil, mangoes, guava, vegetables. With her sense of good management, she was able to pay back in due time and obtain a second credit of $200 dollars which allowed her to expand her activity. Looking at the span and the way she mastered the business, she wants to make it a professional activity in order to have a more reasonable source of revenue. Therefore she requested a credit of $ 850 which will help purchase and sell essential products.

Madame A. Pauline est née en 1957 à Vogan ville (P/Vo). Elle est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants avec cinq (05) autres personnes à charge dont le mari. De teint clair, taille moyenne, très discrète et réservée mais travailleuse, elle vivait très bien avec son mari jusqu’au jour où un feu de brousse avait complètement dévasté le champ de palmier à huile et d’ignames de Monsieur A. (le mari), qui a perdu tout espoir à la vie et s’est confié à l’alcool, le mauvais maître. C’est alors que commença la misère du foyer. Mais Madame A. Pauline étant une femme très courageuse, dynamique et respectueuse a pu bénéficier d’un crédit de $ 20 pour démarrer la vente, porte à porte, des produits comme le savon traditionnel, d’huile rouge, des mangues, des goyaves, des légumes. Avec son sens de bonne gestionnaire, elle a su rembourser à temps et bénéficier à nouveau, d’un second crédit de $ 200 qui lui a permis d’élargir son activité. Compte tenu de l’ampleur et de la maîtrise de ce commerce, elle veut en faire une activité professionnelle en vue d’avoir une source de revenu plus raisonnable. Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un crédit de $ 850 qui va servir à l’achat et à la revente des produits de première nécessité.

loans.use: To purchase and sell essential products (.traditional soap, palm nut oil, mangoes, guava, vegetables)

loans.name: Afi

texts.en:
Born in 1954 in Tsévié, Zio prefecture, Ms. Afi K. is a married mother of 4 and cares for 2 other people as well. She is an illiterate woman who has dedicated herself to the sale of fish and food products. Her financial means are insufficient for meeting the demands of her clientele. In order to breathe new life into her business, she is asking for a loan of $400 which will provide the funds needed to grow her business, increase its yield and improve its self-financing ability.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1954 à Tsévié dans la préfecture du Zio, Madame K. Afi est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants et a également à sa charge deux (02) autres personnes. C’est une femme analphabète qui s’est investie dans le commerce de poisson et des produits alimentaires. Ses moyens financiers insuffisants n’arrivent pas à satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Pour donner un autre souffle aujourd’hui à son commerce, elle sollicite un crédit de $400 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour augmenter la taille de ses activités afin d’accroître son rendement et améliorer sa capacité d’auto financement.

loans.use: Sale of fish and food products

loans.name: Gulbakhor

texts.en:
Gulbakhor started her business in the local market. She has over 15 years of experience in trade. First she had only a little table. After a loan, she rented a slightly bigger counter. Since working at an open-air market is not easy, she would like to rent a place in a store. Her current request for a loan will be used for renting a shop and increasing the assortment of her goods.

Gulbakhor is married and has 3 children (two girls and one son).

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
FRANCISCA IS 56 YEARS OLD. SHE IS MARRIED AND HAS 11 CHILDREN. SHE AND HER HUSBAND BUY AND SELL HORSES FROM AND TO PEOPLE THAT LIVE ON THE FIELDS AROUND HER COMMUNITY - THEY ARE USED FOR LAND CULTIVATION AND TRANSPORTATION. SHE IS ON GROUP SANTA CATARINA 12, ALONG WITH LUZ ESTHER DIAZ FLORES ( FOOD SUPPLY STORE ), AND MRS. MARTHA SANCHEZ ABARCA ( FOOD SUPPLY STORE ). MRS. FRANCISCA EXPECTS TO INVEST THE LOAN TO PURCHASE MORE LIVESTOCK AND MORE FOOD FOR THEM IN ORDER TO IMPROVE STOCK REARING. THE OTHER TWO LADIES WILL APPLY THEIR SHARE OF THE LOAN TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE TO INCREASE INVENTORY, THUS, INCREASING GAIN.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

FRANCISCA TIENE 56 AÑOS , CASADA 11 HIJOS , TRABAJA CON SU ESPOSO EN LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE CABALLOS A LAS PERSONAS DEL CAMPO QUE HABITAN EN LOS ALREDEDORES DE SU COMUNIDAD QUIENES LOS UTILIZAN PARA EL TRABAJO DE SIEMBRA Y DE TRASLADO. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SANTA CATARINA 12 JUNTO CON DOÑA LUZ ESTHER DIAZ FLORES ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) Y DOÑA MARTHA SANCHEZ ABARCA ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES ).CON EL PRESTAMO DOÑA FRANCISCA ESPERA INVERTIR EN MAS ANIMALES Y ALIMENTO PARA UNA MEJOR CRIANZA. LAS OTRAS DOS SEÑORAS INVERTIRAN SU PARTE DEL PRESTAMO EN MERCADERIA PARA ABASTECER MEJOR A SUS TIENDAS Y ASI OBTENER MAS GANANCIAS.

loans.use: COMPRA Y VENTA DE CABALLOS

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Phượng, 41 years old, lives with her husband and their 2 children in Sóc Sơn, a district just outside of Hà Nội. She opened her restaurant in 1994 with the fund that she received that year. Now her restaurant is a familiar address to the locals. At first, only breakfast was served. As the popularity of the restaurant grows so do the operating hours. Now it is open from morning till night. The restaurant's menu offers more choices than ever: poultry, pork, pork's tripes ...etc. It also offers a catering service. In 2005, Ms Phượng expanded her restaurant from 50 square meters to over 200 square meters (1800 square feet). Her husband, Nguyễn Văn Đồng, and their 2 daughters give her a hand in running the restaurant. The monthly revenue from the restaurant is 200-300 USD. Ms Phượng requests a loan of 1200 USD to buy a fridge and more produce for her restaurant.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị Phượng, 41 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và hai con tại Sóc Sơn, một huyện ngoại thành Hà Nội. Bắt đầu kinh doanh dịch vụ ăn uống từ khi vào Quỹ năm 1994 đến nay, cửa hàng chị đã trở thành một địa chỉ quen thuộc đối với người dân địa phương. Khởi đầu bằng việc bán hàng ăn sáng, dần dần việc bán hàng chiếm thời gian của chị Phượng từ sáng đến tối. Số loại thực phẩm cửa hàng cung cấp cũng tăng lên: thịt gà, lòng lợn, ... nhận đặt cơm. Năm 2005 chị quyết định mở rộng cửa hàng ăn từ 50 lên 200 mét vuông. Anh Nguyễn Văn Đồng, chồng chị, và hai cô con gái ngoài thời gian đi học đều rất tích cực hỗ trợ mẹ trong việc bán hàng. Với mức thu nhập hàng tháng từ 200-300 USD, chị làm đơn xin vay 1200 USD để mua tủ lạnh bảo quản thức ăn cùng thực phẩm phục vụ cho việc bán hàng.

loans.use: buy fridge and food for her restaurant

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en: I am Nazeeran B.. I was born in Gujarat, a mid size city but moved to Lahore in my early teens. I am the mother of two sons and one daughter. My husband is a scrap dealer and he purchases various second-hand machine tools and sells them in different factories. This business leaves us with decent profits and we were able to buy a fridge and marry one of my daughters. We need to expand the business and buy a large quantity of second hand machinery spare parts.

loans.use: Buy various machine spare parts in large quantity

loans.name: Alfiya

texts.en:
Alfiya is a mother of two children. She has worked with Microinvest since 2003. She is an intelligent woman who quickly understands her clients' needs and tries to satisfy them. Her clients are happy with her business, because they always find the necessary items they need at her shop. Today she has created a good turnover of working capital. She is requesting a loan of $975 to develop her business further.
Before New Year, she plans to buy more winter clothes and try to get more income from clothes sale.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es:
Elvia is 48 years old and has been selling candy for a long time with much success. She has four children who are the light of her life since they arrived in this world. This noble mother wishes to grow the items she offers for sale by offering larger quantities in a well-equipped establishment. So to start down this great path that she wishes to travel with your help, she asks for help from your noble heart in order to make this goal come true in the near future. Support Mrs. Elvia, she is hard working and promises not to disappoint you.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Elvia, de 48 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de golosinas desde hace mucho tiempo con mucho éxito, tiene cuatro hijos que se han convertido en la luz que alumbra su camino desde que llegaron a este mundo.Esta noble madre de familia desea acrecentar la venta de los artículos que oferta hasta ofertarlo en grandes cantidades en un establecimiento bien equipado a fin de iniciar el gran camino que desea recorrer con su labor solicita la ayuda de tu noble corazón a fin de cristalizar su objetivo en poco tiempo.Apoya a la señora Elvia, ella es trabajadora y promete no defraudarte.

loans.use: Enlarge her small establishment

loans.name: Namunina A(I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Efransi K.. She is currently in the business of livestock farming and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to buy cattle feed. Efransi is 40 years old and is single. She has 6 children who range in age from 6 to 24. All of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land.

Efransi is joined in her small group by Rehema N., Rebecca N., Robinah N., and Madina N.. Rehema N. is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to expand her stone business. Rebecca N. is currently in the business of brick laying and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to re-invest in the brick business. Robinah N. is also currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to re-invest in the stone business. Madina N. is currently in the business of stone quarrying. She is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to expand her stone quarry business.

loans.use: To invest in the various businesses

loans.name: Dany

texts.en:
Dany runs a food stand in the neighborhood of Parta Alta in the city of Tarapoto, San Martin. She sells “Juane” (rice and chicken wrapped in palm leaf), Fried Rice, French Fries, and Hot Dogs. She prepares her foods daily to sell in the evening on the corner of a busy intersection near her house.  

Dany is 36 years old, married, and has 2 children. Her children are young so she is happy she can work from home and spend time with them. She started the business 5 years ago to help earn money for her family and gain some independence. She now has many loyal customers and an active social life.  She says she gets to meet people from all over the region which she really enjoys. One day she would like to save enough money to send her children to University.

A member of the community bank Las Orquidias, Dany is requesting a loan of S/. 800 to repay over 6 months. With the loan she would like to buy new tables, plates, and cups so she can serve more clients.

loans.use: She would like tu buy new tables, plates, and cups

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
Mrs. Nimia P. A. is a member of the “Banco Comunal, Nuestra Sra. de la Paz”, she lives in the Region of San Martín, Province of San Martín, District of Tarapoto, her address is Jr. Ulises Reátegui No. 235, where her business of groceries – general store also is located. The loans from “Banco Comunal” have allowed her to implement her business and keep growing. Her husband and son support her and they have plans to pack coffee beans for the next season.

With the loan of S/.800.00 to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy sacks of rice, sugar, toilet paper, soft drinks, and other products to supply her store. Doña Nimia is 56 years old, lives with her husband and she has 2 children, one of them lives with his parents and her husband and son help her organize the tasks at home and at the business which allows her time for her personal affairs.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nimia P. A. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Sra. de la Paz” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Ulises Reátegui Nº 235, donde también se ubica su negocio de venta de abarrotes – bodega. Los préstamos del Banco Comunal le han permitido implementar su negocio y seguir creciendo, es apoyada por su esposo e hijo y tiene previsto asimismo en el próximo ciclo envasar café de cereales.

Con el crédito de S/. 800.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará sacos de arroz, azúcar, papel higiénico, gaseosas y otros productos para surtir. La señora Nimia tiene 56 años, vive con su esposo y tiene 2 hijos, sólo vive con uno de ellos, su esposo e hijo le ayudan a organizar las tareas del hogar y del negocio por lo que ella tiene tiempo también para hacer sus cosas personales fuera de casa.

loans.use: Purchase products to supply general store and increase sales.

loans.name: Mauwa's Furaha Group

texts.en:
Mauwa is 48 years old and is a married woman with 11 children, ages 4-25 years old. Mauwa sells charcoal and bread. Everyday, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Asya, Rabia and Zuhura, who sell charcoal and firewood, snacks, and clothing.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Komla Adjato

texts.fr:
Born in Tohoun in 1985, Mr. Komla Adjato A. is single. In 2005, he opened a general store in the district of Agoè near the market. In his shop, ETS AKAS, he sells milk, canned goods, soaps and detergents, etc. His location allows him to do a good business since he is alone in this area. On days when the market is not busy, Mr. Komla Adjato A. has a hefty turnover.

This first loan that he is requesting will allow him to stock up on certain non-perishable items. He would like to buy 10 sacks of rice and 8 sacks of granulated sugar.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né à Tohoun en 1985, Monsieur A. Komla Adjato est célibataire. Il a crée en 2005, un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè près du marché. Dans son magasin « ETS AKAS », il vend du lait, des boites de conserves, des savons etc. Sa situation géographique lui permet de mieux vendre car il est le seul dans ce milieu. Les jours aux quels le marché ne s’anime pas, monsieur A. Komla Adjato réalise de gros chiffre d’affaires.

Le premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra de faire un approvisionnement des certains produits non périssables. Il désire acheter aussi dix (10) sacs de riz et huit (8) sacs de sucre en poudre.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 sacks of rice and 8 sacks of granulated sugar

Achat de 10 sacs de riz et de 8 sacs de sucre en poudre.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia is a young mother who, together with her husband, has looked for opportunities to enable her to keep her family, which currently consists of Eugenia, her husband and a daughter. This was the the driving force behind the couple's decision to sell forage wholesale. Eugenia and her husband rent farming land so that they can harvest the forage and then distribute it to the market closest to their home. They also sell the forage to their neighbors. Their goal is to increase their business and so they are applying for a loan of $350. Please help Eugenia to bring her business forward.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Eugenia es una joven madre de familia que junto a su esposo han buscado opciones de desarrollo que les permita poder sostener a su familia, por ahora ellos tienen una niña. Es así que optaron por dedicarse a la venta de pastos al por mayor, Eugenia y su esposo alquilan terrenos de cultivo para poder cosechar el pasto y luego distribuirlo en el mercado más cercano a su casa, también lo venden a sus vecinos, su meta es crecer cada vez, solicitando un préstamo de 1000 soles. Apoya a Eugenia a seguir adelante en su negocio.

loans.use: Capital increase for her business.

loans.name: Silath

texts.en:
Mrs. Silath N. is a basket maker in Taing Bampong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province (pictured with her husband). She also cultivates rice and vegetables on her farm. Mrs. Silath N. now faces a small problem, because she does not have enough animals to plow her field. So she is asking for a loan to buy cows to plow it.

Mrs. N.'s husband, Mr. Veasna Von, is a construction worker and pig breeder. Mrs. Silath N. is 27 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school; the youngest child is too young to work or study.

Previously, Mrs. Silath N. obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets for breeding and bamboo for making baskets. She has fully paid it back. Last year, Mrs. Silath N. gave birth to her child, and she spent $150. This is the reason that Mrs. Silath N. does not have enough money to buy cows to plow her field.

loans.use: Buy cows to plow the rice field

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es:
Yanina is 26 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children. She is a young mother who shares the farming duties with her husband , as much agriculture as with the livestock, because she really desires to get ahead. She primarily cultivates potatoes and corn as well as vegetables, which require much work and effort, and she also spends most of the day caring for her 4 Brown Swiss cows. She receives excellent profits from the daily sale of milk, and she also makes and sells delicious cheeses.

Yanina does not consider this daily labor to be a problem worth mentioning, since she and her husband are used to this work, and she does not neglect the care of her two small children. She has requested this loan because she needs to improve her next planting season and to buy balanced feed for her cows.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Yanina tiene 26 años, vive al lado de su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Es una joven madre de familia que se dedica, de manera compartida con su esposo, a las tareas del campo, tanto a la agricultura, como a la ganadería, ya que ella tiene muchos deseos de seguir adelante, cultiva principalmente la papa, el maíz, también verduras, las cuales requieren de un gran esfuerzo y trabajo, así también, casi todo el día en la cuidad, cuida de sus 4 vacas de raza Bronz Suiz con las cuales percibe mayores ganancias con la venta de la leche diariamente, también elabora y vende deliciosos quesos. Para Yanina no existen dificultades considerables de mencionarse, en el trabajo diario que realiza, ya que ella y su esposo están habituados a estas labores, y además no descuida la atención de sus dos pequeños hijos. La solicitud de su préstamo es a razón de que necesita mejorar su próxima siembra y comprar alimento balanceado para sus vacas.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her lands and balanced feed for her cows

loans.name: Axel Leonardo

texts.es: Axel Leonardo tiene un pequeño negocio de veterinaria que se llama “El Arca de Noe”.  Tiene más de 1 año de haber iniciado este negocio.  También se dedica a brindar sus servicios como técnico en el cuidado y atención de animales, para lo cual él hace visitas a sus clientes.  El préstamo él lo necesita para poder tener mas mercadería en su negocio, como lo son alimentos de animales, medicinas y todo lo que se necesita para el cuidado de animales, también con el préstamo él quiere ampliar su local.  El esta muy conciente que con este negocio es presta un importante servicio a su comunidad.  En la actualidad él es soltero, y su sueño es tener mejores ingresos para poder seguir estudiando la carrera de Ingeniero Agrónomo en la Universidad.  El cree que en Guatemala se puede desarrollar como persona y como profesional.
texts.en:
Axel Leonardo has a small veterinary clinic called "El Arca de Noe" ("Noah's Ark") which he opened more than a year ago. He also makes house calls as a veterinary technician to attend and care for animals. He needs this loan to offer more merchandise at his business, such as pet food, medicine and everything else that is necessary to care for animals. He would also like to use the loan to expand his business. He is very conscious of the fact that with this business, he is offering an important service to his community. He is currently single, and his dream is to earn more so that he can continue to study agronomy at the university. He believes that in Guatemala, he can develop as a person and as a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand veterinary clinic, buy pet food and medicine

loans.name: Julia Rosa

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer, es casada , tiene 2 hijos, de 21 y 31 años Julia vende cosméticos desde hace 18 años , también alquila departamentos y desde hace 2 meses se dedica la tejido

Julia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en los acabados, infraestructura e implementación, de departamentos para alquilar, va a colocar ventanas . Julia desde que recibe los préstamos ha podido crecer y avanzar en sus proyectos. Los sueños de Julia construir mas departamentos y formar una empresa.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the communal bank Nuevo Amanecer. She is married and has two children ages 21 and 31. Julia has been selling cosmetics for 18 years. She also rents apartments and for the last two months she has been knitting.

Julia needs this loan to invest in finishes, infrastructure and implementation of the apartments she rents such as installing windows. Since she began receiving these loans, Julia has been able to expand and forge ahead in her projects. Julia dreams of building more apartments and forming a company.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in finishes, infrastructure and implementation of apartment rentals.

loans.name: Babalola

texts.en: Babalola sells drinks in her shop and she has been in this business for the past 4 years. Babalola is a LAPO Microfinance client. Babalola lives in Kasidi, Lagos state, Nigeria. She opens her shop by 7am in the morning and she closes by 7pm daily. Babalola is 40 years old and married with 5 children. Babalola is requesting the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Femarie

texts.en:
Femarie L. is a 29-year-old store owner married to Freddie, who is involved in farming activities. They are blessed with two children, Sigrid Faye – six years old, already in Grade One and Geradee – three years old. They live in Brgy San Mateo, Quirino, Isabela, which she describes as an agricultural area with rice and corn as its main products.

Femarie is generating an average weekly income of about $30, used in maintaining her store's daily operation and sustaining her other source of income - raising pigs. She wants to expand into selling vegetables and meats which will be displayed in front of her store and is therefore requesting a loan for this purpose.

Femarie hopes to improve the business so as to enable her children to gain the highest level of education they need.

loans.use: To buy meats and vegetables to sell in her store.

loans.name: Alhadi Primary School Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Alhadi Primary School in Makeni. It was founded in 1996 by a Lebanese called Rashik. It was primarily established for the propagation of the Shiite Islamic faith. Today, it has a total of 722 pupils, with a staff of 18 teachers.

Alhadi is proud that their pupils are able to make good grades on the National Primary School Exams (NPSE). In sports also, (i.e., for both athletics and soccer), Alhadi is proud that they always emerge victorious among all Islamic schools in Makeni town.

Over the years the school has grown so much that it now lacks adequate furniture and teaching materials. There are not enough benches and desks for the pupils, so they have to squeeze together. In addition to this, teaching materials like textbooks and chalk are also a constrain for this school.

This will be the first loan for teachers of the Alhadi Primary School from SMT (through Kiva). This loan will certainly be of immense help to these teachers. Since salaries are usually small in Sierra Leone, and especially so for people in the teaching profession, they can not use such salaries to buy much or do anything great. But with a loan, they can now buy or do something big and then repay over a period of time. Some of them will use their share to begin or continue building a house, others to pay either for themselves to pursue further studies or pay for their children’s education. Some will use their share to invest in business in order to complement their monthly salaries. And still others will use theirs to buy pieces of furniture.

Fatu M. K. (left) is the head teacher of this school. She was born in Lunsar, Port Loko district, northern Sierra Leone. She is age fifty-five and a widow of four children. All of her children are now grown-ups and are professionals. She has been head teacher of this school for five years now. Fatu will use her Le 1,000,000 loan to invest in business. She will make "gara lappers" (locally dyed cloth, sometimes with fancy designs) to sell in Freetown. Fatu said she wants to get started in business so that once she retires, she will have something to do.

loans.use: Invest in her start-up business

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: This woman is widow. She was born in 1961. Nazira lives in Khachmaz town. Three years ago she started a clothing sales business. Now she needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy clothes for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Mrs. Ya C. lives in Chreak village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces some problems because her field is infertile and is far from the irrigation system.

In order to deal with these problems, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, fuel, and a pump to support her field. Her husband, Mr. Chhoem Meak, is a hard-working man. Mrs. Ya C. is 30 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fuel, and pump

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
María de los Ángeles A. A. es una señora de 26 años de edad casada con Yinier Gustavo Araya. Ellos dos tienen una hija que se llama Enid Sofía. Viven en una pequeña comunidad al oeste de San José que se llama  Grifo Alto de Puriscal.
Grifo Alto es una comunidad rural que se ubica aproximadamente a una hora al oeste de San José. Es una zona montañosa y tiene una vista muy linda de valles, ríos y montañas que miran a la costa pacífica de Costa Rica. Grifo Alto queda sobre la carretera que va hacia las playas por lo tanto muchos turistas paran ahí a comer, o simplemente disfrutar de los paisajes y el ambiente rural. En la zona hay muchas fincas pequeñas que se dedican tanto a la agricultura como a la ganadería. Anteriormente se sembraba mucho tabaco pero luego los precios bajaron y la gente buscó otras opciones.
Doña María de los Ángeles tiene una granja de gallinas ponedoras para vender huevos en la comunidad. Este negocio lo iniciaron hace dos años cuando el papá de María de los Ángeles les vendió un pedazo de tierra y ahí construyeron un galerón en dónde iniciaron con 300 pollitas. Con un primer micro préstamo que solicitaron lograron aumentar la cantidad de gallinas ponedoras en 750. Ahora piensan obtener un nuevo préstamo para lograr llegar a 1.000 gallinas y en un futuro aumentar hasta 1.500 que es la meta que se han propuesto y con la cual consideran que pueden llegar a tener un ingreso suficiente para que se convierta en la fuente de ingresos para toda la familia. 
Con el préstamo que están solicitando esperan comprar 250 pollitas, 20 sacos de alimento, 10 comedores y 10 bebedores. 
En este momento María de los Ángeles se dedica a cuidarlas, alimentarlas, recoger los huevos y distribuirlos en las tienditas y casas cercanas. Su esposo le ayuda por las tardes cuando regresa de su trabajo. 
María de los Ángeles es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Grifo Alto de Puriscal la cual es una de las organizaciones comunales socias de EDESA. Anteriormente obtuvo un préstamo de seiscientos mil colones (¢600.000) el cual pagó de forma puntual ya que la actividad le genera ingresos diarios.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles A. A. is a woman of 26 years married to Yinier Gustavo Araya. They have a daughter whose name is Enid Sofia. They live in a small community west of San Jose called Grifo Alto Puriscal. Grifo Alto is a rural community that is approximately one hour west of San José. It is a mountainous area and has a beautiful view of valleys, rivers, and mountains that overlook the Pacific coast of Costa Rica. Grifo Alto is on the road towards the beaches so many tourists stop there to eat or simply enjoy the scenery and the rural environment. The area has many small farms for agriculture and livestock. They used to plant a lot of tobacco, but then prices dropped and people sought other options. Doña María de los Angeles has a farm of laying hens for eggs which are sold in the community. They started this business two years ago when María de los Ángeles' father sold them a piece of land where they built a shed and started with 300 chicks. With the first micro loan they requested they were able to increase the number of hens to 750. Now they plan to obtain a new loan in order to get to 1000 hens and in the future increase to 1500 which is the target they have been proposed and which they think will provide a sufficient income to become the source of income for the whole family. With the loan they are requesting they plan to buy 250 chicks, 20 bags of feed, 10 feeders, and 10 waterers. At this time María de los Angeles works taking care of the chickens, feeding them, collecting the eggs, and distributing the eggs in nearby shops and houses. Her husband helps in the evenings after returning from his work. Maria de los Angeles is a member of the Community Credit Corporation of Grifo Alto Puriscal which is one of the community social organizations of EDESA. Previously she obtained a loan of six hundred thousand colones (¢ 600,000) which she repaid in a timely manner now that the business generates daily income.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 250 laying hens, 10 feeders, and 10 waterers.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hanna is a single mother of three older children and makes a living through working on her farm.  She will use this loan to pay for labor to clear her farmland, tools for farming, groundnuts (peanuts) and seedlings for the crops.  By hiring additional labor to work her farm, Hanna is creating employment opportunities for her neighbors in the community.  

Similar to fellow borrowers at GHAPE, a field partner of Kiva, Hanna and her family have faced some of life's challenges, such as deep poverty, sickness, and inability to pay for education. However, with the profit from her loan, she will be able to help herself and her family live a better life, pay for her children's education and support other family members.  

Hanna believes that her business will do well because of her hard work, and she is appreciative of Kiva's field partner, GHAPE, because she would not be able to expand her farm otherwise.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account, and most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Labor to Clear Farmland, Peanuts, Seedlings and Farming Tools

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20201050006) is a 38 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Phú Mẫn 07 (7).

T. is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, T. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fried foods in the local community.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2006000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị L. (20201050008) is a 42 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.

2.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20201050009) is a 26 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

3.  Nguyễn Thị Hoà (20201050062) is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector selling home products.

4.  Đặng Thị N. (20201050063) is a 50 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5.  Dương Thị Hà (20201050064) is a 41 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector selling home products.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Making & selling food.

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.ru: Абдумалик мужчина , который торгует мужской обувью на рынке Костакоза. Во время мониторинга чаще всего торгует его отец, Абдумалик всегда в отъезде за товаром. Но на сей раз я смогла застать его на месте торговли. Это пунктуальный и честный человек который пятый год работает с Фондом. Следующий кредит хочет использовать на завоз летней обуви.
texts.en:
Abdumalik sells men's shoes at the market of Kostakoz. He has been a microfinance client for five years, and he has been noted for his honesty and punctuality in loan repayment. He would like to use the new loan for the purchase men's shoes for the summer season. Since Abdumalik is often away purchasing goods, during the monitoring I only saw his father at the market stall.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: men's shoes

loans.name: Expedito

texts.en: M. Expedito is 48 years old and married with four children. He has been operating his business since 2000 and deals in textiles, making suits for his customers. He is using the loan to purchase material for making more suits for his customers. M. Expedito's hope for the future is to increase his production and daily sales for more profits.

loans.use: To purchase material for making more suits for his customers.

loans.name: Danilza

texts.es:
DANILZA G. D. L., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SOLIDARIAS”, vive en el Jr. Ricardo palma Nº 383, tiene 55 años D. edad, es madre soltera y se dedicaba  a la venta D. golosinas en la escuela  “El Arenal”.

Tiene 5 años en Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto D. S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, el cuál lo utilizó para comprar golosinas para su pequeño negocio. En la actualidad, se dedica a la venta D. ropas, el cual le genera mejores ingresos que el trabajo anterior.

Con este  préstamo D. S/ 1,200.00, lo invertirá en la compra D. ropas para damas y caballeros ya que después ofrecerá a sus vecinos y amistades.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos porque le otorgó un crédito sin tanto papeleo,  confía en ella y la motiva a ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Danilza G. D. L. belongs to the “Supportive Women” Communal Bank. She lives on Ricardo Palma Street, is 55 years old, a single mother, and used to work selling sweets in the “El Arenal” school. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for 5 years and the first loan that she received was for 300 new soles, which she used to buy sweets for her small business. Currently she works selling clothing, which makes her a better income than her previous job. With this loan of 1,200 new soles, she will invest in the purchase of clothing for women and men and then sell them to her neighbors and friends. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos because they gave her a loan without so much paperwork. They trusted her and this motivated her to be responsible in her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy different clothing for women and men

loans.name: Bopha

texts.en:
Mrs. Bopha N., 31, and her husband, Mr. Phalla Lun, 27, live along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 2003 and have a three-year-old daughter.

Bopha has been selling fruit since she was seventeen years old. She buys the fruit from her fellow villagers and sells it in the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a chef for five years. She runs the business with her mother. Now she wants to launch her own business, but she doesn’t have enough capital. Therefore, Bopha she is asking for her first loan of $300 to purchase longan fruit on contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase longan on contract for resale.

loans.name: Rosefina

texts.en:
Rosefina D. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 45 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rosefina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling shoes in the local community. Rosefina is just starting this business.

In 2007, Rosefina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Rosefina is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosefina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 22 años y vive con sus padres y hermanos en el caserío Los Mochumanos, ubicado en el Sector Tambo Real, distrito de Pítipo, a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años se dedica a la agricultura, posee una pequeña parcela agrícola que cultiva para sostener a su familia que ha venido pasando por muchos problemas desde que su padre empezara a tener serios problemas con su visión.

Sus dos hermanos menores, de 17 y 13 años, también están bajo su responsabilidad y es deseo de toda la familia es que continúen estudiando para tener un mejor futuro; su hermana de 17 años empezará a estudiar una carrera técnica el próximo año mientras que su hermano menor estudia todavía en el colegio de la zona.

Elmer ha sembrado una hectárea de maíz esta temporada y ha solicitado por primera vez a nuestra Institución un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de fertilizantes para abonar su cultivo.

El desea seguir ayudando a su familia y continuar apoyando a sus hermanos con sus estudios, Elmer es considerado por los vecinos de su comunidad como un joven muy trabajador y responsable.
texts.en:
Elmer is 22 years old and lives with his parents and brothers in the village of Los Mochumanos, located in the Tambo Real sector of Pítipo district, 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For 2 years he has worked in agriculture. He has a small parcel of farmland that he works to support his family, who has been going through difficult times ever since his father began to have problems with his vision. His 2 younger siblings, ages 17 and 13, are also his responsibility and it is the family's wish that they continue studying in order to have a better future. Elmer's 17 year old sister will be starting at a technical college next year while his younger brother attends the local high school. Elmer has sowed a hectare of maize this season and is requesting a loan for the first time at our loan institution. The 1,000 PEN will be used to purchase fertilizer for his crops. He hopes to keep helping his family and supporting his siblings' studies. Elmer is considered by his neighbors in the community to be a hardworking and responsible young man.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for maize fields.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: A sus 27 años, Rosmery muestra laboriosidad y tenacidad para sus cultivos, tiene un hijo y el segundo por nacer. Ella vive en su casa propia, en su pueblo Picoy, a media hora de la ciudad de Tarma. A pesar de su embarazo Rosmery viene cultivando, cosechando y también ordeñando diariamente sus vacas para vender la leche en el mercado de la ciudad. Pero sus mayores ingresos económicos se dan a través de sus cultivos de hortalizas, por ello no descuida de cultivar y regar sus siembras y como resultado logra cosechar en tan sólo 3 meses los productos esperados, como las zanahorias. Cuando va recogiendo sus productos, también los va seleccionado de acuerdo al tamaño y lavando en la acequia de su pueblo, para que posteriormente, generalmente los días martes a las tres de la madrugada, los lleva hasta el mercado más importante de la ciudad de Tarma, donde elige a los compradores que le ofrezcan los mejores precios. Por ello, a Rosmery le gusta sembrar todo tipo de hortalizas, ya que le permite recaudar dinero en corto plazo. Este es su treceavo préstamo con MFP y en ninguno de sus créditos anteriores se demoró en pagar sus cuotas. Además, cuando las reuniones de su grupo tocan en su casa, Rosmery prepara el típico plato “picante de cuy”, con el fin de compartir con todos sus compañeros de su banco comunal, a quienes estima mucho. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos y semillas de zanahorias para el incremento de su producción.
texts.en:
At 27 years old, Rosmery cultivates her crops with diligence and tenacity. She has one child and a second child who is due any day. She lives in the town of Picoy in her own house, one-half hour from the city of Tarma. Despite her pregnancy, she cultivates and harvests her crops and also tends to her cows daily and sells the milk in the city market. The majority of her income is derived from the cultivation of vegetables; therefore, she does not fail to cultivate and water her seedlings, and, as a result, harvests in only three months the expected produce, such as carrots. When she harvests her produce, she also sorts it by size and washes it in the irrigation ditch of her town, so that later, generally on Tuesdays at three in the afternoon, she takes it to the most important market in the city of Tarma, where it is chosen by the buyers who pay the best prices. For this reason, Rosmery likes to sow all types of vegetables which permit her to profit in a short period of time. This is her thirteenth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has never been late in making payments on her previous loans. In addition, when it is her turn to host her group in her house, she prepares the traditional spicy meat stew to share with her companions in the cooperative bank, who she holds in high esteem. With the requested $350, she will buy chemical fertilizers and carrot seeds to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a member of the Idope west in Kinayanambo, Iringa. She is married and she has 1 child. Her child is 3 years old.


Teresia has owned a food business selling local beer for 3 years,she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 70,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Teresia`s first loan from  BRAC_ Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for her business.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Teresia hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for local beer

loans.name: Emie

texts.en: Emie R. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 32 years old. Emie is married and has 4 school-aged children. Emie owns & operates a business operating a transportation service. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a pedicab transport service. Emie has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Emie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Emie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Emie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Brenda Dalila

texts.es: La señora Brenda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Pequeñas Empresarias II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 23 años y no tiene hijos.Con el fin de contribuir con los ingresos económicos de su hogar le nace la idea de aperturar un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas preparadas y poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio atendiendo a sus clientes que a diario acuden a su restaurant y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con su rica sazón y la amabilidad que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, verduras diversas,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. Brenda, se siente muy segura y con ganas de seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.

loans.use: Comprará insumos, para preparar sus comidas.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is 52 years old, is widowed, and is a mother with eight children, two of whom are currently in school.

Akua is very humble and committed to her work and to the family needs as a single mother. She sells smoked fish in bulk at the community market and started a year ago. She takes her stock of goods from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana and retails to her customers.

Akua requests the loan to buy stock in bulk. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Kantutas Group

texts.es:
Bordar ropa de fiesta, especialmente de la danza de Moreno es la actividad principal de Maruja M. , quien emprendió su negocio con su esposo hace 10 años, también con el adiestramiento de su suegro, desde entonces con los ingresos generados sostienen a su familia, ella vende sus productos todos los días en diferentes ferias. Ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales. 
Las demás integrantes  del grupo Kantutas, también cuentan con diversos negocios como la venta de chamarras, deportivos, tejido de chompas, venta de carne, artefactos y alimento seco, necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, materia prima e insumos.
texts.en:
Maruja M. embroiders festive clothing, especially "Moreno" dance clothing. It's a business that she began with her husband 10 years ago, with the help of her father in law. They sell their products each day in different markets. They began this business to bring in more money to sustain their family. Now, they are requesting a loan to purchase materials needed for their business. The other Kantuta members also have their individual businesses where they sell jackets, sportswear, hand knitted sweaters, meats, dry food products and artifacts. They, too, are requesting loans in order to purchase merchandise, top quality materials and inventory for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA, MATERIA PRIMA E INSUMOS (to purchase merchandise, top quality materials and inventory for their businesses)

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando tiene 53 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace más de 32 años se dedica a elaborar bellos trajes típicos de su  región, a base de bordados y aplicaciones en telas doradas, hilos de colores y lentejuelas; de esta manera ha conseguido durante estos años sostener a su familia. En la actualidad, uno de sus hijos tiene el mismo interés por el arte que desarrolla y ha aprendido mucho de su padre, siendo su brazo derecho en estas actividades. 
Rolando divide su tiempo para confeccionar estos trajes y para criar a los animales que tiene en su casa, esto con el apoyo de su esposa. 
Sus clientes conocen de la calidad de sus trabajos por lo que siempre acuden a solicitar sus prendas y esto lo motiva para seguir desarrollarse en esta actividad. 

Este es su 14avo crédito con MFP, él es parte de un banco comunal y tiene como virtud la  perseverancia y la responsabilidad, siendo considerado en su grupo como el sostén moral. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de los materiales básicos para realizar sus trajes, tales como: hilos, aplicaciones de lentejuelas, pegamento, entre otros.
texts.en:
Rolando is 53 years old and lives with his wife and their 3 children in their own house.

For the last 32 years, he has dedicated himself to elaborating beautiful costumes typical of his region, based on embroidery and applications to gold cloth, plus colored thread and spangles. In this manner he has managed to sustain his family all these years. At present, one of his children shares the same interest in the art and has learned much from his father, serving as his right hand in these activities.

Rolando divides his time between making these costumes and raising animals at home, with the help of his wife.

His customers know the quality of his work and for this reason they keep coming back for his costumes. This motivates him to continue advancing his efforts in this activity.

This is his 14th credit with MFP. He belongs to a community bank and due to his perseverance and responsibility, he is considered the moral support of his group. The money he requests now is to buy basic materials for creating his costumes: thread, spangle applications, and glue, among other items.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY TEXTILES AND MATERIALS FOR COSTUMES

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 42 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a bricklayer and he also supports the home. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. 

Stella sells groceries at retail prices. She hopes to add the sales of cooking oil to her business. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs and necessities of her family members. She hopes to be a major cooking-oil distributor in the future. She needs a loan of 40,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Fausta Gregoria

texts.es:
Fausta es socia del Banco Comunal Fraternidad.
Fausta es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Fausta tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, bebidas, golosinas. Además Fausta viaja a diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y de allá compra cereales quesos.
Fausta necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada.
Los sueños de Fausta son construir su casa y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fausta is a member of the Banco Comunal Fraternidad. Fausta has a common-law partner. She is 39 years old and has four children. Fausta has a grocery store in her house where she sells groceries, drinks and sweets. In addition, Fausta travels to different markets in the region where she sells fruits, and there she buys grains and cheeses. Fausta needs a loan of 2200 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of wheat and barley. Fausta's dreams are to build her house and to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wheat and barley.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja dando clases de oratoria pero este ingreso es mínimo por lo tanto se dedico también a la venta de chompas.
El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y no perder la clientela que ganó y poder mantener su negocio estable.

Es cliente de Impro y tiene un historial de pagos muy bueno, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her own house in the Sopocachi zone in the city of La Paz with her husband and children. She works providing speech classes but the income from them is minimal, so she also sells sweaters. The loan that she is requesting is to increase her capital, not lose the customers that she gained, and to be able to keep her business stable.

She is an Impro client and has a very good loan repayment history. This has allowed her to access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more sweaters for her business

loans.name: Severio Okello

texts.en:
Severio O. O. is in the cereals business. He specializes in selling maize. He started this business in January 2009. Severio is a former teacher, and his cereals business was his retirement project. He is 64 years of age, married and the father of ten. 

Severio would like a loan of 10,000 KES which is to be used for the expansion of his business by increasing his stock of cereals.

loans.use: to expand his business by increasing his stock

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is 55 years old from Esichirai in Kakamega town. She is married to Arnest M. and they have three who are all married.

Rose applied for her first loan with Kadet Ltd., which she paid well without any difficulties. She is now considered a client with a good credit history. She is applying for the second loan and she intends to use it to buy another cow. 

Her primary business is selling milk, which she gets after milking her dairy cows. Her customers mainly consist of shops and the neighbors, whom she normally delivers to very early in the morning as many of them use the milk for making breakfast and the enjoyment of a good cup of tea.

Her dream is to be a big dairy farmer, supplying milk to the dairy companies in her area.

loans.use: Buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Karen Elena

texts.es:
Karen Barón  B., tiene 26 años  vive en el barrio Altos de San Isidro, en la ciudad de Cartagena  de Indias Municipio de Bolívar;  comenzó  su negocio con un pequeño capital que le quedo de un trabajo temporal en sus vacaciones de estudio;  con sus ganancias pagó su colegio porque desde muy joven tenia negocios con sus compañeras de clases.
Cuando se casó su esposo(a su lado en la fotografia) le recomendaba compañeros de trabajo como clientes y una vez él quedó sin trabajo, también empezó a comercializar con ella durante un año manteniéndose  esta pareja de las ganancias producidas: ellos vendían  de puerta en puerta y de barrio en barrio, alli se dieron a conocer y ganaron muchos clientes ; cuando posteriormente los clientes aumentaron sus pedidos de mercancía, tenían que esperar hasta recoger sus cuentas por cobrar para responderles, así muchas veces dejaron de ser oportunos y por eso recurrieron a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo buscando recursos para financiarse.  Hoy su esposo trabaja de mensajero  en una empresa, pero también gestiona la venta de mercancía que Karen vende entre sus compañeros de trabajo, ayudándola  a conseguir mucha clientela de sus conocidos.  Karen ha recibido 2 créditos de la Fundación en la línea de capital de trabajo, con ellos ha podido aumentar sus utilidades porque tiene más venta debido a que con este dinero pudo comprar más mercancía y hacer una oferta  diversificada; en la actualidad  solicita su tercer crédito por valor de $ 2.200.000 para comprar ropa, calzado e interiores para damas caballeros y niños, tendidos para camas, para lo cual viajará a  Barranquilla, ciudad a dos horas de Cartagena, porque incluyendo transporte su mercancía  sale a un mejor costo y puede venderla a un precio adecuado entre sus clientes.
Con su  negocio Karen se siente útil para los planes futuros que tienen ella y su esposo, porque sabe que pude lograr el sueño de adquirir su vivienda propia y  piensa que puede también tener un local al lado de su casa. Su gran desafío es terminar los estudios  y con su esposo tener un  gran almacén de ropa y brindar a los hijos que planean,  un futuro prometedor.
Karen se siente contenta, vive en un barrio que fue producto de invasión pero entre todos los vecinos  se organizaron y lograron  acceder a todos los servicios públicos y especialmente a la pavimentación de sus calles que hace fácil el acceso a su negocio.
texts.en:
Karen Barón B., age 26, lives in the Altos de San Isidro neighborhood of the city of Cartagena de Indias, within the municipality of Bolívar. She began her business with a small amount of capital that she obtained from temporary work during school vacations. She also paid high school fees with her earnings because, beginning when she was very young, she did business with her classmates.

When she married her husband (standing next to her in the photo) he sent friends from his job to her as customers. Once, when he became unemployed, he began working with her for a year, and the couple continued to produce profits. They were selling from door-to-door and neighborhood-to-neighborhood, and they say they got to know and win over many customers.

Later, when customers increased their orders for merchandise they had to wait until they had collected on their accounts in order to fill them. As a result, many times they lost opportunities. Because of this, they resorted to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, looking for resources to finance themselves. Today, her husband works as a messenger in a business, but he also tries to sell Karen's merchandise to his fellow employees, helping her to get more business from among his acquaintances.

Karen has received two loans from Fundación for working capital. With these she was able to increase her earnings because she had more sales due to the fact that she was able to buy more merchandise and offer greater diversity. Currently, she is applying for her third loan for 2,200,000 Columbian pesos in order to purchase clothing, footwear, and underwear for ladies, gentlemen and children. For these she will travel to Barranquilla, a city two hours from Cartagena, because, even including transportation, she can obtain her merchandise at a better price there and can sell it at a good price to her customers.

With her business Karen feels good about the future plans that she and her husband have because she knows that they can succeed in their dream of acquiring their own home, and she thinks that she can also have a shop next to their house. Her great challenge is to finish her schooling and with her husband have a large clothing store and offer the children they plan to have a promising future.

Karen feels contented. She lives in a neighborhood that was informally settled but all the neighbors organized themselves and succeeded in obtaining public services and especially the paving of their streets, which makes access to her business easy.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to purchase clothing, footwear and underwear for ladies, gentlemen, and children and bed linen

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina  P. is 23 and married with 3 children.  She owns a business venture, raising fish for sale.  Tina  has many years of experience in this business.  Tina  needs a loan of WST $1500 purchase fishing gears and a new canoe.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 750 talas or US $313 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Tina  joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Tina 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Tina  P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.7 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: purchase fishing gears and a new canoe

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Since the beginning of Rowena S.’s membership in ASHI, her determination to grow her ice-cream making/sales business has been strong. Her loan from ASHI is her main source of financial support. The profit from her business provides her family with food and other basic needs because this  is the only income source for both her and her husband. 

Since she started receiving loans from ASHI in 2004, her business has grown and she has been able to support the needs of her four children, particularly their educational needs. Soon, her eldest will go to college and her second child is in secondary school. They will need much financial support until they graduate from college. Therefore, Rowena really wants her business to become stable and to increase the family income while her two youngest children are still in elementary school. She is requesting a much larger loan from ASHI to help finance her aspirations for the business. 

With hope that, someday, she will fully achieve her dream of lifting her family above poverty, Rowena is very enthusiastic about managing her business well, in partnership with her loving husband.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients in bulk for her ice-cream production business.

loans.name: Juan Eusebio

texts.es: Juan es de 54 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos tres varones y dos mujeres, en su casa de habitación tiene establecido un taller de carpintería, su actividad lo viene practicando hace aproximadamente 15 años con la ayuda de su esposa han salido adelante, solicita su cuarto crédito, para comprar herramienta y maquinaria en su carpintería, los créditos anteriores los pago bien.
texts.en:
Juan is 54 years old, and he is married. He has five children, three boys and two girls. He has a carpentry shop set up in his home. He has been in this activity for approximately 15 years. With help from his wife, he has gotten ahead. He is asking for his fourth loan to buy tools and machinery for his carpentry shop. He paid his previous loans well.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Acuario 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Acuario 2 está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y decididas  una de ellas es  Rosa María Gaitán González, coordinadora del grupo quien se dedica a la venta de cerdo y cuajadas ambulante negocio con el que saco delante a su familia.

 Sus compañeras de grupo son Manuela de Jesús Jiménez quien comercializa accesorios en mercado Israel  como chapas, pirañas,   aros…etc. y Rosa Amanda Suarez quien venta de tortillas e invertirá el crédito en maíz, leña, molino, cal.
texts.en:
The "Acuario 2" (Aquarius 2) group is made up of three hard working, dedicated and determined people. One of them is Rosa María Gaitán González, group coordinator, who sells pork and cuajadas (a cheese-like product). This itinerant business has made it possible for her to move her family ahead in life. Her fellow group members are: Manuela de Jesús Jiménez who sells accessories, like locks, hoops, hair pins, etc. in the Israel market and Rosa Amanda Suarez who sells tortillas and will use the funds to buy corn, firewood, lime powder and a mill.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For pork and cuajadas (a cheese-like product)

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites B. is from the village of  Baluarte Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro. She is 37 years old. Marites is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a  specialized retail store, buying and selling bananas in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marites from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sully

texts.es:
Sully M. O.  es casada y su esposo se dedica al comercio, apoyá con sus ingresos a la economía del hogar, tienen un  hijo de 5 años, y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace 2 años, fue gracias al apoyo de su esposo que logro realizar la compra para las primeras mercaderías de su negocio.

Ella maneja que existen meses en el año en que las ventas se enfrían y decaen las ganancias, espera que para el segundo semestre del año 2010 se mejoren y para esto solicita de un  préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de productos, el crédito lo solicitará para la compra de  cosméticos con el objetivo de aprovechar el día en que celebramos a la madre Nicaragüense, de esta forma elevar sus ingresos para la inversión a nuevas fuentes de trabajo, y brindarle a su pequeño hijo mejores condiciones que beneficien a su desarrollo perosonal.
texts.en:
Sully M. O. is married and her husband works in trade. Their earnings help with household costs. They have one child, age 5. She has sold cosmetics for 2 years; it was thanks to her husband's support that she was able to purchase her business' first merchandise. She manages, even though there are months in the year when sales cool off and earnings wane. She hopes that the second half of 2010 will be better, and so she is requesting a loan to buy a better inventory. The requested loan is for the purchase of cosmetics in order to benefit from the day of celebration of Nicaragua's mother. This will improve her income for investment in new jobs, and offer her little child better conditions to benefit his personal development.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cosmetics

loans.name: Yakha

texts.fr: Yakha B. est une femme de 60 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants et tutrice d’un  garçon confié par un tiers. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAMBA 15 ans 1 depuis le 19 juillet 2002, elle a 15 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et ne s’est jamais confrontée à des difficultés de remboursement. Elle est vendeuse de crème glacée et de jus de fruit naturels qu’elle fabrique de ses propres mains. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 05 ans et son nouveau prêt lui permettra de la renforcer  en achetant plus de condiments pour la préparation de ses crèmes et jus de fruit. Son objectif est d’augmenter ses revenus financiers et de participer à la prise en charge des besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Yakha B. is sixty years old, married, the mother of three children and the guardian of a boy entrusted to her by someone else. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Samba since July 19, 2002. She has already benefitted from 15 consecutive loans and never met any difficulties in paying them back. She sells ice cream and natural fruit juices which she makes with her own hands. She has done this kind of work for more than five years and her new loan will help strengthen her business by allowing her to buy more ingredients needed to prepare her ice cream and fruit juices.
