Her goal is to increase her income and to participate in meeting the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of paint,

loans.name: Mrs. Rith Kuoy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of 17 people who live in Trapeang Reang village, Takeo Province. Mrs. Rith K., the village bank president selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes, was born in 1960. She and her husband, Mr. Chhan Sam, are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow a crop to sell to support their family. In the interests of improving their living standard, Ruth is now requesting a loan to buy some piglets to start a breeding business, with the rest being used to purchases fertilizer.

Ruth is a mother of four children, one of whom is a driver, another a seamstress in a garment factory, another a farmer, and another a student. Mr. Sen Sou is a group guarantor, so he is presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion L. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. She is 66 years old. Asuncion is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Asuncion owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Asuncion has been engaged in her business for over 50 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Asuncion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Asuncion is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Asuncion from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gai

texts.en: Gai  T. N. is 39 years old. She lives in the town of Dong anh with her family. Two of her children attend secondary school. Gai  T. N. has raised hundreds of  chickens for eggs since she was out of work in 2004.  Her business is quite good and she can get a stable income from it. The first loan that she received in 2006 helped her a lot in running the business and encouraged her to stay with our program. She would like a loan of 7,630,000 VND to buy 200  baby chickens and feed  for them.

loans.use: to buy 200  baby chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Good Guys Group

texts.en:
Lawrence G., shown holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Good Guys. He is 25 years old, married, and has two children who are three and seven years of age. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial constraints.

For seven years, Lawrence has been operating a foreign exchange bureau and selling phone cards in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 11,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 45,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more phone cards. He describes himself as a friendly man whose goal is to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy more phone cards

loans.name: Sandra Beatriz

texts.es:
Sandra Beatriz V. T. tiene 38 anos. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos de 13 anos hasta 11 meses. 
  
Sandra es una socia de la ventanilla rural Progreso Comunitario, que está ubicada a dos horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios. 

Sandra tiene una tienda general donde vende arroz, fideos, y otra comida. Hace las compras de sus productos en Mata de Cacao cada 8 días, que se queda una hora de su comunidad. 

Solicita el crédito para aumentar las cosas diferentes que vende en su tienda. Con el apoyo del crédito quiere invertir y vender mas cosas. Podrá mejorar su situación familiar económica por poder ampliar sus productos. Su sueno es tener una tienda bien grande y estable, y que a todos sus hijos estudien. Se desafía porque a veces la gente paga por crédito y nunca le pagan su dinero. 

No tiene tiempo libre porque trabaja de 6 en la mañana hasta 830 de la noche todos los días. Si no trabaja, no se venden sus productos.
texts.en:
Sandra is 38 years old. She lives with her common law husband in the village of Chillanes in the Bolívar province. She has four children ranging from 11 months to 13 years old. 
  
Sandra is a member of the rural ventanilla (rural loan group) Progreso Comunitario, located two hours from Chillanes. There are 11 members total, the majority of whom cultivate cocoa or have their own small businesses. 

Sandra has a general store that sells rice, pasta, and other food. She purchases her products from Mata de Cacao every eight days, which is one hour from her community. 

She is requesting a loan in order to increase the variety of products in her store. With the support of the loan she wants to invest and buy more things, helping her family's economic state. Her dream is to have a large and steady store and for all of her children to go to school. She is challenged because sometimes people pay on credit and never give her the money. 

She does not have free time because she works from 6:00 in the morning until 8:30 at night every day. If she doesn't work, she won't sell her products.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita J. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Melita is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests a variety of vegetables to sell, like eggplant, okra and others. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $355 a month for these activities.

In 2003, Melita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 38,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Melita is requesting a new loan of 38,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 20th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina L. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 52 years old and married, with 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Josefina runs a general store, where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Josefina also makes coconut candies that she sells at her store. 

Josefina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated as a result of the loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Monserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. Aquí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
Hace 11 años ella empezó a integrar el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor y desde que obtuvo su primer crédito ella mejoro su futuro, gracias a los créditos ella pudo incrementar su negocio y por eso está muy agradecida con la Fundación Espoir. Ella tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos de 14 – 13 y 4 años de edad,  los mayores están en el colegio. Su esposo es taxista.
 
Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es  puerta a puerta, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 10am hasta las 16h00. La mercadería la compra en Portoviejo y Guayaquil ciudades que visita una o dos veces por mes, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada semana los días domingos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa para niños. Sus sueños ser una gran empresaria y tener un buen local.
texts.en:
The 24 de Mayo canton is in the Manabí province.  It is known for its beautiful scenery, its forests, a variety of fauna, and its hard-working people who devote themselves to agriculture and raising animals.  This is where the “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother For a Better Future) Communal Bank meets every two weeks.

She became a member of the Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor Communal Bank 11 years ago.  Ever since she got her first loan she improved her future.  Thanks to the loans she was able to increase her business, and she is very grateful to the Fundación Espoir for this.  

She is 36 years old, married, and has three children.  The children are 14, 13, and 4 years old.  The oldest ones are in school.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  She sells all types of clothes door to door.  She works Monday through Friday from 10:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.  She buys the merchandise in the cities of Portoviejo and Guayaquil.  She goes there once or twice a month.  She gives credit, and she collects every Sunday.

She will use this loan to buy pants, T-shirts, blouses, and children’s clothes.  Her dreams are to be a great businesswoman and to have a good place.

loans.use: To buy pants, T-shirts, blouses, and children’s clothes

loans.name: Hyline

texts.en:
Hyline is a resident of Kisii Town in Western Kenya.  She is married with four children between the ages of six and twelve years old.  She is a teacher by profession and has been doing mixed farming for seven years and employs one farmhand.  Her produce of maize, beans, milk and fish are all sold locally.

She has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  She plans to use the income generated to expand her fish pond and pay school fees for her children.  She is also focusing on having two more dairy cows and to build rental houses.

Price fluctuations and insecurity are the greatest threats to her business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
D. Nguyễn Thị (20201070037) is a 52 year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - B. Ninh.  D. is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Trung Bạn (3).


D. is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To making a living, D. raises livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  D. has been engaged in this business for over 22 years and earns approximately 1.800.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, D. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  D. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2.464.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.496.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  D. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị B. (0) is a 36 year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Nguyễn Thị Huế (0) is a 39 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  Nguyễn Thị P. (0) is a 52 year-old female who is requesting a 2.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


D. Nguyễn Thị (20201070037) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - B. Ninh.  D. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Trung Bạn (3).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  D. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 22 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, D. kiếm được khoảng 1.800.000 VND.  Vào 2007, D. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  D. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.464.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.496.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị B. (0) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Huế (0) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nguyễn Thị P. (0) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía B. Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Marlon's Group

texts.en:
Marlon S. is from the village of Maligaya Echague. He is 35 years old. Marlon is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marlon is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marlon owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Marlon has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marlon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlon is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marlon from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 19-year-old single man living with his parents. He is from Lebanon. He has worked as an electrician for more than four years and in 2008, he decided to work as a freelance electrician, depending on customer’s demands. He helps his father with the family’s income. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his electric tools to be able to perform his work properly and provide his clients with better service.

loans.use: To renew his electric tools

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Madame Salimata Konaté est une femme mariée de 44 ans et mère de 2 enfants, qui vit avec ses enfants dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir abandonné l’école en classe de neuvième année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien), Salimata décida de s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à la fabrication et vente de l’encens. Elle a appris cette activité auprès d’une amie.
Pour obtenir un fond de roulement consistant pouvant satisfaire ses clients, elle décida de continuer à collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, des intrants rentrant dans  la fabrication de l’encens. 
Sa production est vendue à Bougouni,  Sikasso et à Bamako. Elle est très sollicitée dans la ville et sa clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes. Elle s'approvisionne en matières première au marché de Bougouni auprès des grossistes. Elle est à son quatrième prêt et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
La rotation de son activité est très élevée et elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000 FCFA.
C’est avec ce bénéfice qu’elle assurera certaines dépenses de la famille et  améliorera d’avantage son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salimata Konate is a married woman who is 44 years old and the mother of 2 children. She lives with her children in the Torakabougou quarter in Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

After she dropped out of school at the basic grade nine levels (Mali educational system), Salimata decided to take up a revenue generating activity, especially the making and sale of incense. She learned the business from a friend.

In order to have a working capital and to be able to consistently satisfy her clients, she decided to continue on with Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). She will purchase materials she needs in incense production. 

Her products are sold in Bougouni, Sikasso and in Bamako. She is highly solicited in the city and her clientele is primarily women. She purchases her materials in the market in Bougouni from wholesalers. She is on her fourth loan, following the successful repayment of all the previous loans. 

Her business experiences a high rate of sale and she expects to earn a monthly income of 40.000 FCFA. 

With this support she will secure her family's needs and will further improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make incense.

loans.name: Enrequita

texts.en:
Enrequita is a married woman who lives in Daan bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: tailoring and a general store.  Her husband, Pablito, who is 49 years old, works as a tailor to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 5 children who are between 11 to 21 years old. Enrequita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Enrequita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000.  She intends to use it to buy materials for the sewing machine so that she can continue to save up for her children's education and the improvement of her home & store. Enrequita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for the sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Santigie

texts.en: This is 39-year-old Santigie K..  He is married, and has three children aged 3, 6, and 12 years. In 1996, Santigie established his fuel business to earn income to support himself and his family.  Working 7 days a week and 19 hours a day, he earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to expand his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. In the future, Santigie plans to construct a house, support his children's education through university, establish a savings account for his retirement and open another shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drums of fuel for resale

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.en: Béatrice is 33 years old and lives in the Myssouro district of Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. A widow, she still looks after two of her three children.  For the past year Béatrice has sold firewood from her home to her neighbors. This is her first loan with ALIDE, and it will allow her to purchase firewood in bulk for resale. Her ambition is to build her own home. She claims her welcoming nature is her greatest attribute.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for resale

loans.name: Kimanyisho

texts.en: Kimanyisho N. is 30 years old, married and has four children. She has farmed her own piece of land for the last six years and makes a monthly profit of Ksh. 5,000. She learned about KADET LTD from our staff and has paid two previous loans on time. She used these loans to buy fertilizer, maize and other farm supplies. She hopes to use the profit generated by this loan to expand her farm and make sure that her children get a good education. She believes she can do this because she is a hardworking woman and is very dedicated to her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ross Mere

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ross Mere; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de preventista, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos entre otros productos, la socia lleva a diferentes tiendas de abarrotes, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos de tiendas de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para ahorrar para pagar los estudios de su hija.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ross Mere is a member of the San Rafael Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Ross Mere is 29 years old, single, and has one child.  She alternates her daily activities with the work of being a “preventista,” which means she ensures that stores have the products they need to sell.  She sells basic needs items like rice, sugar, oil, and noodles, among other products.

She takes the groceries to different stores.  It is through this business that she gets her children ahead.  She wants to expand her business of selling groceries to stores.

She is requesting the loan to save in order to pay for her daughter’s education.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to save in order to pay for her daughter's education.

loans.name: Edward Saitoti

texts.en: Edward Saitoti M. has been a farmer for the last eleven years. He is 31 years old, married to Carol who is a house wife, and blessed with two children. He learned about KADET LTD from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area. This is his third loan with which he plans to purchase farm supplies. He intends to use the profit from the loan to reinvest in farming and buy a bigger farm. Edward’s’ dreams is to be the best-known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.ru: Хабиба жительница района Шахритус. Ей 52 года. Она замужем. У нее 6 детей. Она предоставляет услугу. Арендует помещение, где открыла салон свадебных платьев. В этой области она уже 8 лет. Кредит берет для покупки новых видов свадебных платьев. Она хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Habiba lives in the Shahrituz Region. She is 52 years old. Married, with six children. She provides a service. She rents a store in which she opened a bridal salon. She has been in this business for eight years already. She is taking out a loan in order to buy new styles of wedding gowns. She would like to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy new types of wedding  gowns

loans.name: Francois

texts.en: Francois is 59 years old. He has four children who are aged 12-20 years. His wife does the same business with him. He sells second-hand clothes and he has been selling these clothes for the past 13 years. He is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and hence make more profit. He plans to continue feeding his family with the profit he plans to make.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Giri Puteri Group

texts.en:
The Giri Puteri group is made up of 15 women who are neighbors in the same village in Melaya, West Bali.  The group is seeking a loan of 30M IDR, and each member will receive 2M IDR.  The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement family income, and out of their interest in education on best practices for pig raising.  This is their first loan with MUK.

Ni Made is the head of the Giri Puteri group.  She is married and has one child, aged 7, first year in elementary school. Ni Made would like to help support her family with her pig raising business.   She plans to use the loans to buy four piglets. She plans to sell the piglets after five months fattening.  With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to pay school fees and expand her economic life.

loans.use: To buy four piglets.

loans.name: Mirma

texts.es:
Mirna, de 37 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Henry de 34 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Mirna es la compra y venta de pescado, ambulatoriamente distribuye a sus caseros su producto, el cual compra a precios muy cómodos. Ella tiene muchos clientes, ya que vende el pescado más fresco y sabroso del mercado y es una vendedora muy alegre, que siempre saca a sus clientes una sonrisa. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que éste trabajo la dignifica además que le es rentable para poder cubrir la necesidades de su hogar. Este es el primer crédito  con MFP, se siente muy feliz por desarrollarse como negociante y espera pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. 
Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más pescado, ya que últimamente esta teniendo más demanda.
texts.en:
Mirna, 37, is a very kind, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Henry, 34, and their three beloved children that she wants to provide a better quality of life for.  

Mirna is a fish merchant.  She is a street vendor selling her products, which she buys at affordable prices, to homeowners.  She has many customers because she sells the freshest and most delicious fish in the market and she’s a cheerful seller that always produces smiles in her customers.  She’s been in this line of work for 15 years and considers that the work dignifies her and that it’s profitable enough to cover household expenses.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She feels very happy to develop as a merchant and expects to pay all her installments on time.  She will use the requested 500 new soles to buy more fish since she’s had more demand lately.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is 35 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested an 18,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase additional items for her store and ingredients for her food production business.
Analy has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for five years and also earns an income from her food-vending and computer games businesses.
Analy aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items for her store and ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 29 year-old hardworking man living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  Moses has been in the transportation business for three years now and, according to him, has faced no major constraints.  

He needs the loan to buy a new motocycle.  His dream is to buy a plot of land on which to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy a new motocycle.

loans.name: Pamela Sofia

texts.es:
La señora Pamela es casada, tiene 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, tiene casa propia, donde posee las condiciones básicas para desarrollar sus actividades dentro del seno familiar y movilidad propia consistente en una motocicleta.
Ella se dedica al lavado de ropas dentro de toda la ciudad de Pilar. Desarrolla esta actividad hace como 2 años, posee la infraestructura necesaria para el desarrollo de esta actividad y su lavandería es muy reconocida por la excelente calidad de los productos utilizados para su actividad. Sueña con poder ampliar su negocio y de esa forma tener más capacidad para atender la demanda de sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima como ser detergentes, aromatizantes, suavizantes y demás utensilios necesarios para la realización de su labor. Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Pamela, 20, is married and lives in the city of Pilar.  She has her own house where she has the basic conditions to run her business within the bosom of her family.  She also has her own mode of transportation: a motorcycle.

She washes clothes from throughout the city of Pilar.  She’s been in this occupation for about two years.  She has the necessary infrastructure to carry out this work and her laundry is very well known because of the excellent quality of products she uses.  She dreams with being able to expand the business and be able to have more capacity to meet customer demand.

She is asking for the loan to buy raw materials like detergents, odor eliminators, fabric softener and other necessary utensils to carry out her work.  She thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy laundry supplies.

loans.name: Lia Vanessa

texts.es: Lia es una joven de 20 años de edad que vive en el municipio de Soledad, donde tiene un negocio llamado “Peluquería Ludys”, el cual funciona hace 6 años ofreciendo servicios de corte de cabello, masajes, peinados y servicios para mejorar la imagen personal y profesional de hombres, mujeres, jóvenes y niños. Lia planea adecuar el espacio físico donde funciona su peluquería, ponerle rejas, puertas, ventanas, lámparas, y también requiere adicionar un secador y comprar en mayor volumen, champo, enjuagues y otros insumos de belleza. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Snto Domingo, pues con ello su capital de trabajo aumentaría y lograría descuentos por compras en volúmenes y de contado, que trasladaría en más ingresos y precios competitivos. Su sueño es lograr el confort de sus clientes, el crecimiento de su peluquería tal cual se requiere para lograr posicionarla en su mercado y agradar a su clientela.
texts.en:
Lia, age 20, is a young woman who lives in the town of Soledad where she has a business called “Peluquería Ludys”. For the past six years Lia has been offering haircuts, massages, styling, and other services to improve one’s personal and professional image. Her customers include men, women, teenagers, and children. Lia will equip her physical space so that she can operate her salon. She plans to install bars, doors, windows, and lamps. Lia also needs an additional hair dryer and supplies in large volumes such as shampoos, conditioners, and other beauty supplies. For this reason she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

This loan will increase her operating capital so that she can obtain discounts when making bulk purchases with cash, which will result in more income and competitive prices. Her dream is to make her customers more comfortable. The growth of her salon requires her to achieve a better position in the marketplace and to expand her customer base.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer, shampoos, conditioners, and other beauty supplies.

loans.name: Iskra Tamara

texts.es: Iskra Tamara tiene 27 años, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que están a su cargo. Desde hace mas de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que sus inicios son con esfuerzos propios, pues desde muy joven su Mama le enseño a ganarse la vida. Su negocio es la venta de refrescos, la mayoría de sus clientes son amigos, vecinos y familiares. A pesar de las difíciles situaciones que ha enfrentado sigue con esta actividad. Ella invertirá el financiamiento en materia prima como frutas, bolsas, pajillas, azúcar y otros productos. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda, pues todavía no tiene ciertos servicios básicos.
texts.en: Iskra Tamara is 27. She has 3 young children who are under her care. She has had her business, which she stared on her own, for over 4 years. From a very young age, her mother taught her how to make her living. Her business is selling drinks. The majority of her customers are friends, neighbours and family members. Despite the difficult situations that she has faced, she continues with her work. She will invest this loan in basic materials such as fruit, bags, straws, sugar, and other products. She dreams of improving her home, since she does not have certain basic services.

loans.use: to buy fruit, bags, straws, sugar and other products.

loans.name: Aida Luz

texts.es: La señora Aida Luz es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que desde hace ocho años ha hecho una vida vendiendo frutas y verduras. Ella usará el préstamo para comprar yuca, repollo, tomate, malanga, naranjas, etc. Ella tiene tres hijos, ya crecidos, y ella desea continuar trabajando y apostando a sí misma.
texts.en: Aida is a hardworking and enterprising woman who, for the past eight years, has been making a living by selling fruits and vegetables. She will use the loan to purchase manioc, cabbage, tomatoes, mangoes, oranges, etc. She has three grown-up children and wishes to keep on working and believing in herself.

loans.use: to purchase manioc, cabbage, tomatoes, mangoes, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Safa'a

texts.en:
Safa'a is a 39-year-old female from Al Hashmi, Jordan.

Safa'a is designing web pages and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase a personal computer.

Safa'a started her business at nternet cafes. Then she purchased her own computer and started her own business from home.

Safa'a is looking to train her husband and some of her sisters to make web pages and she is willing to update her PC and purchase a laptop.

loans.use: to purchase a personal computer

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 30 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. For the past three years, Irene has been working hard to manage her bricklaying business, which sells bricks for local construction projects. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more supplies to make bricks, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and improve her family's quality of life. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a daycare center. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Irene who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies to make bricks

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. 

William has a motorcycle unit used to transport passengers in the village. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy tools and pay for gasoline and maintenance.

William is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, William hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline and maintenance

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María cuenta con 52 años de edad, es viuda su esposo falleció ahora tiene 6 hijos los cuales son muy independientes ellos mismo y también ayudan a doña María.

Ella se dedica a la costura pero no basta para doña María porque también es comerciante ella vende perfumes por catalogo lo cual ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de telas para su costura y surtió sus pedidos que tenía pendientes doña María dice que les tal yendo muy bien con su negocio a ella le gustaría que su negocio creciera un poco mas incrementarlo más.
texts.en:
María is 52 years old and a widow.  She has six children who are very independent.  They also help her out.

María has a sewing business but that is not enough for her as she is also a saleswoman.  She sells perfumes through a catalog.  She invested her loan in buying fabric for her sewing business and filling some orders that she had.  María says that her business is doing very well and she would like to grow and increase her business a little more.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her sewing business and to fill some orders that she has

loans.name: Miramar Femenino 3 Group

texts.en: Ana is the coordinator of Grupo Miramar Femenina 3. The group is made up of five women who have businesses selling clothing, shoes and cosmetics, among other things. Some of them sell door-to-door while others run their businesses out of their homes. Ana is very excited to receive her thirteenth loan from Esperanza Internacional. She's been getting loans from us and investing them in her business. She will use the current loan to buy grocery products for her Colmado, which is a small grocery store where most of her neighbors go to buy their daily meals. The investment will be in rice, beans, cooking oil, canned products, sugar and other goods. Ana is the mother of four children; right now only two of them live together with her and their father. Ana has been married for more than 20 years. In the future, she would like to have land with cattle. She also wants to save enough money and overcome the economic crisis. She enjoys attending church. This group is in the town of Samana, a popular tourist destination on the Atlantic Ocean that's surrounded by a lush, mountainous landscape. The community has few economic resources and services, since it's a very rural area. The main businesses in town belong to the members of this group.

loans.use: To buy grocery products.

loans.name: La Reforma 3 Group

texts.en:
Urcania is one of the members of the La Reforma 3 (Reform) group. They are micro-entrepreneurs dedicated to selling clothing, natural goods, shoes, education services, etc., in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, which is famous for its athletes and its sugar industry. At present, its economy depends on the duty-free industrial zones, the cement industry and other minor activities like tourism.

Urcania is the mother of two children and, together with her long-term partner, she has been able to provide the necessities for her family, which include needs like school supplies, clothes, shoes for her children. She is also saving for her dream, which is to have her own house.

Urcania is receiving her 9th loan. For each loan, she has made her payments on time and has made good investments. She is planning to invest her new loan to purchase goods for her cafeteria, where she sells sandwiches, burgers, juices and other different foods and snacks. 

Urcania is saving her income to make her dreams come true. In the short term, she is going to use her earnings to buy furniture for her living room and save, because her plan in the short term is to have a house and a bigger cafeteria. She will be able to do this by saving and continuing to invest in her business. With Esperanza's loans, she will be able to improve her family's and her own life.

loans.use: To buy snacks, bread, jam, cheese, eggs, fruits, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To service his motorcycle and purchase some spare parts

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Graciela; Actualmente se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia prepara panes en casa y los vende de forma independiente en la plaza de armas
texts.en: The member is Mrs. Graciela.  She currently works in retail.  She prepares breads at home and sells them in the town square.

loans.use: to buy new cellular equipment.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis, tiene 53  años de edad, es una mujer alegre, luchadora. Esta casada con Amancio quien es jubilado. Juntos habitan en compañía de sus tres hijos y un ahijado, y su nuera, en su casa propia la cual construyó con el apoyo de su esposo.  Gladis se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su bodega, negocio que está instalada  en su propia casa, siendo muy concurrida por los vecinos a quienes atiende muy amablemente. Se dedica a esta actividad hace 7 años. Por otro lado, se dedica también a alquilar cuartos, que es muy concurrida por los turistas y personas de la zon. Éste hospedaje lleva ya 4 años de funcionamiento, contando con el apoyo de su nuera para la atención al público. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le trae ingreso económico que le permite mantener su hogar, y pagar los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos menores. Por ello considera rentable la actividad que realiza ya que es bastante concurrido y le ha traído muchas satisfacciones, espera  seguir creciendo y ampliar más su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP, le gusta mucho su grupo por que siente que son responsables. Espera poder seguir bien y seguir trabajando con la institución a quien agradece mucho por la oportunidad. Así como le agrada estar en su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y amables. Con el monto solicitado 3000 nuevos  soles comprará abarrotes  en general al por mayor a menor costo para surtir su bodega, y colchones para implementar más su hospedaje y tener mayor acogida.
texts.en:
Gladis, 53, is a cheerful, tenacious woman.  She’s married to Amancio who is retired.  They live together with their three children, a godson and her daughter-in-law in her own house that she built with help from her husband.

Gladis sells groceries in her store, a business that’s installed in her house and that is very popular with her neighbors who she tends to very kindly.  She’s been in business 7 years.  She also rents rooms that are quite sought after by tourists and locals.  The rentals have been in operation for 4 years and her daughter-in-law helps her tend to the public.

What she likes about her work is that it produces income that allows her to support her home and pay her younger children’s school costs.  She considers her work to be profitable because it’s quite heavily patronized and it’s brought her much satisfaction.  She hopes to continue growing and expanding more.

This will be MFP loan #10.  She likes her group very much because she feels that they are responsible people.  She hopes to continue well and working with the institution which she thanks very much for the opportunity.  She enjoys being in the communal bank because she considers the members to be responsible and kind.

She will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy groceries in general at wholesale and at lower prices to stock her store and to buy mattresses to better furnish her inn and be better received.

loans.use: Comprar más productos para abastecer su tienda, asimismo comprar un colchon para implementar el servicio de hospedaje.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria  es casada, tiene 40 años de edad, cursó el tercer año de educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos, 3 de los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica a la producción de pantalones y faldas, inició este negocio como operaria y hasta el momento lleva 16 años de experiencia, cuanta con el apoyo de su esposo qu9ien hace el mismo trabajo.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materiales consistente en telas e hilos y mejorar su producción de pantalones y faldas, telas de lonas, gabardina, telas lamina. Espera incrementar el numero de trabajadores con los que tiene.
texts.en:
Maria is married, 40 years old, and studied through the third year of primary school. She has five children, three of whom are students. She works making pants and skirts. She began this business as a loom operator and so far has sixteen years of experience, and has the support of her husband who does the same work. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy some supplies such as fabric and yarn to improve her production of pants and skirts, tarpaulins, raincoats, and fabrics for laminating. She hopes to increase the amount of work that she gets.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread to make pants and skirts

loans.name: Galina

texts.en: Galina is a 41 year old woman from the village Vegini in Georgia. She lives with husband and two daughters in a house. Next to her jobs the family has own land where they grew peaches. Now that the trees got old they cut them and want to plant grapes. With the money they can buy the seedlings and start their business. The credit helps the family to obtain additional income.

loans.use: She wants to by grape plants and cultivate grape garden

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is an artisan with 10 years of experience, he manufactures all type of crafts with wood, from furniture until wooden decorations. José was working in a cooperative of artisans people, however, Jose could not support his family expenses, for this reason, he decided to start his own business in the same line of work, Jose does not have capital to increase his product and his sales. Jose has 3 children, 2 young women and a adult male who helps him in his business.

**. He and his son need are requesting for a loan of $375 Dlls to purchase of tools and raw materials, because the tools that they are using are very rudimentary and they cannot supply the great demand that they have. With a new capital they hope to increase the production, saving time and improving the quality of their products. Jose and his family thanks your support.

** ** \\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

** José es un artesano con 10 años de experiencia, fabrica todo tipo de artesanías con la madera, desde muebles, hasta adornos de madera. José estaba trabajando en una cooperativa de personas artesanas, sin embargo, José no alcanzaba para los gastos familiares, por lo que decido emprender su propio negocio del mismo género, sin embargo, José carece de capital para producir y poder incrementar el producto y sus ventas. José tiene 3 hijos, 2 mujeres jovencitas y un varón adulto, quien le ayuda en su taller.

** El como su hijo necesitan de un préstamo de $375 Dlls para comprar herramienta y materia prima, debido que la herramienta con la que hoy trabajan es muy rudimentaria y no pueden abastecer la gran demanda que tienen. Con un nuevo capital esperan aumentar la producción ahorrando tiempo y mejorando la calidad de sus productos. José su familia agradecen tu apoyo.

**

loans.use: Purchase of tools and raw materials

loans.name: Comlan

texts.en:
Comlan N’TSOUGAN was born in 1970 and is married with four children. After finishing secondary school, he studied agropastoral farming, which led to raising livestock. Presently, he provides for his family with the small earnings he makes from raising pigs. He quickly joined a group of other stockbreeders and earned a loan through them. He has a lot of experience raising this kind of livestock, and has earned a good reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $950 to modernize his operation, which includes buying troughs and grain and introducing a more productive species of pig. This will enable him to increase his income, improve his working conditions and provide for his family.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1970, Monsieur N’TSOUGAN Comlan est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants. Après ses études secondaires, il s’est fait formé en Agropastoral qui lui ouvre la porte de l’élevage. Aujourd’hui, Monsieur N’TSOUGAN subvient aux besoins de sa famille à partir des maigres revenus de l’élevage du porcin, Très tôt, il adhère à un groupement auprès duquel il a bénéficié d’un crédit. Il possède une grande expérience en ce type d’élevage ; ce qui lui confère une bonne réputation.

Il sollicite un crédit de $950 pour moderniser son élevage : acheter des abreuvoirs, des sons et introduire une nouvelle espèce de porcs plus productrice. La réussite de ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et améliorer ses conditions de travail et celles de sa famille.

loans.use: Modernize livestock operation, buy troughs and grain, and introduce new types of pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow for her commercial dairy farming business

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
MatilD. is 44 years old and married; she lives with her husband. Ramón is 54 years old and currently works in a cleaning products factory.

MatilD. has 3 children: 2 sons and a daughter. Two of her children are in secondary school. Due to the demands of their school work, the family put in a lot of effort and succeeded in buying a computer for the house so that her children could do their school work at home. The family was able to buy the computer with a loan from Fundación Paraguaya.

MatilD. has worked for 8 years buying and selling all types of clothing. She left the work for a period of 4 years when her mother fell ill, but had to return to it in order to support her husband, a builder who travels continually to Argentina looking for better work opportunities.

MatilD. sells her products door to door, from a small truck owned by the family. She is a very enterprising woman, very sure of her self and willing to make any sacrifice to improve her children's quality of life.

She is applying for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of winter children's clothing. She already has many orders to cover for jackets, T-shirts, jeans, shirts, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. MatilD. tiene 44 años, es casada y vive con su esposo. El Sr. Ramón tiene 54 años D. edad y actualmente está trabajando en una fábrica en donD. se elaboran productos D. limpieza.

Tiene 3 hijos: dos varones y una nena. Dos D. sus hijos están estudiando en la secundaria, y debido a las exigencias del estudio han hecho un gran esfuerzo para adquirir una computadora D. manera que sus hijos puedan hacer uso D. ella en su propia casa. Para ello han recurrido en una oportunidad a un préstamo que la Fundación Paraguaya les otorgó para adquirir dicha herramienta.

La Sra. MatilD. se dedica hace 8 años aproximadamente a la actividad D. compra y venta D. ropas D. todo tipo, trabajo que suspendió por un período D. 4 años debido a la enfermedad D. su madre, pero que tuvo que retomar debido a la necesidad D. apoyar a su esposo quien es constructor y que viaja continuamente a Argentina en busca D. mejores horizontes laborales. Hace sus recorridos todos los días por la ciudad D. Itá visitando casa por casa a su clientela en una pequeña camioneta, propiedad D. la familia. Es una mujer muy emprendedora y segura D. sí misma, dispuesta a cualquier sacrificio a fin D. dar un mejor nivel D. vida a sus hijos. Ella solicita un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra D. ropas D. temporada D. invierno, ya que tiene muchos pedidos que debe cubrir como ser: camperas, remeras, jeans, camisas, etc.

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell: jackets, pullovers, Tshirts, jeans

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
S. Florence is married and has four children: three boys and a girl. She is a vegetarian and thus has a passion for vegetables. She sells vegetables and Matoke (green bananas) at Seguku on the Kampala – Entebbe road. She has been in this business for the last 18 years. The business has helped her to look after her family very well and recently she bought a plot in Seguku which she plans to develop.

Her husband also works and his income helps to pay their children's school fees and cover the family's household expenses.

So far, S. has serviced five loans of $100, 150, 180, 200 and 220 very well. It is her wish to improve her stock by including other vegetables such as cabbages, spinach, carrots as well as fruits to attract a good number of customers.

loans.use: Florence wants to improve her stock of vegetables such as cabbages, spinach, carrots as well as fruits to attract a good number of customers.

loans.name: Ablakpi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ablakpi L. is 55 years old, married, and mother of three children. She lives in Togblé, Togo where she also has a business selling palm oil (for culinary purposes) and firewood. Because of her lack of capital and other difficulties of running a business, she is asking for a loan of US$ 200 so that she can maintain a constant supply of palm oil and firewood, so that she can get her business going again.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame L. Ablakpi âgée de 55 ans, est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle réside à Togblé où elle exerce comme activité la vente d’huile de palme et de bois de chauffage. Par manque de fond de commerce, et certaines difficultés qu’elle rencontre dans ses activités, elle sollicite un crédit de $200 pour faire le stockage permanent d’huile et de bois afin de relancer ses activités.

loans.use:
purchase of palm oil for resale

Stockage d'huile

loans.name: Olatunji

texts.en: Olatunji M. is a mother of 2, 35 years old, and hails from Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells clothes in her community. She is a LAPO member (the lender) and has been in business for years. She is in needs a loan to buy more clothes to be sold.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Quyền, 46 years old, lives with her husband and 3 children in Minh Phú, Sóc Sơn province. In 1996, the TYM Fund opened more branches to rural areas, she was one of the firsts joining the Fund. In the first year, she took out a loan of 30USD to invest in poultry. She also processes and sells chicken meat at home. In 2000, the family has had a farm of 300 to 500 chickens for meat. Her farm processes about 100 kg chicken meat every day for retails and restaurants in the area. Part of the income, they invest in their son’s education in the electronic vocational school. In November 2007, she took a lease and opened a store selling mobile phones in downtown Sóc Sơn. She is applying for a loan of 950USD to buy chicken. The family’s income is about 250USD a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Quyền, 46 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại xã Minh Phú, Sóc Sơn. Năm 1996, chi nhánh 2 Quỹ Tình thương mở rộng địa bàn hoạt động ra các thôn trong xã, chị là một trong những người đầu tiên của thôn tham gia thành lập cụm 13. Năm thứ nhất chị xin vay 30USD mua gà con về chăn nuôi và mổ thịt bán tại nhà với số lượng nhỏ. Đến năm 2000 gia đình chị đã mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi với số lượng lớn, trong chuồng luôn có từ 300 - 500 con gà thịt. Mỗi ngày cửa hàng của chị Quyền giết mổ khoảng 100kg gà bán lẻ tại chợ huyện Sóc Sơn và xuất cho các nhà hàng ăn uống trong huyện. Từ tiền lãi thu được chị bàn với chồng đầu tư cho con trai đi học lớp sửa chữa điện tử. Tháng 11/2007 gia đình chị đã thuê địa điểm và mở cửa hàng kinh doanh điện thoại di động tại huyện Sóc Sơn. Vòng vốn này chị Quyền xin vay 950USD để mua gà thịt. Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình hàng tháng khoảng 250USD

loans.use: Buy chicken

loans.name: Kitega F(I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret N.. She is currently in the business of laundry and drycleaning. She is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy more laundry equipment. Margret is 28 years old and she is married with a husband that works as well. She has a daughter aged 10 who attends school. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 30,000 in profits. With the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to start a poultry business.

Margret is joined in her small group by Suzan M., Rose N., Irene N., and Fatumah N.. Suzan M. is currently in the business of running a nursery school and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to construct a new classroom. Rose N. is currently in the business of brick laying and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to expand her brick business. Irene N. is currently in the business of selling used clothing. She is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to increase her stock. Fatumah N. is currently in the salon business and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy more hairdryers.

loans.use: To invest in the businesses

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria is an example of a women that always comes out on top no matter the difficulty. She can also be qualified as a person with a lust for life and enjoys every moment that life offers. She works where needed, whether it be lending her hand in the fields, selling local prepared dishes, selling milk, or providing laundry services. Her main line of work, however, is sewing clothes; which she does in small space of her home with a sewing machine she paid for with a lot of hard work. She loves to sit in front of her shop and sew clothes which she sells at the local markets in her city. She is using this opportunity to ask for your help to stock her little shop with raw materials in different colors and qualities and thus optimize and increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

María, es ejemplo de una mujer que sobresale ante cualquier dificultad, se le puede calificar también como una persona con talento para vivir y disfrutar de cada momento que le otorga la vida.Su ocupación la desarrolla según la ocasión, por ejemplo, se dedica a las tareas de campo ofreciendo su mano de obra, vende en algunas ocasiones comidas típicas, también vende leche y ofrece servicios de lavado de prendas; pero sin duda la actividad principal es la de tejer prendas de vestir a máquina, las herramientas de trabajo con las que se desempeña en un pequeño espacio de su hogar las ha conseguido con mucho esfuerzo.Le satisface mucho permanecer al frente de su taller y teje faldones sin descano para ofertarlos en las ferias locales de su ciudad.En esta oportunidad recurre en búsqueda de tu ayuda para implementar su pequeño taller con materia prima de diferentes colores y calidades a fin de optimizar y acrecentar su producción.

loans.use: Injection of capital to acquire a larger quantity of raw materials and optimize the fabrication of clothing for the general public.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel T. V. runs a general store in the city of Pucallpa. She started the store a year ago and it has grown quickly. She has a good location in Market #3 and always serves her clients with a smile.

Raquel is 43 years old, has 2 children, and is happily married. She is very hard working and only sleeps for a few hours each night so that she has time to take care of her many responsibilities. After she closes her shop in the afternoon, she goes home to cook and sell grilled meats to her neighbors.

A member of the community bank Amigas Siempre Unidas, Raquel is requesting a loan of $475 to repay over 6 months. Raquel will use the loan to buy sugar, rice, eggs, oil, and other popular products for her store.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, eggs, oil, and other popular products for her store

loans.name: Mwatima's Kiwa Mama Bora Group

texts.en:
Mwatima, age 27, is the a single parent of 3 children. She owns a charcoal and bread business, and has been selling these items for 3 years. Each month, these sales bring her a profit of about $180.

Mwatima hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and bread to sell. She will share this loan with Mwanajuma. They are both members of the Kiwa Mama Bora loan group, whose members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and bread to sell

loans.name: Yawa Eléonore Zita

texts.fr:
Mrs. Yawa Eléonore Zita T. was born on August 16, 1973 in Kpadapé, in the Kloto prefecture. She is single and has one child. Since 1995, she has been selling traditional African cloth and charcoal. Seventy percent of her capital is dedicated to selling charcoal. She earns a decent income from these sales, as she is able to sell both wholesale and retail. Her primary suppliers are farmers from the plateau region. Her first loan, which she quickly repaid, allowed her to purchase her supplies for last year. This second loan she is requesting will allow her to purchase 35 bags of charcoal in order to boost her sales.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame T. Yawa Eléonore Zita est née le 16 Août 1973 à Kpadapé dans la préfecture de Kloto. Elle est célibataire avec un enfant à charge. Depuis 1995, elle exerce le commerce de pagne et de charbon. 70% de son fonds de commerce est alloué à l’activité de charbon de bois. Elle tire assez de revenu dans cette activité car elle vend en gros et en détail. Ses principaux fournisseurs sont des paysans de la région des plateaux. Le premier crédit qu’elle a promptement remboursé lui permis de faire le stock l’année passée. Le second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 35 sacs de charbon de bois en vue d’améliorer ses ventes.

loans.use: Purchase of 35 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Monica is an industrious and diligent 22 year old woman. Her financial situation did not allow he to complete her education, but she has not lost hope of achieving this dream one day. Since she finished high school, and with support from her family, she decided to rent a small shop and work with leather (making and dying jackets, trousers, shoes etc), a trade that she learnt from her brothers who work in this area too, and that she performs efficiently. Monica would like to actively contribute to the improvement of her familiy's quality of life and she is sure that with this business she will be able to do this. She will invest the sum that she is asking for in the implementation of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Mónica, emprendedora y diligente joven de 22 años de edad, sus posibilidades económicas no le permitieron seguir sus estudios superiores pero tampoco pierde las esperanzas de concretar algún día ese gran anhelo, desde que concluyó sus estudios secundarios y con apoyo de sus familiares decidió alquilar un local y dedicarse a realizar trabajos en cuero (teñido y arreglo de casacas, pantalones, calzados, etc) este oficio que desempeña eficientemente lo aprendió de sus hermanos quienes encuentran en esta actividad su principal sustento. Mónica desea contribuir de manera activa al mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de su familia y está segura que a través de este servicio que brinda lo conseguirá. El aporte que solicita lo invertirá en implementar su negocio.

loans.use: To implement her business/Implementar los insumos necesarios para su negocio.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is the wife of G. M. and has lived in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the last 25 years. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her elder son is a daily wage laborer, and the other three children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her husband is a vegetable seller and has been in this profession for the last 10 years. She successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more vegetables for her husband’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to resell. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy thread for her carpet weaving business. Salma baji wants a loan to buy more milk for her milk business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Nilda Rossio

texts.es:
Nilda is 31 and lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and two daughters. She is a hardworking mom; she works in agriculture and stock breeding. The animals facilitate her work in the land and reduce her efforts when going from one place to another. She has worked on this since she got married with the purpose of helping her husband with his work. Working as a farmer takes all of her day, starting very early in the morning. She likes this activity because its good to see the result of her efforts during harvest season, that makes all the hours of hard work worth it, however, there are moments when the prices in the market go down, which is discouraging but doesn’t stop her from working harder. Now she wishes to purchase fertilizers for her land and this way have a good production.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Nilda tiene 31, vive con su esposo que es agricultor y sus dos hijas. Es una trabajadora, madre de familia dedicada a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales, los cuales le ayudan en su trabajo dentro de sus terrenos, y sobre todo aminoran la carga que tienen el trasladarse.Esta actividad como agricultora la realiza desde que contrajo matrimonio, con el fin de ser un apoyo y ayuda idónea para su esposo en su trabajo, dicha actividad le toma todo el día, desde muy tempranas horas.Esta actividad le empezó a agradar porque en los tiempos de cosecha puede ver los frutos de su trabajo, esto reconforta todas las horas de sacrificio, sin embargo, hay momentos en que los precios en los mercados disminuyen, lo cual la desanima, pero no la limita a seguir trabajando. Nilda tiene en su familia y sobre todo en sus hijos, las razones para seguir esforzándose. Ahora desea acceder a los abonos y fertilizantes que requiere para sus cultivos y así seguir produciendo favorablemente.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for land

loans.name: Roberto  Carlos

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, el caballero Roberto S. con gran ahínco se dedica a la actividad agropecuaria la cual desde hace varios años la ejerce con el fin de mantener su humilde hogar de habitación.

Los sueños del señor Roberto S. son mejorar su condición de vida por medio de la mejora de su actividad agropecuaria. Por este motivo es que continúa apoyándose de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel para así brindarle una mejor condición de vida a su familia y mejorar las condiciones de su actividad económica agropecuaria. El destino del crédito el cual solicita es para asistencia en los cultivos y para la compra de terneros para su respectivo desarrollo.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega, Caballero Roberto S., with great devotion, works in agriculture which he has done for many years. He does this work with the goal of keeping his humble home.

Roberto S.’s dreams are to improve the quality of life by improving his agricultural work. For this reason, he continues to rely on the loans provided by Ceprodel so that he can provide a better quality of life to his family and to improve the quality of his farming. The loan he requests will be used to tend to his crops and for the purchase of calves to raise.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tending to Crops and the Purchase of Cattle

loans.name: Sandra Carolina

texts.es: La señora Sandra Carolina S. C. tiene la edad de 31 años habita en el Barrio San Fernado ubicado en la Ciudad de Masaya, esta señora es casada, de ella dependen 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja para ayudarle con los gastos de la casa, ella tiene un taller de costura desde hace 7 años, con su trabajo y mucho esfuerzo ha logrado darle lo mejor a sus pequeños , doña Sandra necesita apoyo financiero ya que  en estos momentos no cuenta con muchos recursos y quiere incrementar su inventario lo cual necesita la cantidad de C$ 4,000.00 córdobas, para comprar algunos materiales de trabajo .
texts.en:
Sñora Sandra Carolina S. C. is 31 years old and lives in the neighborhood San Fernando located in the City of Masaya. This lady is married and has three children who depend on her. Her husband works to help her with the household costs. She has owned a sewing workshop for seven years. With her work and lots of effort, she has succeeded in giving the best to her little ones. Doña Sandra needs financial support since right now she doesn't have many resources with which to work and she wants to increase her inventory. For this purpose, she needs C$ 4,000 (Córdobas, the currency of Nicaragua) to buy some work materials.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy work materials.

loans.name: Manso Group

texts.en:
This is Fatmata K. and Hawa C.. They named their group Manso. This will be their fifth loan from SMT. The previous loans have had meaningful impacts in the lives of these people. The last loan they received from Kiva through SMT was for 800,000 LE each. Now they are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 LE each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses.

Fatmata K. (left) is the leader of the group. Fatmata is thirty-three years of age. She was born in Makeni City, in the Bombali District in northern Sierra Leone. She is married with two children, both of whom are in primary schools. Her husband is a tailor. The two work hard to sustain the family. Fatmata has been baking and selling bread for over four years now at the town’s main market. With this loan, Fatmata will reinvest the proceeds into her bread business. She will use the whole loan to buy bags of flour. A bag of flour costs her 140,000 LE in Makeni. She will be able to buy seven bags of flour with the loan. With the numerous loans she has received from Kiva through SMT, she was able to buy herself a manual machine to help her mix the flour very well.

With the profit she makes, Fatmata uses part of it to repay her monthly loan, part to feed herself and her children and the rest is saved for future use. Having repaid her loan successfully, it is her wish to buy herself a plot of land and prepare herself for the challenge of building a house.

loans.use: To buy at least seven bags of flour for her business

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is Shamim M., a 39-year-old woman from Mwanza. She is a widow with four children, who are between the ages of 14 and 20 years old.

Shamim M. has been operating a charcoal sales business since 1998. Notably, many Tanzanians use charcoal for fuel to cook their daily meals; indeed, women cook food in small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags, or kerosene in order to light the charcoal. Fortunately, there is a high demand for charcoal across the country, so charcoal-selling is quite a lucrative profession. She works at her business 16 hours per day, 7 days per week, though she notes that she receives assistance from one employee. In doing so, Shamim currently earns approximately $440 per month from her business operations. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $425 in order to purchase more charcoal for resale purposes. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Shamim thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services. Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her. As such, one of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional charcoal

loans.name: Luz Aurora

texts.es: La Sra.: Luz, trabaja en una casa particular dando sus servicios de domestica desde hace dos año, es un trabajo muy agotado y no es tan buen salario pero sastiface las necesidades de su familia, tiene 46 años de edad, y resida en Villa reconciliación en la ciudad de Managua, antes vendía por cuenta propia carnes de cerdo ambulante, pero había día que no vendía lo que debía y quebró su negocio, su esposo trabaja de conductor de camión, lo cual no da con los gastos por eso trabajamos los dos, con esta solicitud de préstamo es la cuarta en Afodenic que ha sido de mucho beneficios ya que con cada préstamo han ido terminando y mejorando su casa, esta solicitud va a comprar un inodoro y todo los artefacto de su instalación para estar mas higiénica y poder gozar de un baño digno con su familia.  sus planes a futuro es comenzar su negocio por su propia cuenta, y así poder ayudar a sus hijos que tengan una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Luz has worked as a domestic in a private home for the past two years. It's extremely exhausting work and the pay is not great, but it meets her family's needs. She is 46-years-old and lives in Villa Reconciliación in the city of Managua. In the past she had worked for herself as a street vendor selling pork products, but in the end she could not sell as much as she needed to so she closed the business. He husband is a truck driver, which does not pay enough to cover their expenses, so they both have to work. This is the fourth loan they are seeking from AFODENIC. The loans, which they've been using to finish their house and do home improvements, have been very beneficial to them. They plan to use this loan to buy a toilet and the materials to install it, so the family can have a decent bathroom and enjoy better hygiene. Their future plans include starting their own business, and having the means to help their children obtain a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a toilet and the matierials to install it.

loans.name: Noemi Marcelina

texts.es:
Noemí es madre de cuatro hijos, dos de ellos aun viven con ella y con su esposo. A partir de este año ella se dedica a vender ropa deportiva ofreciéndoles a amigos y familiares, pero especialmente a deportistas que encuentra visitando diferentes gimnasios.
