Se animo a emprender este negocio con la idea de progresar y seguir creciendo.

Por otro lado, desde hace cinco años Noemí se encarga de atender en un salón de belleza propio. Debido a sus estudios de comestología, hace algún tiempo decidió abrir las puertas de su casa y ofrecer el servicio de corte de cabello y peinado a sus amigos en un primer momento y luego a diversos clientes.

Gracias al espacio que goza en su salón de belleza, Noemí también vende maquillaje y cosméticos en general. Por lo pronto, lo que ella espera en el futuro es contar con la ayuda de su hija, quien también estudiará comestología, para poder ampliar el local de su salón y poner uno nuevo en el mercado para la venta de ropa
texts.en:
Noemi is the mother of four children, two of whom still live with her and huer husband. For the past year, she has worked selling athletic clothing to friends and family but especially to athletes that she finds while visiting various gyms. She decided to start this business in order to help her progress and to grow her income. For the past five years, Noemi has tended to her own beauty parlor. Due to her studies in cosmetology, she had decided to open the doors of her home to offer hair cuts and styling first to her friends, and later to other customers. Thanks to the amount of space in her beauty parlor, Noemi also sells makeup and cosmetics in general. In the future, she hopes to also have the assistance of her daughter who will also study cosmetology; this will allow her to expand the shop and put up a new store in the market to sell clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of athletic clothing to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy L., 28 years old, is a typical "tapisero" (sugarcane cutter) of  Barandias, Pangantucan, Bukidnon, Southern Philippines. She and her husband receive PHP100 (USD$2.50) a day for their labor.  The couple comes from the Manobo tribe and they  have been in financial difficulty for the past years. She then decided to engage in rice trading with her co-"tapaseros" as her main customers. Currently, Joy and her husband continue to be "tapaseros" so they can earn additional income. However, income is not sufficient for the family. To expand her business, she needs an additional capital amounting to PHP 8000 to purchase milled rice directly from the farmers.

loans.use: To purchase  bags of milled rice for sale

loans.name: Ana Yudith

texts.es:
Ana inició el negocio para ayudar con los gastos familiares a su esposo ya que el no cuenta con un trabajo fijo. Comenzó el negocio en abril del 2006 ayudando a una amiga a realizar ventas de productos de plastico para el hogar, desde entonces a la fecha le ha hido bastante bien ahora realiza sus propias ventas  y surte mas mercancia que ha ido invirtiendo por su propia cuenta para revender.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $5,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para poder surtir  mercancia y poder realizar unos bingos que tiene programados, los cuales los usa como estrategia para atraer clientes y vender.
texts.en:
Ana started her business to help out her husband with the household expenses since he doesn't have a steady job. She started the business April 2006 helping a friend selling plastic products for the home; since then things have gone well for her and she now sells on her own and buys her own merchandise which she resells. She needs a loan of 5000 Mexican Pesos, which will be repaid in 10 fourteen day installments, to restock her merchandise and to organize some bingo games that she uses as a strategy to attract customers.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sinikagni Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Sinikagni (sont toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Kapaga un des villages de la commune de Zégoua, préfecture de Kadiolo, 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
 Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de riz  paddy et de condiments alimentaires.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire, le premier s’est bien dénoué. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3 paquets de condiments et 3sacs de 100kg de riz paddy qui seront décortiqués et revendus en détail. Elles s’approvisionnent à kapaga et les localités avoisinantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Zégoua le jour de foire et souvent au village dans les familles à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 5.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Sinikagni ambitionnent de devenir chacune une grande commerçante.
texts.en:
The six women of the group Sinikagni are all married and average 28 years of age and 3 children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Kapaga, a village in the community of Zégoua, Kadiolo prefecture, third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso). These women do a diversity of work, including selling paddy rice and condiments. They’re collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. They are now on their second solidarity loan. The first one was indeed settled.

With this new loan, the group members plan to buy two packets of condiments and three 100-kg sacks of paddy rice, which will be husked and resold at the retail level. Supplies of goods are gotten in Kapaga and neighboring towns. The goods are sold most in cash transactions at the Zégoua marketplace on market day and often in the village in families. Their customers are composed of men and women.

Each group member envisions realizing an average monthly profit of 5,500 francs CFA. A portion of these profits will be used for family needs and the other portion will be invested in business. The ambition of each group member is to become a large-scale merchant.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and condiments

loans.name: Mataomaile

texts.en:
Mataomaile G., 27, is married with 3 children. She has 5 years of experience in the Pancake business. She sells her pancakes in the public market 5 days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 240 Tala (~ 160USD).

She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Mataomaile’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her pancake business

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en: Betty N. is the chairperson of the Kikooza Development Association in Mityana. She is a hard-working lady. She is married with four children and cares for three other relatives as well. Betty has a produce-selling business, growing matooke (green cooking bananas) and other food crops like cassava (Uganda's main staple food), sweet potatoes, maize (corn), beans and so on, and selling at the market for cash. In seasons when she does not have a large enough harvest, Betty buys from other farmers so as to keep her clients supplied. This is her sixth loan with the group from Pearl Microfinance (a field partner of Kiva). These loans, which provide money to buy the produce she needs, have increased her profitability and the level at which she is able to save. Betty needs a new loan to be able to buy more produce for her business and also to pay school fees for her children. (Also pictured above is Fred, the credit officer of the group.)

loans.use: Buy more produce to sell.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza a sus 44 años tiene solo un hijo, Alexander de 8 años, vive en la casa que le dejaron sus padres y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y darle una buena educación a su niño. Ella considera que la educación es un aspecto muy importante en la vida de un niño, es por eso que decidió poner una escuela para niños especiales (con síndrome de dawn o retardo mental), ya que siente que todos merecemos la oportunidad de tener una buena educación, ella es muy alegre y trata con mucho cariño a sus “Amores”, que es como ella llama a los niños que estudian en su Institución Educativa. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, puesto que es muy feliz educando a los niños, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para ella es cuidar a los estudiantes de algún imprevisto. Espera en el futuro poder agrandar la infraestructura de su institución y así poder acoger a más niños y prepararlos para que sepan defenderse solos en la vida. Es el segundo préstamo de Maritza con MFP, siempre ha sido muy responsable en sus pagos, ya que siente que tiene que dar el ejemplo en su banco comunal, del cual es una de las fundadoras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, hará arreglar las instalaciones de su colegio, además renovará las carpetas y pizarras.
texts.en:
Maritza, at 44 years old, has just one child, eight-year-old Alexander. She lives in the house that her parents left her, and she has a drive to move ahead and giver her son a good education. She believes education is a very important aspect in the life of a child, and for this reason she decided to start a school for special children (with Down's Syndrome or mental retardation), as she feels that we all deserve the opportunity to have a good education. She is very happy and carefully tends to her "Loves", as she calls the children who study in her Educational Institution. She really enjoys her work, and is very happy teaching children. She has been working in this field for seven years, and the most difficult part is taking care of her students during unforeseen circumstances. In the future, she hopes to expand the infrastructure of her school and thus be able to take in more children and prepare them to be able to defend themselves in life. This is Maritza's second loan with MFP. She has always been responsible in her payments, as she feels the need to set an example in her communal bank, of which she is a founder. With the 1,000 soles she is requesting, she will repair her school facilities and renovate the carpets and blackboards.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve facilities and furniture

loans.name: Ni Kadek Suastini

texts.en:
Ni Kadek Suastini - (DNR.M-0696) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Manistutu - Melaya.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Ni Kadek Suastini owns & operates a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing hairdressing & beauty services to local community members.  Ni Kadek Suastini has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 1,500,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2007, Ni Kadek Suastini joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Kadek Suastini has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  Ni Kadek Suastini is now requesting a new loan of 4,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI.  Ni Kadek Suastini plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ni Kadek Suastini - (DNR.M-0696) merupakan 37 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Kadek Suastini memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor jasa.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah mengoperasikan usaha berbasis jasa.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menyediakan layanan rias rambut & kecantikan bagi anggota masyarakat setempat.  Ni Kadek Suastini sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 7 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Kadek Suastini menghasilkan sekitar 1,500,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2007, Ni Kadek Suastini bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Kadek Suastini meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk berinvestasi dengan merenovasi bisnis.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 4,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli peralatan untuk meningkatkan bisnis.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Kadek Suastini berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Razia Muhammad Mansha Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz Baji wants a loan to buy a musical instrument (guitar) for her musical band. Bilquis Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shahnaz Akhtar Baji wants a loan to buy carpets to sell. Anwar Baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

Razia Baji is the group leader of the aforementioned ladies. They all have resided in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Razia Baji is an uneducated lady because her parents couldn’t afford her education expenses. She insisted her mother teach her a carpet-weaving skill. With this skill, she was able to start her own carpet-weaving business. Now her skill rewards her in the shape of money. She used her amount as needed. Her husband's name is M. M., and he has a barber shop in the community. Razia Baji is applying for a loan to buy items (scissors, chairs, and a mirror) for her husband’s barber shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Razia Baji is seated in the picture, wearing a black shawl and showing her business.

loans.use: To buy items for her barber shop

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma H. Vda. D. R. resiD. en el municipio D. apopa del departamento D. San Salvador. Irma tiene 52 años D. edad Vive con dos hijos: Melquíades D. 19 años y una hija D. 25 años. Irma se dedica a ala elaboración y venta D. tortillas todos los días y por las tardes elabora antojitos que no pueden faltar en la merienda D. los salvadoreños, Irma posee una clientela muy estable ya que ella lleva años trabajando y es muy conocida en la zona, el crédito que Irma solicita es para la compra D. materia prima para sus antojitos ya que desea aumentar su producción e ir a ofrecer a mas lugares para lograr mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Irma lives in the municipality of Apopa in the department of San Salvador. She is 52 years old with two children: Melquiades, age 19, and a daughter, age 25. Irma is engaged in the making and selling of tortillas every day, and in the afternoons she makes small snacks that people in El Salvador cannot do without.

Irma has a very stable clientele since she has been working for years and is well known in the area. The loan that Irma is applying for is for the purchase of basic materials since she wants to increase her production and offer them in more places in order to succeed in obtaining greater income

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic materials

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married to Hero. She is 23 years old and works as a retailer of RTW (Ready-To-Wear) clothes in their rural village in Cebu in San Isidro, Isabela. The couple have children who inspire them every day. Thus, they are working hard to save for their children’s future education. Her husband is a farmer and they are helping one another to have a better way of living.

Maricel wants her RTW business to become profitable. She roams around their village to sell her products and most of her customers are her friends and neighbors. However, due to lack of financial resources, she is now seeking the support of Kiva lenders for her business. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 that she can use as business capital.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

location.town: Cebu, San Isidro, Santiago City, Isabela

loans.name: Mirna María

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Mirna O. se dedica a su actividad de venta de productos plásticos tales como bolsas, platos, vasos, cubiertos, entre otros teniendo su propio establecimiento en el mercado central.

Ella es madre soltera con tres hijos que mantener y para esto busca la manera de salir adelante en su negocio ofreciendo mayores cantidades de productos. Con el crédito que solicita en Ceprodel lo utilizará para la compra de los productos plásticos para ofertarlos en su negocio.

loans.use: Compra de productos plásticos

loans.name: Holida

texts.en:
J. Holida is 51 years old, married and the loving mother of two children. Holida is a cattle breeder. She buys small cattle at market for a low price, feeds them and then resells them on the same market at a more profitable price. Her elder son also works with her in this business. Holida works hard in order to make the business successful and able to generate a stable income for her family. Now Holida is planning to purchase more cattle to raise and sell. For this purpose she is requesting $700 USD. Holida would like to thank everyone for their support, and promises to manage the loan without violations or delinquency.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle for breeding and selling

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia G. is from the village of Mialem. She is 47 years old. Lucia is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Lucia owns & operates a farm business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lucia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lucia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
A sus 35 años, Martha ha luchado mucho para sobresalir en la vida, es madre soltera y vive con su única hija, Juana de 13 años y desea con todas sus fuerzas tener un futuro más prometedor.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia.

Martha tiene 20 años trabajando en la crianza de ganado, se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para sacar a pastear a sus animales, los cuales cría con mucho cariño y dedicación, ya que sabe que de la buena crianza depende la ganancia que obtendrá por venderlos.

Lo que más le gusta a Martha de su trabajo es caminar por lo inmensos campos por donde pastea a su ganado, por lo  que espera poder incrementar el número de reses que tiene y así poder aumentar sus ingresos. Lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es tener que llevar las reses hasta Azangaro, que es donde las vende, aun así ella está dispuesta a trabajar duro con tal de mejorar su vida.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Martha con MFP y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que siente que tiene una responsabilidad con las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por el orden que le pone a las reuniones. Con los mil setecientos soles que solicita completará la suma que necesita para poder comprar un toro, el cual le costará al rededor de tres mil nuevo soles.
texts.en:
At 35 years old, Martha has fought hard to excel in life. As a single mother living with her only daughter, Juana, 13, she wants with all her efforts to have a more promising future with age, members of her family and civil status.

For the past 20 years Martha has been working in breeding cattle. She gets up at 5am to take her animals out to graze, tending them with much care and dedication, as she already knows that good breeding will affect the profits she can obtain in selling them.

What Martha likes most about her work is walking through the immense fields where she grazes her cattle and she hopes to increase the number of cattle that she owns and thereby increase her profits. What she likes least about her work is having to take the cattle to Azangaro where she sells them, but she is still ready to work hard to improve her life.

This is the second loan for Martha with MFP and she commits to pay all instalments on time as she feels a responsibility to the partners of the communal bank, where she is very well respected for the order she brings to meetings. The 1,700 soles that she is requesting will complete the sum she needs to buy a bull, which will cost her around 3,000 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bull.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta, de 58 años, es una madre muy amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo menor, Edwin de 23 años, y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.

Su trabajo es la venta de abarrotes de forma ambulatoria, ella recorre las ferias de la ciudad de Juliaca vendiendo leche, aceite, sacos de fideo, harina, etc. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y convincente, lo cual ha hecho que su negocio tenga muchos clientes y sus ingresos mejoren.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad de horarios que tiene, pues también tiene que velar por la seguridad de su hogar. Lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar sus productos hasta las distintas ferias de la ciudad. 
Para más adelante, desea tener una tienda donde pueda vender su mercadería con más tranquilidad, para ello está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Jacinta con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y promete hacerlo. En su banco comunal es muy querida y respetada, ya que siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los mil quinientos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor el stock de su negocio.
texts.en:
Jacinta is a 58 year old loving mother who lives with her youngest son, Edwin, who is 23 years old. What Jacinta wants most is to live out her old age in peace. She is an ambulatory grocery saleswoman who goes from market to market in Juliaca selling milk, oil, sacks of pasta, flour, etc. She is a good humored and sincere saleswoman, which is why she has so many customers and earns good money. What she likes most about her work is the flexible schedule which allows her to take care of her home at the same time. She has been doing this for 16 years and finds the most difficult thing about it is transporting her goods to the various city markets. In the future, she would like to have a store where she could sell her merchandise with greater ease and she’s willing to work hard to achieve this. This is Jacinta’s sixth loan with MFP, she knows she has to pay her installments on time and she promises to do so. She is well loved and respected in her communal bank since she always keeps the meetings running smoothly. She will buy more products to increase her stock with the 1500 soles she is asking for.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is taking care of her pig at the back of her house. She gives it pig feed, and she hopes that she will have sufficient capital to buy more feed. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to help her acquire a supply of feed for her pig. She hopes that someday she can buy more pigs to raise in order to earn more income in the future. She hopes that Kiva lenders will assist in the growth of her business. 

Leonora is a 45-year-old businesswoman. She is married and has five children, and most of them are currently studying. She is really doing her best to make her business progressive.

loans.use: To buy a supply of feed for her pig.

loans.name: Mercedes Lourdes

texts.es:
Mercedes está  casada desde hace 17 años y tiene tres hijos, ha  formando  una familia muy unida  lo que les ha permito salir delante de algunos momentos difíciles por los que han tenido que atravesar; su esposo  se desempeña como albañil,  tienen  muchos años viviendo en la ciudadela Francisco Pacheco en la  ciudad de Portoviejo un sitio retirado del centro de la urbe.

Mercedes es una señora de 38 años Portovejense que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza Yanbal lleva un año realizando esta actividad y en cada pedido invierte entre 80 y 90 dólares, visita a sus clientes de manera informal puerta a puerta dejando los productos  a crédito a gente del sector donde ella vive,  además vende tarjetas para telefonía celular en su propia casa.

Nuestra socia  está muy satisfecha de formar parte del Banco Comunal Los Claveles porque gracias a la Fundación Espoir  ha podido incrementar su negocio, por ahora con el préstamo que recibirá invertirá en comprar más productos Yanbal  como perfumes, cremas, labiales, polvos compactos, rímel, etc. y además comprara un teléfono para vender recargas para móviles desde su casa, es una manera importante de poder aportar en casa con la familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes has been married for 17 years, and has three children. She has formed a very united family, which is what has allowed them to get ahead in some difficult moments which they have had to cross. Her husband is employed as a builder, they have for many years been living in the residential community Francisco Pacheco in the city of Portoviejo, which is a place out of the center of the city.

Mercedes is a 38 year old Portoviejan woman, who sells Yanbal beauty products. She has been in this business for one year, and in every order, she invests between 80 and 90 dollars. She visits her customers in an informal manner door to door, leaving the products on credit to people from the area where she lives. She also sells cell phone cards in her own house.

Our member is very satisfied to be part of the Community Bank Los Claveles (The Carnations), because thanks to the Fundación Espoir, she has been able to grow her business. For now with the loan she will receive, she will invest in the purchase of more Yanbal products, such as perfumes, creams, lip products, powder compacts, mascara, etc. She will also buy a telephone in order to sell mobile recharges from her house. It is an important way to be able to contribute in the house with the family.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, lip products, powder compacts, etc. and also buy a telephone to recharge mobiles

loans.name: Jah Bless Group

texts.en: Charlotte is forty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coast in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people. She is a fish seller. Charlotte is the leader of a trust bank group called Jah Bless. The members of the group are mainly traders. The group requests for a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. It is their desire to give their children the best of education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy goods to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Mariela Adela

texts.es: La Sra. Mariela tiene 43 años D. edad, tiene 2 hijos menores D. edad D. 13 y 6 años  en edad escolar, ella es casada  su conyugue esta laborando en la ciudad D. Trujillo, ella vive en la tinguiña en la Av. Jorge  Chavez en casa alquilada  D. una amiga ella vive en esa hace tres años, ella se dedica a ala venta D. ropa como recorredora  se dedica a este negocio hace  5 años, su sueño es poder tener su propia casa, con el credito que solicita invertira en capital D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Mariela is 43 years old, has two school-aged children ages 13 and 6, and is married. Her husband works in Trujillo city. She lives La Tinguiña on Jorge Chavez Avenue in a home she rents from a friend. She has lived there for three years. She has been selling clothing for 5 years. Her dream is to be able to have her own home. The loan will be used as working capital for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is currently in the business of selling bread in the market and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour, milk, sugar, etc. to make more bread to sell.  Rose is 28 years-old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients.

loans.name: Necida

texts.es:
Necida es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces.
Necida es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 1 hijo, Necida vende ropa variada a pedido, sus ventas los realiza a amigo y familiares, además Necida tiene una polleria en su casa actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 2 personas.
Necida necesita un préstamo de 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, buzos.
Los sueños de Necida son tener ahorros para la educación de su hijo y una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Necida is a member of the community bank "Los Sauces." She is in a common law marriage, is 35 years old, and has one son. She makes and sells a variety of clothes to-order to friends and family members. She also sells chicken from her home seven days a week with the help of two other people.

Necida seeks this loan of 750 Soles in order to invest in the purchase of polo shirts and sweatshirts. She dreams of saving money for her son's education and to open her own clothing shop.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of polo shirts and sweatshirts

loans.name: Menza

texts.en: Menza B. is 43 years old, married, and has two children. He runs a nursery school in Mtongwe and also does double-duty as a teacher. He is a member of KADET and is applying for a new loan, his second, to improve his school. This new loan, for Kshs. 12,000, will allow him to purchase teaching materials and other much-needed items, such as stationery. His school mainly serves the community and families around Mtongwe, but he hopes it will become fully established and the school of choice for educating local children.

loans.use: To buy an assortment of items for a local school.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 48-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. He has been working in agriculture since 2002. He grows olives, and either produces oil, or sells his olives.

When Youssef first started his business, he didn’t produce as much as he does today, and his number of clients has increased. His clients are people from his region, as well as people from other regions. Youssef decided on doing his business because he took over his family’s business.

Youssef requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to pay for the harvesting of his olives. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

Youssef is special in his work because he does his best to produce the best quality of olives and oil. In the future, he plans to keep on expanding his business by producing more.

loans.use: To pay for the harvesting of his olives

loans.name: Faima

texts.en:
Faima  F. is 45 and married with 5 children (ages 4 - 18).  She owns a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  Faima  has many years of experience in this business.  Faima  needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Faima  joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Faima 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faima  F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine D. is from the village of Sto. Domingo. She is 45 years old. Josephine is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Josephine D..

Josephine is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a specialized retail store selling snacks in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Magdonio

texts.es:
El señor Magdonio Martínez tiene 57 años y esta casado con la Señora Ninfalina Velazquez que tiene 50 años, los mismos tienen dos hijos.
Uno varón de 33 años que se dedica como el padre a la reparación de artículos electrónicos, y una hija de 25 que recientemente culmino  la carrera de Administración de Empresas en la Universidad Nacional de Asunción.
El mismo se recibió de electricista y de técnico en Electrónica en el año 1972. y desde esa fecha se dedica a la reparación de aparatos electrónicos como : Equipos de Sonido , Televisores , Computadoras , celulares y otros  mas.
El mismo desea invertir el préstamo. En la compra de repuestos para artículos electrónicos y en la actualización de programas para flasheo de celulares.
texts.en:
Señor Magdonio Martínez is 57 and is married to la Señora Ninfalina Velazquez who is 50. They have two children, one son who is 33, he works in the same profession as his father, repairing electronics; their daughter is 25, she recently began her studies of Business Administration at National University of Asunción. Magdonio received a degree as an electrician and as electronics technician in 1972. Since then he has worked in the repair of electric apartus like: stereos, televisions, computers, cell phones and others. He wishes to invest the loan in the purchase of spare parts for the electronics and in updating programs for cellphones.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the electronics and in updating programs for cellphones.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda R., 46, is making sure that her family has enough provisions to meet their daily needs. Married to Edwin R., a painter, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store while selling viands (item of food/tasty dish) alongside her usual products.

Luzviminda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow eight times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a loan of 15,000 PFP. This amount will be a source of added capital for her expanding business and will be used to buy groceries needed to replenish her store inventory as well as for raw ingredients for her viands.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries needed to replenish her store inventory and raw ingredients for her viands

loans.name: Erlin

texts.en:
Erlin A. is from the town of Banga. She is 36 years old. Erlin is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Erlin owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Erlin has been engaged in her business for over 3 years now.

In May 2007, Erlin joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlin has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Erlin is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Erlin from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es una madre de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su menor hija en el distrito agrícola de Cayaltí, una zona de constante desarrollo comercial ubicada a una hora de la ciuda de Chiclayo.

Ella se gana la vida trabajando como profesora en un colegio primario de la zona y también prepararando dulces en su vivienda para luego venderlos en sus tiempos libres en la puerta de un colegio de la zona. Este negocio es de mucha acogida ya que ella prepara los dulces con muy buena sazón. Durante el tiempo que lleva trabajando se ha vuelto conocida en la zona y ha empezado a repartir dulces por pedidos adicionalmente. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza en solventar los gastos de su familia.

La creciente demanda de pedidos por los dulces que prepara han hecho que piense en incrementar su producción para aumentar sus ventas y por ende, sus ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Liliana es una mujer bastante emprendedora, creativa y de mucha paciencia. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Liliana is a 41 year old mother who lives with her younger daughter in the farming district of Cayaltí, an area of constant commercial development located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She earns her living working as a teacher in an elementary school in the area and also preparing sweets in her home then selling them in her free time at the entrance of the area school. This business is well received as her sweets have a very good flavor. During the time that she has been working she has become known in the area and has also begun to deliver sweets to order. The income that she receives from these business she uses for covering the family's expenses. The increasing demand of orders for the sweets that she prepares means that she is thinking of increasing her production to boost her sales and therefore, her profits. To achieve her goal she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of PEN 2000. Liliana is quite an enterprising woman, creative and has a lot of patience. She has worked previously with Our Institution and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing comsumables to make sweets for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita L. is from Gala Ozamiz City. She is 60 years old. Rosita is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling soya milk products to local businesses and community members. Rosita has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional products. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Rosita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional products

loans.name: Jundes Group

texts.en:
Perlita J. lives in the village of Loquilos. She is 44 years old and leads a three-member loan group. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is J..

Perlita is married and has two school-aged children. She makes a living by running a store where she sells dried fish. She has been in this line of work for more than ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Perlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC, and will use her 5,000 PHP portion of this loan to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her small company to improve her family's living conditions.  

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her small business

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda C. is from the village of Ricoro in Gingoog City. She is 33 years old, is married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconuts within the local community. Elda has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for her retail activities.

In 2010 Elda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional coconuts to sell. Elda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Elda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households in Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Al

texts.en:
Al D. is from the village of Marapong, Sibutad. He is 30 years old and single. To make a living, Al owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, selling harvested rice from his own farm. Al has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Al joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Al is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for rice production. This will be his first loan from PMPC.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for rice production

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua N. sells bread, eggs, biscuits and other goods at Elmina. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. She has been through senior high school. She is responsible by helping her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more of her goods for sale. She anticipates reinvesting her profit back into her business.

loans.use: buy more of her goods for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
ROSA MARIA C., Trabaja como Supervisora de Cocina en el  Universidad Nacional de Ingeniaría .

es madre soltera de dos hijos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, ha tenido dos creditos con la institucion y estos han sido para el mejoramiento de su casa.
texts.en:
ROSA MARIA C. works as a Kitchen Supervisor at the National Engineering University.  She is a single mother of two, school age children.

She has had two previous loans with the Institution that have been used for home improvements.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy building materials and supplies to replace the electrical wiring in her house.  The rest of the funds will be for pending family expenses.

loans.name: Chuluunbat

texts.en:
Chuluubat C. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a house. His two children, aged 15 and 12, both attend secondary school while his wife works in the agricultural sector. 
Chuluunbat owns his own car and is a taxi driver in his town. He began his business in 1990 and has gained a lot of experience as a driver. He has a good, moral character. Chuluunbat needs more funds to build a new garage that will be useful for his car during the cold and extreme winters. Therefore, he is requesting a 950,000 MNT loan.

loans.use: To build a new garage

loans.name: Martha Graciela

texts.es: La señora Martha es un cliente nuevo en la institución, la actividad de la cliente es la venta de productos  para bajar de peso, estos productos son naturales que ayudan a diferentes enfermedades que puede adquirir la persona, su negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio, su esposo tiene la actividad de profesor, el trabaja todos los días por las tardes y en las mañanas le ayuda a su esposa en su labor, la señora Martha tiene la profesión de auditora en un momento de la vida ejerció su profesión pero por causas de la familia y por los constantes viajes que tenia en su trabajo ella decidió dejar su trabajo, al decidir eso inicio su trabajo de venta de estos productos, el crédito será invertido en la compra de producto para adelgazar, este producto que quiere adquirir es muy demandado por sus consumidores, la pareja actualmente tiene dos hijos uno de ellos  ya esta en el colegio y el otro todavía no. Están muy agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Martha is a new customer of this institution. She in engages in selling products to lose weight: these are natural products that help treating different illnesses that can affect people. Hers shop is located in her own house. Her husband is a teacher: he works daily during the evenings, while in the mornings he helps his wife with her activity. An auditor by education, at one time in her life Martha has worked in this capacity, but due to family issues and to the fact she was constantly travelling she decided quitting her job; after taking this decision she also started her present activity. The loan will be used to buy a slenderizing product that her customers request the most. Martha and her husband have two children: one goes to school while the other is still too young. They are deeply thankful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy products to lose weight.

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en: Aireen L. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Santa Cruz, Don Virgilio, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a fishing business. Her husband Eddie L., who is 28 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 2 children who are 7 months and 2 years old. Aireen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Aireen has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 5th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 which she intends to use to buy a pump boat so that she could continue to save up for the future and to create another business. Aireen L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing gear and materials

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a 41 year-old mother who aims to become successful by developing her fishing business. Her husband works closely with her as fisherman. They work together for the future of their family. Rosalie is thankful to ASHI for the loan they provided. Since 1997, Rosalie has been able to support the maintenance of her fishing business by purchasing fishing net, a fishing boat, and other fishing equipment.  She hopes to further improve her fishing business through hard work and with continuous support from ASHI and the Kiva Partner.

Due to a lack of business capital, she was encouraged to seek financial support from Kiva lenders. She will be glad if her loan request is granted.  She will use the loan wisely by purchasing materials for her business; such as a fishing cage (fish trap) and other related materials. Her hard work and patience are her foundation to achieve a better life. 

The income she earns from the business is very helpful, as it supports her business and sustains the needs of her family, especially by providing school allowances for her only son, Romeo, a high school student. She hopes that someday she will be able to expand her fishing business. Rosalie is glad to have the secure opportunity to request this loan and for your support and encouragement. 

Her long-term goal is to have a fish farm so that she can offer support to others in her village, especially her relatives. Rosalie hopes to maintain long-term, sustainable fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her fishing business, such as a fishing cage (fish trap) and other related materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nally

texts.en: Nally M. is an industrious and an active member of ASHI Antique North Branch Lipata Center 4, Lipata, Culasi, Antique Philippines. She is a 59-year-old widow and presently has five dependents, three of whom are still studying. They earn their living through their tricycle and she has also a variety store in their barangay (neighborhood or district). The income that they earn from this business really helps her to sustain their basic needs. Though some of her children who already work help support her, sometimes it is not enough for their needs, especially if there are unexpected expenses. Nally is one of the pioneer members of the branch. She has been a member for 11 years in ASHI and has already received several awards for being a good member. The Institution really helps her because through ASHI, some of her children have already finished their studies and have a stable job, and she has a tricycle. For her next loan, she is planning to expand her store and to purchase again an additional motorcycle. These projects are very useful not only for her, but also to her children who do not have any source of income. Her greatest dream in life is to have a decent house and to have savings for the future needs of the family.

loans.use: For a motorcycle and to expand her variety store

loans.name: John Gitonga

texts.en: John Gitonga K. is a 30-year-old man from Bamburi. He has been in the transport business for the last two years. This marks his second loan from KADET, and he plans to use it to repair his vehicle. The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of his clothing business. His dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with six children, three of whom attend school, while three graduated from school. She lives in a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For over fourteen years, she has operated a fish-selling business. Her customers are the local community members. Mwanasha faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the hot summer season, the availability of fish for sale is lower compared to the cold winter season, where the demand is higher. She hopes to educate all her children and expand her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to pay school fees for her son. She decided to join Yehu to access loans easily and educate her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a married man with two children, all of whom graduated from school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

He has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling to his neighbours and motorcyclists. Richard faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. He hopes to expand and operate a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, rice and wheat flour for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, rice and wheat flour for sale.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita A. is from the village of Bonbon, Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Emerita is married and has three grown children. To make a living, Emerita owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood products  including fish, milkfish, and sardines  in the local community. Emerita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Emerita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Emerita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. 

Emerita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products, like milkfish and mackerel, to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Emerita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products, like milkfish and mackerel, to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es: Blanca madre soltera, tiene tres hijos ya mayores, que se encuentre bien sus hijos es su objetivo.  Le ayuda económicamente para que cubra algunos gastos de la casa, ella trabaja como operaria desde hace un tiempo. Su mayor necesidad mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda la zona donde habita es de peligro por tal requiere seguridad para su persona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, piedrines, bloques, alambre de amarre, láminas de zinc.  Para construir el frente de la casa y parte del muro lateral.
texts.en: Blanca is a single mother and she has three grown children. Her objective is to be well with her children. They help her to cover some of the household expenses. She has been working as an operator for some time. Her greatest need is to improve the infrastructure of her house. The area where she lives is dangerous and so she needs this for her personal safety. The loan will be used to purchase construction materials such as: cement, sand, gravel, construction bocks, wiring, and zinc sheets to build a front portion to the house and to build a part of the side perimeter wall.

loans.use: to build the front section of her house

loans.name: Mercy Angelita

texts.es:
Mercy de 23 años, es una joven que tiene gran aspiración de salir adelante con la ayuda de su padre empezaron a vender cangrejo en tarrina.

Ella trabaja diariamente sacando la carne de los cangrejos para venderlos en tarrinas. La dificultad de su trabajo es que cuando está en veda o esta caro los cangrejos. Con el préstamo quiere  la compra de cangrejos para mejorar su negocio. En su futuro ella quiere mejora su casa y así sacar adelante a sus hijos en lo que necesite.
texts.en:
Mercy, age 23, is a young woman who has great ambition to succeed with the help of her father. They have started a business selling crabs by the tub.

She works every day removing the meat from the crabs before selling it in containers. Her main difficulties occur when crab season is closed or when the price of crabs gets expensive. With this loan, Mercy wants to buy crabs to improve her business. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her home and see that her children have what they need to get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase crabs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old married man from Lebanon and the father of two school-aged children. He has owned a restaurant since 2005. He produces tasty Lebanese bread, pastries and other food. His restaurant is located in a pleasant area with mountains and a sea view at the same time, where customers can enjoy his delicious food and other products.
 
Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform needed maintenance on his restaurant and renew its decoration. This renovation will allow him to attract more customers which will result in increasing his income. He is very positive about his future plans and wants to better support his family.

loans.use: perform needed maintenance and redecorate his restaurant.

loans.name: Eduwiges

texts.es: La señora Eduwiges se dedica a la venta de productos de plástico por catalogo  para la cocina como jarras vasos, ensaladeras y un poco de productos de belleza como maquillajes y pinturas para dama ella lleva  con este negocio hace 20 años para ayudar en los gastos de su casa, dice que ella ofrece sus productos en las rancherías aledañas a su comunidad y surte sus productos en la población de Hidalgo en un distribuidor autorizado para que le den un buen precio y ella venderlo una poco mas barato que sus competidoras. Ella esta agradecida con el préstamo por que gracias a este podrá tener en existencia productos y así las clientas se los compren más rápido. Comenta que uno de sus obstáculos para hacer crecer su negocio es que le ayuda a su hija a cuidar a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera y tiene que salir a trabajar y eso le quita un poco de tiempo para ver a más clientas. Ella esta casada con el señor Juan José el cuál es jornalero ellos tuvieron 3 hijos pero nada mas uno depende de ella llamado Omar el cual estudia la preparatoria.
texts.en: Eduwiges sells plastic kitchen supplies such as jugs, cups and bowls by catalog. She also sells some beauty products such as makeup. She has been in this business for 20 years to help with her family's expenses. She offers her products to the surrounding villages to her community. She stocks her products in the town of Hidalgo at an authorized distributor so that she can get a good price and be able to sell at a lower price than her competitors. She is thankful for this loan because, thanks to this loan, she will be able to stock products and thus her clients will buy more quickly. One of the obstacles to the growth of her business is that she has to help her daughter take care of her children since her daughter is a single mother and has to go out to work. This takes away some of Eduwiges' time to see more clients. She is married to Juan Jose who is a laborer. They had three children but only one of them, Omar who is in high school, depends on them.

loans.use: in the sale of kitchen supplies and beauty supplies.

loans.name: Calfonia Group

texts.en:
Judith S., who is in her early 20s, is single.  She has been running a cafeteria for three years now. She works from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Judith's first motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She hopes for a loan to buy herself a fridge for her cafe.  Her dream is to one day buy land.

Judith will share this loan with her loan group "Calfonia", which has a total of eight members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Judith is second from left in the back row.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 45, is married to Cyrus. They are blessed with two children aged 27 and 19.

She sells second-hand clothes and has been doing this for two years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 19,290.

This is her second loan from KADET Ltd., and she has successfully settled her previous loan. She will use the funds to buy two bales of clothes for resale.

She intends to use the anticipated profits to buy new clothes for sale and hopes to educate her children and operate a big fashion shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: El  Sr. Iván es un joven de 26 años de edad, vive en la zona de villa salome que esta ubicada a 40 minutos del centro de la ciudad. Iván trabaja como constructor desde hace 10 meses pero anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de edredones y colchas en la localidad de palos blancos en la provincia de los yungas, dejó de viajar con estos productos debido a que decidió quedarse en la paz y ayudar a sus padres ya que ellos están pasando por problemas económicos. Él es muy trabajador y responsable dicen sus padres y sus hermanos ya que el solo esta manteniendo la casa. Iván solicita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas para su trabajo de construcción, ya que tiene que realizar un trabajo muy importante y le faltan herramientas, esta agradecido con  la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Iván is a young man who is 26 years of age. He lives in the District of Villa Salome, which is 40 minutes away from the central part of the city. Iván has worked as a builder for the past 10 months. He previously sold quilts and blankets in the town of Palos Blancos in Los Yungas Province. Iván stopped traveling to sell these products because he wanted to stay in La Paz and help his parents who are experiencing financial difficulties. His parents and siblings say he is hardworking and responsible since he is the only person maintaining their household.

Iván is requesting a loan to buy tools for his construction work. His job is very important, but he lacks the equipment. Iván is grateful to Emprender for the support being provided.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his construction work.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
This is Marcela, 35, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Rey, a security guard, and is a mother to her children. 

Marcela has managed to support her older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continue to provide income for her children's everyday expenses as well as their schooling. Marcela believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Marcela operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families eat home-cooked meals only during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. 

Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Aside from the food stall, she sells frozen food like hot dogs and ham. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,690 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, as well as frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marcela dreams of giving all her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her own restaurant. 

She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for products and raw ingredients needed in her business.

loans.name: Heidy Saray

texts.es:
Heidy  es una mujer muy luchadora, y ha sacado a su familia adelante por sí sola. 
Por falta de dinero no ha podido mejorar su casita, en este momento solo le falta el piso, y es por eso que hoy ella necesita un préstamo de ₡400 000 (cuatrocientos mil colones) para la compra de cerámica  para el piso de su casa y también para la mano de obra.
Ella es socia de la empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Garita, una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en: Heidy is a very tenacious woman; she has raised her family alone.  Because of the lack of money she’s been unable to improve her little house.  Currently, it’s still lacking flooring and this is why she needs a ₡400 000 (four-hundred thousand colones) loan to buy tile for her house’s floor and also to pay labor costs.  She is a member of the La Garita (Sentry Post) communal bank, one of EDESA’s 110 member firms in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy tile.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 43-year-old single lady. She is a poultry farmer in Mariakani. She has been in this business for the last one year.
 
She has been a KADET client, and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase more chicks and chicken feed for her business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan. Her dream is to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El Sr. José Vive en la localidad de el Torno, es soltero, su actividad es el servicio de transporte de pasajeros desde el torno a la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  vive en la casa de sus padres que son de edad avanzada, el mantiene solo el hogar, el destino del crédito es para terminar de construir un habitación para que así el pueda vivir mas cómodo,  con sus ingreso le ayuda a sus padres, hace unos 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad, es un cliente antiguo de la institución por lo que se siente agradecido por el apoyo económico que se le brindara.
texts.en:
José lives in the town of El Torno.  He is single and his business activity is providing a passenger transport service between El Torno and the city of Santa Cruz.  José lives in his elderly parents' home.  He is the only one who supports their household.  José will use this loan to finish building a room so that he can live more comfortably.  He uses his income to help his parents.  He has been in his business for ten years.

José is a long-standing client of our institution and he feels grateful for the financial support that he is given.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is 50 years old and singL.. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. For the past ten years, Ha has run a general store in the local community and earns an income from this business for cover all her expenditures. 

Ha's shop sells mainly food and basic household items for the peopL. in her community, such as instant noodles, confectionery, shampoo, clothes hangers, paper tissues, and cigarrettes. 

Ha is requesting a loan to purchase a greater quantity and variety of basic goods (in particular snacks and confectionery) to sell in her general store. She hopes that through this loan she will be abL. to generate more income and save enough money to cover family emergencies.

loans.use: buy household items to sell in her store

loans.name: Eseese

texts.en:
Eseese is 32 years of age and married with four children.  Eseese owns and operates a business venture, catching and selling ocean fish.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Eseese needs a loan of 1000 Samoan talas (WST) to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.
