She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Eseese joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Eseese's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients: corn, rice, beans, cheese, pork rinds, etc, and propane gas.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: La señora Edith  solicita  un préstamo para impermeabilizar y pintar su casa; por que en las temporadas de lluvias el agua se trasmina por consecuencia el techo se esta deteriorando. Edith quiere prevenir que el problema se agrave  y tenga que gastar más de lo previsto. Para poder cubrir los gastos el trabaja en maquiladora de Lunes a Viernes al igual que su esposo para tener un ingreso mas  se  quedan tiempo extra. Edith es madre  de dos niños, de los que quiere formar unos buenos ciudadanos y un mejor patrimonio. Para que ella pueda realizar su proyecto necesita comprar el material y pintura para que su casa quede protegida.
texts.en:
Sra. Edith is requesting a loan to waterproof and paint her house because the water from the rainy season has seeped through the ceiling, causing it to deteriorate. She wants to prevent this problem from getting worse and having to spend more than expected. To cover her expenses, Edith and her husband work at a factory Monday through Friday. She also works overtime to earn extra money.

Edith is the mother of two children. She wants to see them become good citizens and to build up a good inheritance for them. In order to complete this project, she needs to buy materials and paint so that her home will be protected.

loans.use: to buy paint and materials for waterproofing her house.

loans.name: Maytham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 25 years old, single, and lives with parents.

Maytham has been the owner of a fabric shop since 2009, selling various types of fabrics suitable for furniture and curtains.  He has sufficient experience in this field from his previous work. He has a good reputation and his shop is situated in a crowded area where there are a lot customers passing by.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia, 50, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines, a single parent with four children. She, together with her children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Alicia operates a piggery. She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market.  Aside from this she also cooks breakfast meals for additional income.Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1200 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy feeds and additional hogs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Alicia hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feed and additional hogs needed in her business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 23-year-old single woman. She has a child who is one year old. She describes herself as ambitious and determined. 

She operates a clothing sales business where she sells clothes to the local people. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a shopping centre and her primary customers are ladies since she specializes in ladies and babies clothes. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate capital. She will use the 10,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to add to her stock of clothes, especially as we approach the festive season. Her business goal is to grow her business into wholesale within five years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es: Estrella, de 51 años, es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos: Wilfredo y Yamile, a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Chilca. Afronta muchos problemas uno de ellos, son los problemas con su esposo, del que se encuentra separado. A pesar de ello continúa trabajando, pues tiene que velar por sus hijos. Su actividad económica por 20 años, es la venta de carne. Cuenta que su trabajo consiste en la compra de ganado porcino en cantidad, sobre todo a los más gorditos y sanos, los que mata para vender la carne en ferias regionales y de los distritos. Con ellos obtiene buenas ganancias, además aprovecha el puesto que tiene para vender productos de belleza a los clientes que ya la conocen. Le va muy bien en su negocio, “vendo más cantidad de carne en las festividades”, afirma. Por ello sus planes son abrir una chicharronería (lugar donde se vende platos a base de carne de cerdo), le falta muy poco para concretar su objetivo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “IDME” y este es el vigésimocuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Estrella de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en el alquiler de su nuevo restaurante, además de platos y demás utensilios para la venta de los alimentos.
texts.en:
Estrella, age 51, is a simple woman. She lives with her two children, Wilfredo and Yamile, whom she cares for in her own house, located in the district of Chilca. She faces a lot of problems. One of them is her husband, from whom she is separated. In spite of this she continues working since she has to take care of her children.

For 20 years, she has been in the business of selling meat. Her work consists of buying large quantities of pigs, in particular the fattest and healthiest ones. She slaughters them in order to sell the meat at in regional and district markets. She gets good earnings from this business. In addition, she has a stall for selling beauty products to customers that already know her.

Her businesses are doing well. “I sold a lot of meat during the festivals,” she says. That’s why she plans on opening a “chicharronería” (a restaurant where pork dishes are sold). She lacks very little in order to achieve this goal.

Estrella belongs to the IDME communal bank, and this is her twenty-fourth loan with MFP. She hopes that this collaboration will allow her to continue towards her objectives, and she promises, once again, to pay all her installments. In addition, she is thankful to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive. Upon receiving her loan, Estrella will invest the money applied for in renting her new restaurant, as well as in purchasing dishes and other utensils needed for selling meals.

loans.use: to rent a place for her restaurant and purchase dishes and utensils.

loans.name: Miriam Yanina

texts.es: Mirian tiene un Bodega, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar y fideos al por mayor. Es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 5 años, ella dice que Finca es un gran apoyo a las madres que inician un negocio, les enseñan en las capacitaciones a poder trabajar con responsabilidad, ella empezó a ahorrar y ahora ya se le hizo una costumbre, con las capitaciones le ayudaron a poder ser mejor madre y negociante, agradece por el apoyo recibido, sobre todo cuando mas lo necesita.
texts.en: Mirian has a general store.  The loan she requested will be used to buy rice, sugar and noodles at wholesale.  She’s been a Finca Perú client for five years.  She says that Finca is a great help for mothers starting a business; they train them so that they can work responsibly.  She started saving and now it’s become a regular habit.  The training helped her be a better mother and businesswoman.  She is grateful for the support received above all when she’s needed it the most.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and noodles.

loans.name: Vabel

texts.en:
Vabel is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Vabel has a shop that sells coconut meat and fruit salad. She has had this business for seven years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy coconuts to make fruit salad.

Vabel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vabel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to make fruit salad.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with 2 children: one attends school while the other one is still too young for school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Rose has operated a retail shop for the past 6 years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of rising commodity prices. She dreams of expanding her business into a wholesale shop.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and a fridge for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial services to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and a fridge for her business

loans.name: Sirley Gertrudis

texts.es:
Sirley es una mujer de 37 años. Vive en Isla Trinitaria, un barrio peri-urbano de Guayaquil.  Con la ayuda de su hermana empezó a vender comidas rapidas por las tardes. Sus mayores ventas son de chuzos (caren en palito) y alitas.

Aun que hay un alto indice de delincuencia en Isla Trinitaria, hasta ahora Sirley no ha tenido problemas con ello. No está casado pero tiene hijos, que todos ya son mayores e independientes. 

Con su prestamo quiere construir mejor su casa ya que el negocio lo tiene en la parte delantera de su casa y asi le daría una mejor atencion a los clientes. Quiere comprar cemento, arena, piedas, pinturas.
texts.en:
Sirley is a 37-year-old woman. She lives on Isla Trinitaria, a semi-urban neighborhood of Guayaquil. With the help of her sister she began selling prepared foods in the afternoons. Her biggest sellers are meat shishkabobs and chicken wings. 

Although Isla Trinitaria has a high crime rate, so far Sirley has not had any problems. She is not married but she has children who are all grown and independent now. 

With the loan she hopes to paint and freshen up her home to make it prettier.

loans.use: cemento, arena, piedas, pinturas.

loans.name: Roric Yowich

texts.es:
Rodic , es un joven emprendedora natural de chincha, Perú. Chincha es nombrado por la  cultura de los Chinchas, célebre por sus avanzados conocimientos de la agricultura y sus proezas marítimas. Hoy en día Chincha es una increíble mezcla de culturas, con una gran población afro-peruana, debido a los restos de un pasado indígena, y las influencias del imperio español. La ciudad, junto a otras ciudades cerca de la costa del Pacífico, fue dañada en el año 2001 y 2007, fechas en las que ocurrieron terremotos de fuerte dimensión, pero ha soportado como siempre lo ha hecho durante gran parte de su historia. 

Roric  vive con su madre y a sus 23 años de edad tiene su negocio propio, el se dedica a la  venta de Salchipollo ( comida a base de papas fritas y piezas de pollo dorado el cual va  acompañado con salsas ) desde hace 3 años, el se animo a tener este tipo de negocio gracias a su madre ya que el la ayuda en el puesto de comida que ella tiene, luego de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación el logro ahorrar dinero suficiente  formando así su negocio, Roric a pesar de duro que es el trabajo y lo joven que es tiene sus propios utensilios de trabajo como es su carrito de salchipollo, vende sus productos a las afueras de la CRAC Señor de Luren, es allí donde los contactamos , ya que siempre hay personas que desean comprar sus productos,poque son muy deliciosos,el no tiene vergüenza y siempre se encuentra amable hacia los clientes, es por ello que él cree que esa amabilidad y la sazón en la preparación de los productos hace que tenga buena clientela.

Roric está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar más insumos y mas utensilios para mejorar su negocio y con ello mejorar la calidad de vida y podrá independizare por sí mismo, para así en algunos meses lograr su gran sueño: “Seguir Estudiando y crecer como microempresario”
texts.en:
Rodic is a young entrepreneur and a native of Chincha, Perú.  Chincha is named after the Chincha culture, famous for its advanced agricultural innovation and its heroic deeds at sea.  Today Chincha is an incredible mix of cultures, with a large Afro-Peruvian population, resulting from what is left of an indigenous past and the influences of the Spanish empire.  The city, along with other cities near the Pacific coast, was damaged in 2001 and 2007, years in which strong earthquakes occurred, but has continued on as it always has through its history.  

Roric lives with his mother and at 23 years old he has his own business selling Salchipollo (a food consisting of french fries and pieces of fried chicken which is accompanied by various sauces).  Three years ago he got up the courage to have this type of business thanks to his mother since he has helped in her food stand, and after much effort and dedication he was able to save enough money to form his own business.  Roric, in spite of the difficult nature of his work and his young age, has his own cooking utensils and his own salchipollo cart, from which he sells his products outside of the rural bank "Señor de Luren".  It is there that he can be contacted, since there are always people wanting to buy his food because they it is so delicious.  He is not timid and always shows kindness to his customers, as he is of the opinion that that kindness and the care with which he prepares his products causes him to have such a good clientele.  

Roric is very grateful to those who give Kiva loans because thanks to their help he will be able to purchase more supplies and cooking utensils to make his business better and in turn better his quality of life.  He will be able to become independent, in order to achieve his big dream in just a few more months: to continue in his studies and to grow as a small businessman.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and cooking utensils for his business.

loans.name: Heisy Georgina

texts.es: Heisy está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería en Sistemas y está solicitando el préstamo para comprar una laptop, que le permita poner en práctica los conocimientos que está adquiriendo en la universidad, así mismo para hacer investigaciones acerca de su carrera. Actualmente se encuentra laborando y es de ésta manera que pagará el crédito y que tambien paga sus estudios. Quiere sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo y a sus padres, es por eso que aspira a un mejor puesto, el que le permita obtener mejores ingresos para lograrlo. Sus papás siempre la han apoyado para que ella pudiera terminar su carrera.
texts.en:
Heisy is studying to be a systems engineer and is asking for this loan to buy a laptop, which will let her put into practice what she is learning at college, and also to do research regarding her career. Right now she is working, and this is how she will pay for the loan and for her studies. 

She would like to give her small son and parents the best in life, which is why she aspires for a good job which would let her make enough money to achieve that. Her parents have always supported her so that she could finish her career.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her engineering practicals.

loans.name: Makboleh

texts.en:
Makboleh is a 28 year old married woman . Who has 2 family members. From Al Russeifeh Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 to pay for home improvements and to buy new furniture.

Since Makboleh is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan .

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, 50, is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as a hard-working and social woman. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. Her business is located within a productive agricultural area and her primary customers are local residents. 

She will use the 5,800 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to purchase a solar lantern which will be used by her family in order to reduce the cost of paraffin used by her five family members. 

Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will install other rooms in her house with solar lamps.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Charles Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of primary school teachers located in Koidu, in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of SLL 23,400,000 for the entire team. With the help of this loan, they can meet their most immediate and pressing financial needs, and at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions, and making the repayments on their behalf.

Charles is the featured leader of this group of teachers. A native of Lei Chiefdom in eastern Sierra Leone, 49-year-old Charles is married and has 2 children who are in college. Charles has been a school teacher for 10 years now. He has requested for this loan in order to pay college fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay college fees for his children.

loans.name: Sour

texts.en: Sour is 61 years old. She is woman who lives at Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a clay stove maker who earns approximately $15 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of $1,300 to purchase the parts of clay stove to make a finished clay stove product to sell. In the future, she hopes that she can expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase the parts of clay stove to make a finished clay stove product to sell

loans.name: Pellagie

texts.en:
Pellagie aged 34 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 3 and 9 years. Not yet go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 5 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and pay school fees of her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay wokers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: A LAPO group leader; Mrs. Roseline O. is 52.  She started her business in1981. She is a popular yam and plantain seller in her quarters in Nigeria. She planned to improve her business with the above amount.

loans.use: To buy more yams and plantains for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 26 years old and married with 1 child. She sells vegetables to her community, namely tomatoes, onions, pepper and eggplants.

Grace brings this produce from Techiman, Bolgatanga (northern Ghana), or Bourkina Faso. Thus a major constraint on her business is transport cost. She wants therefore to secure the KIVA loan to beef up her capital and to augment the number of boxes she can bring on a trip.

loans.use: Capital for transport costs

loans.name: José Luís

texts.en:
Jose Luis is originally from Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, in the northern part of Mexico. Because of a lack of resources, he lives with his girlfriend, unmarried, Juana, and they have two small children who are 3 and 1 years old. He had a job working as a baker in the commercial centers for 6 years, and thanks to the experience he adquired, had the skills to open his own business, where he makes and sells baked goods, in order to be able to support his family and to offer a better quality of life to his children.

Luis' business has grown and the demand for his product is always increasing. To meet demand, he needs a loan of $550 which he will use to buy an oven which will increase production and to offer a better service to his customers. He will also buy supplies he needs for the business. You can be a fundamental part of the continued sucess of this business and the life of this family, please do not hesitate in your decision to help this family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

José Luís es originario de Monterrey, Nuevo León, al norte de México. Por falta de recursos, vive en unión libre con Juana, tienen dos pequeños hijos de 3 y 1 años. Él estuvo trabajando como panadero en centros comerciales durante 6 años, y gracias a la experiencia que adquirió, desde hace año y medio decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la elaboración y venta de donas, para obtener mejores recursos para el sustento de su familia y poder ofrecerle una mejor vida a sus hijos.

El negocio de Luís ha estado creciendo y cada ves se incrementa más la demanda, y para poder cubrirla necesita de un préstamo por $550 dólares que empleará en la compra de un horno de mayor capacidad con el que aumentará su producción y ofrecerá un mejor servicio, además de la compra de insumos que requiere para la elaboración de las donas. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: To purchase a furnace and supplies

loans.name: Twaha

texts.en:
Twaha is 26 years old and lives in the Mbagala area of Dar es Salaam. Twaha is a hawker. What differentiates him from other hawkers is that he buys different consumable items like razor blades, matches, sweets, sewing materials, pens, cosmetics and many other easily carried items, and then sells these items to shops located far from the city center. He sells these items in dozens and he does not sell them at retail; other hawkers sells at retail.

A competitive advantage for Twaha is that he identifies wholesale shops whose prices are lower. He usually takes orders from his clients before he buy the items. He said that he has been in this business for more than five years. He is ambitious about becoming a big wholesaler in his area one day. He is in need of USD 550 to replenish his stock.

loans.use: To purchase different consumables

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
"LAPO has given me voice," says Mrs. Rose O. whose business is stable and profitable. She sells gallons of oil and foodstuffs to people in the open-air market. Rose is 49, married, and has six children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

If she is accorded the loan of US$ 625, Rose intends to buy more gallons of oil and foodstuffs for sale. She has been a client of LAPO for 8 years and started her micro-business in 1987.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil and food stuffs for resale

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo is a 44-year-old father of four and a resident of Vituka. He has a hardware shop where he sells electrical goods. He has been doing business for the past ten years and now wants to open up another shop in the nearby trading center to reach more customers. He is in need of USD 1,075 to help him achieve this goal.

loans.use: Expand his business

loans.name: Emem

texts.en: Emem O. is 29 years old, married and has a child; she lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells drinks and cooked food at her restaurant. She has been in her business since the year 2003 and needs a loan to buy drinks and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drinks & foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Hameedan's Group

texts.en:
"My name is Hameedan A. M.. I am a widow and the mother of three sons and four daughters. My children had to quit their studies after their father’s death. I am a textile designer and I make embroidered bed sheets, cushions, etc. Two of my sons are turners and they requires a loan to buy a lathe (a tool used to turn objects).

My group members are: Sumaira F. and Humaira S., both of whom need a loan for their grocery stores; Farzana N. who requires a loan for their vegetable shop; and Amna S. who needs a loan to start up a grocery store for her son."

loans.use: Buy a lathe for my sons' business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Dr. B. is 51 years old and lives with her husband and four children. She is an obstetrian/gynacologist and manages the Milimani Martenity and Nursing home in Kisumu, Kenya. She was employed by the government for fourteen years right after she graduated from university. Dr. B. then opened her own private hospital in 2000, where she focused her efforts on building a larger out-patient facility. Besides general curative services and check-ups, her facility has a pharmacy, an x-ray machine, a laboratory, and maternal and child health services. Dr. B. attributes her success to hard work, perseverance, and assistance from KMET through three previous loans that have allowed her to expand the clinic, increase the number of services it offers, and improve the quality of care it provides. Dr. B. also carries a very good reputation from her many years of good work in Kisumu. Her practice continues to grow as she attracts more corporate clients as well as private patients. To further expand her healthcare facility and partly cover the costs of an ultra-sound machine, Dr. B. has applied for a loan of US$1,200.

loans.use: Cover a part of the cost of an ultra-sound machine

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
This humble lady's name is Aurelia; today we find her resting after an immense amount of weekend work. She sells cheese and meat at her city's fairs on saturdays and sundays; she collects the products during the week from adjoining towns which are famous for their product's great taste in her native Huancayo. In addition to this activity, she also occupies herself with the breeding and selling of pigs with the help of her two young sons who are still her dependents. Because she is the only source of income for her home, she spends long periods of time outside of the house at work, hoping to better the quality of life of her dear family. Aurelia asks for a loan to invest in purchasing a higher quantity of cheese and meat in order to sell in them full time from her humble home that she has been preparing for over time. Lets make her petition possible so that this humble mother can spend more time in the company of her dear children.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Ésta humilde mujer se llama Aurelia, ahora la encontramos descansando después de su inmenso trajín de fin de semana. Se dedica a la venta de quesos y carne en las ferias de su ciudad los días sábados y domingos, que recolecta durante la semana de los pueblitos aledaños famosos por el gran sabor de estos productos en su natal Huancayo.Adicionalmente a esta actividad se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerditos con ayuda de sus dos pequeños hijos que aún se encuentran bajo su protección, debido a que ella es el único sostén económico de su hogar permanece largos períodos de tiempo fuera de casa realizando sus acostumbradas actividades, con el deseo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su querida familia.Aurelia, solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad de quesos y carne a fin de ofertarlos de manera constante en un humilde espacio de su hogar que ha ido acondicionando con el tiempo. Posibilitemos su petición para que pronto esta humilde madre pueda permanecer más tiempo en compañía de sus queridos hijos.

loans.use: Increase capital to sell a greater quantity of cheese and meat on a full time basis from her home

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena Rancel started her business in order to cover school expenses for her three children. She was also struggling to cover family expenses, since her husband does not earn a fixed income, and she felt the need to contribute to the family earnings. For these reasons she began to sell shoes via catalogue to her relatives more than two years ago.

Now she is asking for a loan of $575 US that will be repaid in 6 months in order to purchase seasonal shoes and to expand her inventory so that she can further increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

María Elena R. emprendió su negocio dada la necesidad de solventar los gastos escolares de sus 3 hijos y además de no completar con el gasto familiar debido a que su esposo no tiene un ingreso fijo y ella sentía la necesidad de contribuir con estos gastos. Fue así como inicio con la venta zapatos por catalogo entre sus familiares hace mas de 2 años.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar zapatos de temporada y aumentar el inventario para con ello poder incrementar mis ventas

loans.use: To purchase shoes

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer M. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 27 years old, married, and has one thee year old child. In 2007, Jennifer established a soap production business. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan of $575 in order to buy additional soap ingredients facilities of production.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for soap production.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is 41 years old and she has a grade 2 education. She has 5 sons and 4 daughters and they are all behind her. Two of her daughters are currently studying. She speaks Aymara and Spanish.

She started her business buying and selling chuno (freeze-dried potatoes), potatoes, and fava beans at the markets in Yungoyo and Tacna. When she got married she started a business selling batteries, sugar, rice, and clothing - buying from the town of Desaguadero and selling them in the city of Tacna.

To expand her business she became a member of the Community Bank Progreso Caluyo in the community fo Villa Santa Rosa in the Sekakatani sector in the district and province of Yunguyo. She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for faive years now and she is very grateful. She has a staqnd in Jr. Atahualpa in front of the market at 15 Agosto in the city of Yunguyo.

With the loan of S/2,500 she will purchase fruit such as grapes, pears, apples and tomatoes. This loan will be repaid in full in 6 months.

She feels very happy that she has been able to make it through united with her family and with the help of the loan that ahs been grated to her. She is also given the ability to vary her business, taking advantage of the opportunities to improve the business and improve her earnings. Her greatest dream is to purchase a plot of land in Yunguyo where she can build a larger grocery store so that she can carry all kinds of products that are necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Margarita tiene 41 años de edad estudió hasta segundo de primaria, tiene 05 hijos y 04 hijas todas están a su lado, de los cuales están estudiando 2 mujeres. Ella habla aymara y castellano. Ella emprendió el negocio de compra y venta de chuño negro y blanco, papa, habas en las ferias de Yunguyo y Tacna, cuando ya tuvo su pareja amplió su negocio de venta de pilas, azúcar, arroz y ropas de vestir comprando de Desaguadero y llevando a la ciudad de Tacna. Para ampliar su negocio se asoció, al Banco Comunal Progreso Caluyo de la comunidad de Villa Santa Rosa de sector Sakakatani del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo. Ella ya viene trabajando hace cinco años con Manuela Ramos y está muy agradecida Tiene puesto ubicado en Jr. Atahualpa al frente del mercado 15 de Agosto de la ciudad de Yunguyo Con el préstamo de S/ 2,500.00 comprara frutas como: uva, pera, manzana y tomate. Este préstamo lo cancelara en 6 meses Se encuentran muy felices porque les ha permitido sobresalir y luchar unidos en la familia con el préstamo que tienen, además les permite variar, aprovechar los tiempos y oportunidades de negocio mejorando sus ingresos. Su sueño más grande es comprar terreno en Yunguyo y tener una tienda grande de abarrotes que contenga todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad.

loans.use: With the funds from the loan she will purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Thi Bao

texts.vi:
Mrs. V. Thi Bao, 35 years old, has 3 school-going children. Before joining the TYM Fund, she stayed at home to raise livestock and take care of the children, thus her family relied mainly on her husband's income. Therefore, they faced many difficulties. She joined the Fund in 1995 and borrowed loans to start a business. She used the first few loans to get used to doing business by selling fresh bamboo shoot. After 10 years of membership, she now has a small shop selling foodstuffs in the market. Besides managing the shop, she also works for various local processed-meat production companies so her family's income is very stable. Her husband works as a driver, earning 3,000,000VND (about 193USD) per month. Her children can all go to school. This time, she would like to borrow 19,000,000VND (1,150USD) to invest in her food shop. Her family's monthly income is 7,000,000VND (about 451USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Bảo năm nay 35 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có 3 con đang tuổi đi học. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương chị chỉ ở nhà chăn nuôi và chăm sóc con cái, thu nhập của gia đình chủ yếu dựa vào lương của chồng do đó gặp không ít khó khăn. Năm 1995 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để bắt đầu công việc kinh doanh. Những vòng vốn đầu chị đã sử dụng để làm quen với công việc kinh doanh bằng việc buôn bán măng tươi. Sau 10 năm tham gia Quỹ hiện nay chị có một cửa hàng nhỏ kinh doanh thực phẩm tại chợ. Ngoài thời gian bán hàng tại chợ chị còn đi làm thuê cho các lò sản xuất giò chả tại địa phương vì vậy thu nhập của gia đình chị rất ổn định. Chồng chị hiện đang làm công việc lái xe thuê cho thu nhập 3.000.000/ tháng. Vì thế kinh tế gia đình chị hiện tại rất ổn định các con của chị đều được đầu tư cho ăn học đầy đủ. Vòng vốn này chị mong muốn được vay 19.000.000 đ để thêm vốn đầu tư vào cửa hàng thực phẩm. Thu nhập hiện tại của chị là 7.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in selling foods

loans.name: Najminisso

texts.en:
Najminisso A.  lives in Kairakkum in Tajikistan. She is a single mother but she is full of enthusiasm and readiness to work hard to ensure her children a good and happy future. She works in a dining hall and she is a qualified cook. She has specialized education and knows how to make a lot of national dishes and other dishes. She is very polite and many people come her dining hall to eat.

Mrs. A.  is applying to KIVA for help in the form of a business development loan of 2800 STJ for 5 months for purchasing new equipment  and modernizing her workplace.

loans.use: purchasing new equipment, etc.

loans.name: Celine

texts.en:
33-year-old Celine Fointain lives in Cameroon's North West Province and is hoping to take out her third business loan.
Celine runs a small but successful food stall near the centre of Bamenda, a medium-sized town in the country's Anglophone west.

She intends to spend the money buying three sacks of rice, a large bag of beans, groundnuts (fresh peanuts), sugar, soap, washing powder, and firewood. She will also invest in a drum of palm oil. Unrefined palm oil is a deep orange colour and rich in flavour and nutrients.  It is the most important oil used in Cameroonian cooking and forms the basis of many dishes. 

Celine is married with six children, five of whom are school age. She is happy that previous business profits have allowed her to pay school fees and buy study books. As well as continuing her children's education, she hopes to eventually buy some land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy food supplies for re-sale

loans.name: Riziki's Tuwe Na Moyo Group

texts.en:
Riziki is 24 years old. She is married with 1 child 5 years old. She has been running her own salon since 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Riziki is now looking for a loan to buy more salon items to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Fatma.

loans.use: To buy more salon items to expand her business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda N. es una dama que se dedica con gran esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de productos lácteos como queso, cuajada y crema los cuales son comercializados en el municipio de Chichigalpa en el mercado municipal.

Desde hace 12 años que inició el negocio ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida propias y ha alcanzado salir adelante junto con su familia ya que anteriormente solamente era ama de casa y no se dedicaba a ninguna actividad. Es por este motivo que son sus sueños continuar creciendo en el negocio y convertirse en una gran comerciante en el mercado de Chichigalpa de donde es originaria.

Este es el motivo por el cual ha venido a Ceprodel esperando que el crédito le sea otorgado y así mejorar en su negocio que tanto le ha costado.
texts.en:
Yolanda N. is a lady who puts great effort in her business. She sells dairy products like cheese, curd and cream, and markets them in the local market in the town of Chichigalpa.

Since she started her business twelve years ago, Yolanda has succeeded in improving her living conditions and has reached success together with her family. Previously, she was only a housewife and not engaged in any business activities. It is for this reason that her dreams are to continue growing her business and to become a major trader in the market of Chichigalpa, where she is originally from.

This is the reason she has come to Ceprodel, in hopes that she will be granted a loan and thus be able to improve her business that has cost her so much.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Anta Mbaye

texts.fr: Cette dame agée de 55 ans  mere huit (08) enfant est veuve .Elle vit avec ses enfants et petits enfants .Pour survenir à ses besoins ;elle fait de la broderie à la main en fabriquant des draps de lit qu 'elle vend  aux femmes du quartier depuis le decé de son marie il y a trois (3) ans.Dans le cadre  du renforcement de ses activités ,elle a déjà bénéficié d'un premier de la caisse .Le pret sollicité  aujourd'hui lui permettra de satisfaire  à la livraison d'une commande de draps faite par une association de femmes du quartier.
texts.en:
This woman, age 55, is a mother with eight children and a widow. She lives with her children and grand-children. To provide for their needs, she does embroidery by hand and makes bedsheets that she has been selling to women of the district since her husband's death three years ago. In regards to bolstering her business, she has already been the recipient of an initial bank loan. The loan she is requesting today will enable her to deliver on an order of bedsheets made for a women's association in the district.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating funds

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Frida M., a 26-year-old woman from Mwanza. She is married and has two children, who are both 3 years old.

Frida M. has been running a stationary business since 2006. The stationary sales business allows micro-entrepreneurs to demonstrate their business savvy; to illustrate, most such entrepreneurs place their shops, stalls, or tables strategically close to post offices, banks, schools, and universities in order to generate as much income as possible. She works at her business 12 hours per day and 6 days per week. By doing so, Frida is able to earn approximately $300 per month from her business operations. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $425 in order to buy a printer and additional paper to better meet her customers' demands. In the future, she plans to increase her inventory of stationary. Frida thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services. Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her. As such, one of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To meet customer demand by purchasing a printer and additional paper

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Las Entusiastas (“The Enthusiasts”) Village Bank. She is a 34-year-old single mother of one child. Ana is a sales executive for the Esika cosmetics line. She is in charge of sales for a specific area and supervises 60 salespeople; she earns a fixed monthly income. Ana also owns a motorcycle taxi, which she rents out to a driver. Ana needs a loan of 1500 soles for motorcycle maintenance. Ana dreams of finishing construction on her home, of having her own investment capital, and of continuing to work. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas. Ana es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijos y 34 años, Ana es ejecutiva de ventas de cosméticos de la línea Esika, Ana es encargada de las ventas de una zona en el cual tiene 60 vendedoras a su cargo, por lo cual recibe un sueldo. Además Ana tiene una mototaxi que alquila. Ana necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento de su mototaxi. Ana sueña con terminar de construir su casa, tener capital propio y seguir trabajando.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana D. is 30 years old. She is divorced but has one child, a boy who is currently in the basic school. She lives with the child in a rented apartment in Koforidua, a small town not very far from Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. It is entirely a farming and commercial town. Christiana works very hard to take care of her child. She trades in bananas and oranges. Fruit selling is a business run by many women in the community. She buys bags of oranges and unripe banana from farmers in the nearby villages, stores the banana until ripe and then sells them. She sells to retailers in her community in the local market. She at times resorts to other types of fruits. Christiana has been in business for over ten years. It has been her dreams to save enough money to support her child in school. She wants a loan to procure banana and oranges in bulk to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To procure bananas and oranges to sell.

loans.name: Mt. Rungwe Group

texts.en:
Stella M., age 36, is married with two children ages 17 and 11. She sells food at Mbagala. She started this business in 2006 and works daily from 6am until 12pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 258.

This will be Stella’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock and started selling pork and has repaid the loans successfully. She now hopes for a fourth loan to pay her children's school fees.

Stella will share this loan with her loan group, Mt. Rungwe, which totals 16 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Stella is 1st on the right with a red cap.

loans.use: School Fees

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en: Moeurn S., 30, lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband and two young children. She works as a farmer, making US$1 a day, and is supported by her husband. He works in construction, making US$4.2 a day.  In light of these times of economic difficulties, Moeurn S. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase fertilizer to expand her cultivation. She is an ambitious entrepreneur who one day hopes to set up a grocery store in front of her home. She sees this loan as a way to increase her income and is confident that her business venture will be successful.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Becky

texts.en: Becky is 35 years old and is a married mother of five children. She sells foodstuffs such as rice, beans, tomato paste, etc., and has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of 140 000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She sends her thanks to everyone who makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rona Group

texts.en:
Rona is the group leader of the Rona group. There are four members in this group. Each member of the group has a business that will benefit from this loan. The money will be used to purchase materials for these local businesses.

Rona's loan will provide necessary materials for her business of carpet weaving. Shapaeray wants a loan for her business of carpet weaving. Nasema and Gull Shan want to take loans for their business of bead-working.

They are all very happy with this opportunity to borrow money in Afghanistan. With this loan, they can collectively expand their businesses and make a better future for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Fathullo

texts.ru: Саидов Фатхулло житель района Рудаки. Возраст 28 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. Работает водителем камаза в частной фирме. Живет с родителями  , семья большая. Поэтому он так же  занимается торговлей детской одежды. На рынке торгует его жена. Товар привозит Фатхулло сам из города Душанбе. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en:
Fathullo S. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 28 years old, is married and has two children. He works as a dump truck (KAMAZ) driver at a private firm. He lives with his parents, the family is large. This is why he also sells children’s clothing. His wife trades at the market. Fathullo brings the products himself from the city of Dushanbe. He plans to get credit in order to increase turnover.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 31 years old and is married to Enrico C. who works as a house carpenter and drives tricycle transport. Nora is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 for the maintenance of the motorcycle and to maintain their daily income.

Nora has four children. Jenalyn is 18 years old and did not pursue her college studies because of a lack of money and is now working in Cavite as a factory worker. Jenevelyn is 15 years old and a high school senior student. Rajar Jhon is 12 years old and a high school sophomore. Enrico C. Jr. is 9 years old and in grade four.

Nora keeps doing her best to continue to provide her children with their needs for their studies. She hopes that someday in the future they will be able to start a new business but for now they must earn as much as they can with the tricycle.

loans.use: Motorcycle Maintenance

loans.name: Surayo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 



Сурайё Абдуллоева имеет 4 летний стаж работы в предпринимательской деятельности, Сурайе торгует на рынке, продает пищевые продукты (сахар, различные виды круп, и зерновые продукты)  Товар ей привозит муж Уктам. 
 Сурайе хочет расширить ассортимент своего товара и поэтому запрашивает сумму в размере 2000 сомони. На эту сумму она хочет купить 60 кг  гороха, и продавать ее вместе с другими товарами.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Surayo A. has four years of experience in retail business. She sells food products on the market such as sugar and different kinds of cereals. Surayo wants to increase the assortment of her goods and this is why is asking for a loan for 2,000 somoni. She wants to buy 60 kilograms of peas and sell it together with other goods.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 60 kilograms of peas

loans.name: Kalisizo South Namujuzi Josephine Group

texts.en: Josephine N. is 32 years old and the single mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She also cares for a younger sister who is still in school. For the last 10 years, she has made a living buying and selling bananas. She is applying for this loan to to buy bananas in bulk for reasle to her customers. Josephine is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: To buy bananas in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Farid

texts.en:
This young man, Farid, was born in 1988. He lives in Baku city. This single man has three years of experience in the clothing-sales business. 

Farid plans to also sell foodstuffs and juices. He does not want to sell only clothes. This man thinks that if he varies his goods, he can get more income and that is why he applies for the loan of 2,000 AZN.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Hakik

texts.en: B. Hakik is a dynamic and ambitious 50-year-old woman. She is married and has three children. For three years, Hakik has had a small business processing and drying apricots. Thanks to the quality of her products and the experience she gained in this sphere of business, she has earned a solid reputation among her customers. Accordingly, the demand for her goods has grown, allowing her to contribute significantly to the household. Now, Hakik requests 900 USD to spend on purchasing apricots which she will dry and resell. She hopes that she will continue sending her children to school so that they will be able to get an adequate education. She expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more apricots to dry and sell

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: bineta N. est parent beneficiaire et evolue dans la vente de draps de lit depuis sept ans.elle sollicite un credit de cent mille(100 000)frs pour diversifier ses articles afin de satisfaire sa clientele.avec son activite elle soutient son ,ari a entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Bineta N. is a recipient parent and has been developing her sales of bedding for seven years. She’s requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to diversify her merchandise in order to satisfy her customers. With her business, she supports her husband in taking care ofr her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Constance

texts.fr: Z. Constance est née le 22/10/1978 au Niger, un pays voisin du Bénin. Constance est mariée et mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Constance habite dans la maison de son père à Fifadji un quartier de Cotonou. Constance est allée à l’école mais n’a pas fini le cours primaire. C’est la couture que Constance a fini par apprendre comme métier. Cependant Constance n’a exercé ce métier que pour quelques années. C’est au commerce que Constance s’est finalement donnée. Constance avait vendu de la nourriture devant sa maison. Mais aujourd’hui, c’est des céréales, le maïs en particulier que Constance vend. Constance a eu déjà trois crédits de ALIDé pour ses activités. Constance sollicite ce quatrième prêt pour renforcer son fonds de roulement et accroître son activité de céréales.
texts.en:
Z. Constance was born on October 22, 1978 in Niger, a country neighboring Benin. She is married and the mother of two children who are both in school. She lives in her father’s house in Fifadji, a district of Cotonou. Constance attended school but did not finish primary school. Sewing is what she finally learned as her trade. Yet she worked in this trade for only a few years and finally came to devote all her time to commerce. She used to sell food in front of her house. But today, it’s grains, corn in particular. Constance has already had three different ALIDé business loans. She’s requesting this fourth loan for bolstering her working capital and for growing her business in grains.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy four 100-kg sacks of corn

loans.name: Mrs. Vorn Sok Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of six people who all live in Smaong Village in Takeo province. Mrs. Vorn S. is the group leader.

Mrs. Vorn S. is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare (5-acre) field on which she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Phan Thob, is a duck breeder. In this business, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy duck food to feed his ducks. Thus, Mrs. Vorn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy duck food for her husband’s business.

Mrs. Vorn S. is 37 years old and is the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the other one stays at home to help the parents with housework.

loans.use: To buy duck food for her husband's business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married to Rex and they were blessed with four children. The couple is living in Bacnor East, Burgos, Isabela, with their children. They are managing a simple business, which is a vehicle-repair shop that serves to provide for the educational needs of their children. Her dreams is for her children to finish their studies for she believes that education is the key to progress. She is glad that aside from their repair shop, her husband is also managing a farm for an alternative source of income.  

She is now in need of additional capital for the maintenance of her repair-shop business. For this, she is asking for a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders. The loan will greatly help her to maintain their small repair shop.

loans.use: Additional capital for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario N. is 46 years old, and her partner now is Eugenio Garcia, 58 years old, with whom she has found true happiness. They were blessed with one child, Mark Lester, 12 years old. From her former unsuccessful marriage, she has two children, Rose Anne, 20 years old, and Rogelyn, 16 years old, for whom she is still responsible.

One source of their income comes from the salary of Eugenio, working as a foreman carpenter. The three children are currently studying so creating more expenses, especially her two older children who are in college. Rosario helps Eugenio in providing for their family through the income from buying and selling various frozen foods. Sometimes she sells some beauty products, and also offers her customers pedicures or manicures, treatment for their hair, a spa for their feet, and facial treatments.

Her 7th loan from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) is will be used in buying what is needed for these businesses: frozen foods and beauty products and for her other business, nail polish, things used in treating hair, face, and feet. She is sure after buying all this, she will get a big boost in income because these are all the things that help her in improving her businesses.

The education of her children is her priority in life, so she will do everything to make her businesses grow. One dream of hers is to have a beauty salon where they live so she can always afford the educational expenses of her children.

loans.use: To finance all her businesses

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia L. is from the village of Talakag , Bukidnon. She is 49 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Lilia owns and operates a business buying and selling different vegetables around the village. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Lilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 37 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Juan, de 38 años; y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado Las Mercedes (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella se dedica a la venta de papayas, las cuales su esposo trae desde la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado (ciudad que limita con el país de Brasil). Su puesto es muy concurrido, pues las papayas que vende son frescas y muy jugosas, lo cual ha hecho que tenga muchos clientes.
Lo que más le gusta a Luz de su negocio es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, ya que así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de venta, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto sin poder salir a ningún lado. Espera que con el tiempo su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos.

Este es el noveno préstamo de Luz con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otros créditos posteriormente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Los dos mil soles que ahora solicita los invertirá en la compra de más papayas, para así implementar mejor la mercadería de su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz, 37, is a very hard-working woman who lives with her husband, Juan, 38, in their own home. Her greatest desire is to improve their quality of life. She sells papayas in the Las Mercedes (Juliaca's most important market) market. Her husband brings the papayas from the city of Puerto Maldonado (a city on the Brazilian border). Her stand is very popular because her papayas are fresh and juicy and this has attracted many customers. What Luz most likes about her job is being able to chat with her fellow merchants because that makes the long work days much more pleasant. She has been in this line of work for 8 years and considers the most difficult part of it having to stay at her post all day long not being able to go out anywhere. She hopes that, in time, her business will grow and produce better earnings. This is Luz's 9th loan with MFP. She knows that she must make all her repayments on time if she wants to have access to future loans and she is willing to do so. The 2000 soles requested will be used to buy more papayas in order to have better selection of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is fifty-one years old. She is married and has four children who are all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coast in the western region of Ghana and fishing is the major occupation of the people there.

Grace is a trader. She trades food items such as maize, cassava, etc. She buys these items from nearby communities and treks to sell them in other nearby towns. She has been a trader for ten years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food items to trade

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en: Leizel C. is from the village of Biasong. She is 29 years old and is married. Leizel owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Leizel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Penda Aliou

texts.fr: Penda Aliou KÂ est âgée de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants . Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SIWAL depuis 2 ans et a eu à y bénéficié de 4 prêts qu'elle a remboursés. Avec son prêt elle développe un petit élevage de bœufs et de moutons et les bénéfices issus de son activité lui permettent d'aider à la prise en charge familiale et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Penda Aliou KÂ is 38 years old, married and has six children. She has been a member of the village bank in SIWAL for two years and has had four loans which she has repaid. With her loan she is building up a small beef and sheep rearing business and the profits from her activity will allow her to help taking care of her family and to boost her savings.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening her self-financing capacity

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Antonio V. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo a poner el techo en una parte de su casa. 
Nuevamente esta solicitando su cooperación para este nuevo crédito, para colocar el techo de madera en mejor condición  poner el techo en la otra parte de la cocina y salas de la casa.
Planea pagar el crédito con una partes del ingreso es el que obtiene de árbitro en un campo de deportes, ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Antonio V. is grateful for your cooperation in the previous loan. It helped him put a roof over a part of his house. He is asking for your cooperation again for this new loan to place a wooden roof in better condition; to put on a roof on the other part of the kitchen and rooms of the house. He plans on paying for the loan with parts of his income he receives as a referee at the sports field. This is his family's source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of the wooden roof

loans.name: Chorn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chorn K. is a villager from Rumchek village, Takeo province. She is 48 years old and the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by AMK, a Kiva partner. With the loans, they will buy supplies, equipment and other items for different purposes.
 
Mrs. Chorn K. is a farmer and also a silk weaver who receives a small income to support her family. For the silk-weaving business, she wants to take a loan of 600,000 Riel from AMK to buy more silk to support her business activities. Mrs. Chorn K. is a widow with three children, one of whom is a seamstress, while another is a silk weaver and the last one is a student in the public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “CAMINO AL EXITO”, actualmente se encuentra en el IV ciclo y esta conformado por 14 personas trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la provincia D. Cusco del departamento Cusco.  Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su Centro Histórico, sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora D. la Región Sur del país. 

Las actividades económicas D. los socios a las que se dedican son el comercio como por ejemplo venta D. comestibles, venta D. comida, venta D. golosinas, venta D. ropa, venta D. leña, venta D. artesanía, venta D. bebidas alcohólicas y venta D. útiles escolares y otros brindan servicios D. transporte y servicio D. cocina. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos D. funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios D. crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo D. permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto D. valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad D. capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Hirazema es socia del banco comunal Camino al Éxito, tiene 39 años D. edad, es soltera y aun no tiene hijos. La socia trabaja en la ONG  “Bartolomé D. las Casas” en la ciudad del Cusco como consejera D. limpieza, su labor como empleada empieza a las 7am hasta las 9am y D. 5pm hasta 7:30pm todos los días. Hirazema es una mujer emprendedora que tiene un pequeño negocio D. confección D. ropa D. lana como por ejemplo chompas, ponchos, chalinas y chulos. La socia requiere el crédito D. los 600 soles para comprar 100 madejas D. lana.
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Camino al Exito” (Road to Success) is currently starting its fourth loan cycle and consists of 14 hardworking individuals who view each moment as an opportunity to get ahead. Through their daily efforts, they are able to proviD. a better future for their children. The members of the Communal Bank live in the Province and Department of Cusco. Cusco is a city known for its Historical Center, its landscapes, and its history for being one of the most enchanting cities in the southern part of the country.

The business activities of the members incluD. selling groceries, food, candy, clothing, firewood, handicrafts, alcoholic beverages, school supplies, or services such as transportation and catering. The Communal Bank has participated in various loan cycles and the members are content and satisfied with the loans, savings, and training sessions. One ongoing aspect of the Communal Bank that is of value is the group savings account that opens the possibility for building up assets, which is what this service provides.

Hirazema is a member of the Communal Bank “Camino al Exito”. She is 39 years old, single, and does not have children. She works for the NGO “Bartolomé D. las Casas” in the city of Cusco as a janitor. Her cleaning duties are performed between 7am to 9am and from 5pm to 7:30pm every day. Hirazema is an enterprising woman who has a small business producing clothing maD. of wool such as sweaters, ponchos, scarves, and caps. She is requesting a loan of 600 PEN in order to buy 100 skeins of wool.

The members are grateful for this opportunity and commit to making their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy S. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 30 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Mercy owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling dried fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Mercy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 7th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with a teenage son. She is an entrepreneur from Beregovo where she sells children’s clothing merchandise in the local market called “Image”.

Irina is very customer-friendly and polite with all of her clients. She has been in this business for six years. Currently, Irina has 22,000 Grivnyas in inventory and her profit amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas a month.

Irina is requesting a 3,500 Grivnya loan to purchase additional merchandise. Her business is constantly growing and she can hardly handle the high demand she’s facing now. She realizes that lending services are very helpful to her business, as loans allow her to increase her turnover capital and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Juan Alberto forma parte del banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA”, tiene 45 años, es conviviente y tiene cuatro hijos. Juan Alberto trabaja en una empresa donde producen tejas y ladrillos y su esposa trabaja vendiendo papas en el mercado de Huancaro de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que trabajan en el negocio de venta de papas y les va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en el trabajo. 

Juan Alberto es un joven trabajador y emprendedor que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un  mejor futuro a sus hijos, el requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar más semillas. 
           
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente. La comunidad de Inquilpata se encuentra a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto, 45, is a member of “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” (Virgin Mary of Inquilpata) communal bank; he lives with his partner and their four children. Juan Alberto works for a firm that manufactures bricks and ceiling tiles; his wife works as a potato merchant in Cusco’s Huancaro market. They have been potato farmers for quite some time now and they do well thanks to the effort they put into their work. Juan Alberto is a hard-working, enterprising young man who is always looking for ways to provide the best for his family and to get ahead in life through his own daily efforts. He needs funds to buy more seed. He is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion. Inquilpata is an hour and 10 minutes away from the city of Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina C. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 50 years old, married, and has 6 school-aged children. Carolina owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling a variety of fish in the local community. Carolina has been involved in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Carolina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carolina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Carolina is requesting a new loan, her 8th, of 7,000 PHP, which will be used for house repair and additional capital for her fishing business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for house repair and additional capital for her fishing business

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin S. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Jasmin is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jasmin owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Jasmin is just starting this business.

In 2006, Jasmin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jasmin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jasmin is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Jasmin from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr: K. Pierrette est née le 29 Juin 1974 et est marié à AGUINDE Gilbert, un tailleur. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à leur charge.
